loans.name: Islomjon

texts.en:
Islomjon supports his parents with a small business selling men’s and women’s clothing. He operates from a little space at the central market in Dushanbe, Tajikistan, where he maintains a nice variety of clothing to choose from. Islomjon has been in business for 3 years. With good quality products and affordable prices, he has developed a solid customer base, and his business continues to grow. Islomjon has requested a loan to increase his working capital and allow him to purchase new inventory. This loan will help Islomjon be prepared for the busy summer season so he can maximize his profits and provide for his family.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing of the new clothing for selling

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita A. is 35 years old. She is married and blessed with three children. Two of them go to school. Her husband works as a miner in the traditional way and sometimes in farming. Nenita wants to help her husband in providing all their needs even in just a simple way. She entered into a business preparing snacks (like fried bananas) and peddles them near the pamilingan where all traditional gold miners do their work, and around the village where she already has her usual customers.

Nenita now is applying for loan from HSPFI, a KIVA partner. The money that will be released to her will be used to purchase enough bananas for her business, part will be spend for the enrollment of her children in school, and the rest for the needs of the family. Nenita is optimistic about all her plans for her business and her family.

loans.use: Bananas for chip production; school fees; family expenses

location.town: Tuburan, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en: Mary Grace H. is 33 years old and a mother of three children. They live in Canitoan, Baungon, Bukidnon. Her husband farms cassava and corn as their primary products. Since farming is seasonal and Mary wants to earn a daily income, she engaged in a sari-sari (variety) store business to support the needs of the family. She wants it to expand and needs additional money to procure additional stock for the variety store. She is now applying for a loan with HSPFI, a Kiva partner. Mary is hoping for a positive response to her request.

loans.use: Will be used to purchase addtional items for the variety store

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena S. is a 50-year-old woman. She is married and the mother of four children but only one is currently in school. Through hard work, Abena has provided support for her first three kids' education. She is a food vendor who has sold banku in her neighborhood for the past 18 years. Banku is prepared from milled maize grains. It is cooked and taken with hot pepper, gravy stew or any kind of soup and fried fish or meat. She has many customers since many Ghanaians enjoy banku as breakfast, lunch and supper.

She wants to use the loan to buy more ingredients like bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood. She hopes to raise more income to support her child to enter teacher-training college. She is a member of a community group called “Mo din mmo” (hard work) Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another and provide assistance to one another in handling repayment of the loan.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients like maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood

loans.name: Gulnora

texts.ru: Кулдашева Гулнора-женщина 42-х лет,замужем,имеет 2-х детей. Вместе со своим мужем Азимовым Баходуром она на протяжении 10 лет занимается откормом и купля-продажей скота.Её муж покупает млодых бычков на скотном рынке за низкую цену.Гулнора откармливает их дома и на пастбище 3 или 4 месяца,затем продает мясникам по хорошей цене.Таким образом она вносит свой вклад в семейный бюджет.Кроме того её муж зарабатывает таксистом.
texts.en:
Gulnora K. is a 42-year-old woman, who is married and has two children. For the past ten years, she and her husband Bahodur Azimov have raised and traded in cattle. Her husband purchases young steers at the cattle market for a low price. Gulnora fattens them for three or four months at home and in the pasture, and then sells them to the butchers for a good price. This is her way of contributing to the family finances. In addition, her husband earns a living as a taxi driver.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

loans.name: Percy

texts.en: Percy A. is 49 years old and resides in Lingating Baungon, Bukidnon. She has two children who both go to school. Her husband is engaged in the buying and selling of livestock. Even though they have her husband's income, she choose to put up a variety store to have extra earnings. Percy is applying for a loan with HSPFI, a Kiva partner, to purchase additional goods because she want to expand her store and make it better. Percy is hoping for improvement of her business with the assistance of the organization.

loans.use: Purchase addtional items for her variety store

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila O. is a resident of Talairon, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental. Her husband works as motor-cab driver and earns only a meager income. She registered as a regular member of Paglaum MPC, a Kiva partner, in August 2006. She is very responsible with her weekly obligations such as savings, share capital and insurance. She has begun a “sari-sari” (general variety) store business. In need of capital, she reached Paglaum for her project and applied for a loan of PHP 25,000.

She is very thankful to Paglaum as her financing partner. She looks forward to seeing her sari-sari store become successful.

loans.use: to buy additional merchandise for "sari-sari" store business

loans.name: Reine

texts.fr: Cette dame est une résidente du quartier de Zanguéra, un quartier  de la ville de Lomé, depuis la mort de son mari elle a la charge de ses 02 enfants, l’activité qu’elle exerce est la vente de volailles plus précisément les poules. Elle fait ce commerce depuis 2001, ce qui fait qu’elle maîtrise ce secteur d’activité. En période de fête, elle vend plus et réalise de bons chiffres d’affaire. Les poules dont elle dispose actuellement ne lui permettent pas de satisfaire sa clientèle raison pour laquelle elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter 80 poules de race différentes.
texts.en:
This lady is a resident of the Zanguéra district, a neighborhood of the city of Lomé. Since the death of her husband, she is solely responsible for their 2 children. Her business is selling hens. She has been in this business since 2001, so she is very familiar with it. During holiday periods, she sells more and has a good turnover. The hens she presently has will not permit her to satisfy the needs of her clientele, which is why she has asked WAGES for a loan to buy 80 chickens of various breeds.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of hens for re-sale

loans.name: Epefania

texts.en:
Epefania T. lives in Tubod, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is sixty-one years old and married with eleven children. Her husband drives a “habal-habal” (a motorcycle without a cab used to transport people). Her husband's income is not enough to provide for all of this big family's daily needs. They would like to buy pump boat motor for their small boat, which will be used for fishing.  (A pump boat is a small racing boat.)
 
Epefania has been a member of Kiva's field partner, Paglaum Coop, since June of 2005.  She has already received several loans from them. Today, she is asking for a loan to buy a pump boat motor. She wants to save for a better future.

loans.use: To buy a pump boat motor for her fishing boat

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine A. is from the town of Lopez Jaena. She is forty years old and married with one grown child. To make a living, Josephine owns and operates a business manufacturing and selling clay products to local businesses and community members.  Josephine has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately $50 a month for these activities.

In 2008, Josephine joined PMPC, a Kiva field partner, to gain access to financial services that would enable her to engage in business activities and thereby improve her living situation. She has successfully repaid previous loans which were used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. Josephine is requesting a new loan that will again be used to buy raw materials. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Josephine from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model).

loans.use: To buy raw materials to make clay products.

loans.name: Letty

texts.en: Letty A. is forty-six years old and married with a grown child who is a Theology graduate. Her husband is a successful farmer who helped her in raising their family. They grow corn on their piece of land. Since she has only the one son, she prefers that he stay with her. She is determined to improve their standard of living. Even though they have their farm she still became involved in her ready-to-wear business. She peddles around her village to her usual customers, selling on both cash and credit terms. Letty is certain that she can save her profits to use for her family's needs and expenses.  Letty is applying for a loan to expand her business, which will include having her own stall so that she will not have to peddle in the village. Letty is optimistic that her plans will be finalized.

loans.use: To buy addtional ready-to-wear items to sell.

loans.name: Akouwa

texts.fr: Divorcée de son époux et ayant un enfant à sa charge, cette femme s’est lancée en 2007 dans le commerce de produits cosmétiques. C’est avec le revenu de son activité qu’elle subvient aux charges de son enfant et à ses propres charges. Elle fait son commerce de façon ambulante, sa clientèle grandit de jour en jour, pour pouvoir les satisfaire convenablement elle a besoin d’agrandir son stock de marchandises. C’est pour cette raison qu’elle s’adresse à WAGES pour demander son premier crédit afin d’acheter divers produits cosmétiques.
texts.en:
Divorced from her spouse and with a child in her care, this lady began selling cosmetics in 2007. With the income from this little business she supports herself and her child. She sells her cosmetics door to door, and her clientele is always growing. In order to satisfy their needs appropriately, she has to expand her stock of merchandise. That is the reason why she has come to WAGES to request her first loan so as to buy various cosmetics for her business inventory.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of cosmetics for re-sale

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en: Carmelita B. is fifty years old and a widow with two children. She lives in Talairon, Oroquieta City. Being a single parent is not easy for Carmelita. She works hard in order to survive and to meet the needs of her family. Her primary source of income is from a "sari-sari" store (general store). In order for her to expand her business, she joined the Kiva field partner, Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative, in June of 2000 to gain additional working capital. Carmelita is thankful to Paglaum because her financial need was answered. Now, she is asking for a loan to buy canned goods and other basic commodities to sell. She is looking forward to a comfortable life ahead.

loans.use: To buy goods for her general store.

loans.name: Ligaya

texts.en:
Ligaya M. is from the town of Mohon, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is thirty-two years old and married with two school-age children. To make a living, Ligaya owns and operates a general store in the community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately $125 a month for these activities.

In 2004, Ligaya joined the Kiva field partner, PMPC, to gain access to financial services that would enable her to engage in business activities and thereby improve her living situation.  She has successfully repaid previous loans from PMPC. These loans were used to purchase additional products to sell, and the new loan she is requesting will be used for the same purpose. This will be her fifth loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Felina

texts.en: Mrs. Felina T. is a thirty-six year old woman and married with four children. When her husband retired from the Philippine Army she decided to venture into a business as a new source of income to support and provide for the needs of her children. She succeeded and opened up a "sari-sari store" (mini grocery store). Next, she planned to open a "carenderia" or eatery as her additional income but due to financial problems, she knew that her plan could not come into reality. She decided to borrow PHP 30,000 from Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative. With this she has enough money to venture into business, and with the skills in managing a business that she already has, she knows her business will prosper and she can secure the future of her children - especially in their education.

loans.use: To open an eatery

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: “Torta” (a native cupcake made of flour and baked through “pugon”) is a delicious and famous delicacy of Misamisnon.  Mrs. Betty C., who is 55 years old, married and lives at Panaon, Misamis Occidental, bakes these at home. She started making “Torta”  while she was still in her 30’s. She sells them to the public market, carenderia, canteens & community stores. The “torta” sales are a great help to her family especially in raising her 3 children. Betty started the business with an initial capital of PHP 500. Her husband is a tricycle driver.  In preparation for her daughter’s education for college, she would like to earn more, so she wants to expand her business. So, she asks for a loan of PHP 30,000 as additional capital for their business expansion.

loans.use: to buy flour & ingredients for "torta" making

loans.name: Rosenda

texts.en:
Rosenda T. is from the village of Clarin. She is 54 years old. Rosenda is married and has 3 adult-aged children. To make a living, Rosenda owns and operates a business in the agriculture sector raising livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale. Rosenda has been engaged in her business for over 5 years.

In 2003, Rosenda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosenda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC. Rosenda is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. Rosenda is an active member of PMPC for the past six years such that this loan will be the 15th loan (average of 4-6 months term per loan cycle) taken out by Rosenda from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en: This is Mrs. Angelina M., who is 33 years old, married and lives at Talairon, Oroquieta City. She is a simple woman, blessed with 3 children. Her husband is a bus driver. In order to help her husband, she decided to open a “sari-sari” (general) store adjacent to their house. It started with a capital of only PHP 500. Her primary customers are their neighbors and relatives. She has been able to manage the business well. In fact, their food is paid for with the income from the “sari-sari” store. Angelina is also thankful to Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative, because it helped her in the expansion, specifically on financial matters. She became a member of the Co-Op in June 2001. She has taken loans several times. Now, she is applying for PHP 10,000 for additional merchandise for sale. She’s looking forward to a comfortable life and plans to expand her business into a grocery store someday. She also wants to own a piece of land someday.

loans.use: To buy additional goods for her "sari-sari" store

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie V. is from the town of Plaridel. She is 30 years old. Margie is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Margie owns and operates a business in the agriculture sector raising livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale. Margie is just starting this business.

In 2008, Margie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Margie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. Margie is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Margie from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn M. is 30 years old. She lives with her family in Mambuaya Cagayan de Oro City. Her two kids go to school and her husband is a hardware employee in the city. Analyn and her husband work hard for the education of their children and for the nice future of the family.

Analyn owns a variety store at their place, where she earns 2000 to 3000 PHP each day. She wants to have more stock to accommodate the needs of her customers. She needs money for the procurement of additional items for her variety store so Analyn is applying for a loan with HSPFI, a Kiva partner. The amount that will be granted to her will be used for her business and partly for payment of her planned residential lot. According to Analyn, this amount would be of great help to her business and to her family. She is determined enough to change and lift their standard of living. She would be grateful to the organization that assists with her plans of improvement.

loans.use: Purchase additional items for her variety store and for payment of residential lot

location.town: Mambuaya, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Jacquiline

texts.en: Mrs. Jacquiline C. has already been a member of Paglaum Co-op for two years. She is a good member and active in all co-op activities. She is 31 years old, married to Ernie, a fisherman. They are blessed with three children. She has requested her third loan amounting to PHP 15,000 to purchase fishing materials and fishing accessories.  Jacquiline helps her husband by selling the fish he catches.

loans.use: Purchase of fishing materials and accessories

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 53 year old man who lives in Saida, Southern Lebanon with his wife and their three children.  Ali sells spare car parts, tools and accessories.  Ali requests a loan for 1000 US dollars from A. Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his shop.  Ali has been a microcredit client for five years now and has always repaid his loans on time.
  
His clients are his friends, neighbors and car mechanics.  When he first started his business, he did not face any difficulties.  Ali decided on this business due to his experience.  In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: Ali will use the loan to purchase merchandise for his shop.

loans.name: Bareaa

texts.en:
Bareaa is a 46 year old woman who lives in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon with her husband and their child.  Bareaa works as a seamstress.  She specializes in wedding and long dresses.  She requested a loan for 500 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to buy thread and accessories for her work.  She also wants to purchase a television for her house. This is Bareaa's first loan request.
 
Bareaa is special in her work because she does it well.  Her clients are wedding shops.  When she first started her business, she had difficulty building a network. Bareaa decided on doing her business because of her previous experience.

loans.use: Bareaa will use the loan to buy thread and accessories for work, along with purchasing a television for her house.

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
Hasan is a 45 year old man who lives in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon with his wife.  Hasan works as a car mechanic and also sells spare car parts. He requests a loan for 1300 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase spare parts.  This is the first time that Hasan has requested a loan.
 
Hasan does his work very well.  His clients are his friends and neighbors.  When Hasan first started his business, he did not face any difficulties. He decided on doing his business because he learned the trade when he was young.

loans.use: Hasan will use the loan to purchase spare parts.

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en: Mercedita A. has 5 children. Three of them have already finished studying, while the other two are still in school. Her husband is a fisherman and she is the one who helps by selling her husband's catch. Their buyers are from their township and from neighboring barangays. Mrs. A. is requesting a loan to repair their fishing boat. She is hoping that their income will support their daily needs and continue to support the education of their children. She dreams of living a comfortable life ahead.

loans.use: Fishing boat repair

loans.name: Sultana

texts.en: Sultana is a 55-year-old married woman with one child, living in Al Rouda, Mount Lebanon. She produces handicrafts and has been in the business for the past 12 years. Sultana is now requesting to borrow US$ 1,000 to increase her inventory.

loans.use: to expand her inventory

loans.name: Adjo Agnès

texts.fr: Cette dame est mariée et mère de 04 enfants, son mari est un chauffeur et son revenu est insuffisant pour couvrir les charges du foyer. Pour aider son mari dans les charges du foyer elle a entamé comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce d’huile qu’elle conserve dans des bidons de 25l. Elle veut diversifier son commerce en y associant le commerce de  tubercules. Elle s’adresse alors à WAGES pour solliciter son premier crédit qui lui  permettra d’acheter 8 bidons d’huile et 20 tas d’ignames.
texts.en:
This lady is married and the mother of 4 children. Her husband is a driver and his income is insufficient to cover household expenses. To help her husband support the family, she began selling oil which she stores in jerry cans of 25 liters each. She wants to diversify her business by adding the sale of cocoyams. She came to WAGES to request her first loan which will allow her to buy 8 jerry cans of oil and 20 piles of cocoyams.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of oil and cereals for resale

loans.name: May

texts.en:
May is a 32 year old woman who lives in Bourj El Barajneh within the southern suburbs of Lebanon with her husband and their two children.  May has been working as a hairdresser for five years.  May does not own a salon, but she visits her clients as a mobile hairdresser.  May also wants to start selling clothes.  She requested a loan for 1500 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase clothes to sell.  This is her third loan, and she has repaid her previous loans on time. 

Her previous loan helped her improve her work.  May is special in her work due to her skills and low prices.  Her clients are her friends and neighbors.  When she first started her business, she did not face difficulties.  May decided on doing her business because of her experience.  In the future, she plans on improving her work and opening a clothing shop.

loans.use: May will use the loan to purchase clothes.

loans.name: Samer

texts.en:
Samer is a 35 year old man who lives in Nabatieh of southern Lebanon with his wife and their two children.  Samer has been working as a car mechanic for three years. Samer requests a loan for 1500 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase tools for his work. This is the first time that Samer has requested a loan.

Samer is special in his work because he does it well.  His clients are people from his region.  When he first started his business, he had difficulty paying the rent of his garage.  Samer pursued his business because he wanted to improve his family’s income.  In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: Samer will use the loan to purchase tools for his work.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en: Elsa Y. is 63 years old and lives in Mambuaya, Cagayan de Oro City. She has seven children, all of whom are married. Her husband works as a watch repairer in the city. Her grandson stays with her. Elsa owns a mini grocery store at their place where she earns 300 to 400 pesos each day. This is enough to support the needs of her grandson. She wants her mini grocery store to expand and have additional items to serve the demands of her customers so Elsa is applying for a loan with HSPFI, a Kiva partner. Elsa is looking forward to the great help that the organization and all the Kiva lenders may extend to her.

loans.use: Amount will be used to purchase additional goods for the business

location.town: Mambuaya, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
Hussein is a 44-year-old man who lives in Nabatieh in southern Lebanon with his wife and their three children. Hussein has been working as a car repairman and painter for 20 years.

This will be his second loan cycle through Al Majmoua and he has always paid on time. His first loan was used to improve his business. He has now requested a loan of $3,000 in order to purchase used cars for his work. With the new loan, he wants to start a new business, specifically, repairing and selling used cars.

Hussein originally decided on engaging in his business because he wanted to improve his family’s income and have an independent career. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase used cars to repair and sell

loans.name: Vilma Angelica

texts.es:
Vilma es socia del Banco Comunal Unión II.
Vilma es viuda, tiene 53 años y 3 hijos, Vilma tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, verduras, carnes, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda eventual de su hijo. Además Vilma junto a sus hijos realizan trabajos en telar como tapices, pasadizos.
Vilma necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar y leche.
Vilma sueña con que sus hijos sean profesionales, techar con material noble su casa e incrementar su negocio.
texts.en:
Vilma is a member of the community bank, Unión II. Vilma is a widow, is 53 years old, and has 3 children. Vilma has a store in her house where she sells groceries in general, vegetables, and meats. She works every day with the occasional help of her son. In addition, Vilma, along with her son, performs weaving jobs, such as making tapestries and banners. Vilma needs a loan of 1000 PEN which will be invested in purchasing rice, sugar, and milk. Vilma dreams that her children will be professionals, will roof their house with a sturdy material, and will expand their business.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, and milk.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 22-year-old man who lives in Saida in southern Lebanon with his wife. Mahmoud has been working as a furniture repairman since 2002.

Mahmoud has requested a loan of $1,500 from Al Majmoua in order to purchase a car for his work. This is the first time that Mahmoud has requested a loan.

Mahmoud enjoys his work and does it well. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When he first started his business, he didn’t have a lot of cash, and he has increased his income over time. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase a car for his work

loans.name: Doris Jovita

texts.es:
Doris es socia del Banco Comunal Unión II.
Doris es casada, tiene 55 años y 1 hijo, Doris tiene un carro con el cual realiza transporte urbano en la ciudad D. Ayacucho, tiene un personal encargado D. conducir el carro. Además Doris es docente y trabaja en un centro educativo en la ciudad D. Ayacucho.
Doris necesita un préstamo D. 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. llantas y para el mantenimiento del carro.
Doris sueña con que sus hijos sean profesionales, mejorar su negocio y ahorrar mas.
texts.en:
Doris is a member of the community bank, Unión II. Doris is married, is 55 years old, and has a son. Doris has a car with which she provides transportation in the city of Ayacucho. She is personally in charge of driving the car. In addition, Doris is a teacher and works in an educational center in the city of Ayacucho. Doris needs a loan of 3000 PEN, which will be invested in purchasing tires and maintaining the car. Doris dreams that her children will be professionals, will improve her business, and will save more.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tires and to maintain her car

loans.name: Malek

texts.en:
Malek is a 48-year-old man who lives in Saida in southern Lebanon with his wife and their three children. Malek has run a vehicle-lift business since 2007. Mahmoud is requesting a loan of $2,000 from Al Majmoua in order to finance essential maintenance and repairwork on his truck. This is the first time that Malek has requested a loan.

Malek knows how to treat his clients and is punctual. His clients are those whose cars need repair. When he first started his business, he didn’t have a lot of cash, and he has increased his income over time. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To perform maintenance and repairwork on his truck

loans.name: Roxana Elizabeth

texts.es:
Roxana es socia del Banco Comunal Unión II.
Roxana es conviviente, tiene 28 años y 2 hijos, Roxana tiene un puesto en el mercado 12 de abril en donde vende ropa variada, además los días domingos y lunes viaja  a las ferias de la región. Roxana esta estudiando la carrera de Obstetriz.
Roxana necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de jeans.
Los sueños de Roxana son construir su casa, ejercer su profesión y sacar adelante a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Roxana is a member of the community bank, Unión II. Roxana is 28 years old, has 2 children, and lives with their father. Roxana has a stand in the market, 12 de abril, where she sells a variety of clothing. In addition, on Sundays and Mondays, she travels to the region's fairs. Roxana is studying the career of midwifery. Roxana needs a loan of 900 PEN, which will be invested in buying jeans. Roxana's dreams are to build a home, practice her profession, and to bring up her children.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy jeans

loans.name: Anunciacion

texts.en:
Mrs. Anunciacion T., 64 years of age, is married with four children, all of whom now live with their own families. The main source of her family income comes from the carpentry wages earned by her husband.

Anunciacion sells snacks and engages in backyard gardening on her own to earn additional income. She became a member of Paglaum three years ago and has been able to maintain a good credit record.

She has now requested another loan in the amount of Php 6,000, which is intended as additional capital for her snack vending activities as well as to help finance the expansion of the vegetable garden in her back yard.

loans.use: To finance her snack-vending and gardening activities

loans.name: Vilda

texts.es:
Vilda es socia del Banco Comunal La Kantuta.
Vilda es casada, tiene 38 años y 5 hijos, Vilda junto a su esposo tienen un restaurante en un local alquilado, actividad que realiza todos los días. Además Vilda tiene un puesto en el mercado 12 d abril en donde vende cereales.
Vilda necesita un préstamo de 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cereales, maíz, cebada, trigo.
Los sueños de Vilda son mejorar su negocio y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Vilda is a member of the community bank "La Kantuta." She is married, 38 years old, and has five children.

Along with her husband, Vilda has a restaurant in a rented space, which she runs everyday. She also has a stall at the 12th de Abril market, where she sells grains. Vilda seeks this loan of 1050 Peruvian soles so that she can invest in the purchase of cereals, corn, barley, and wheat.

Vilda dreams of improving her business and that her children can become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Michelle Harrison, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of cereals, corn, barley, and wheat.

loans.name: Salma

texts.en: Salma is a 25-year-old married woman living in Kamed El Louz, in the Bekaa Valley. She has been working as a beautician for the past two years. Today, Salma is requesting to borrow US$ 500 to purchase beauty products.

loans.use: to purchase beauty products

loans.name: Hourna

texts.fr: Cette femme est mariée et mère de 2 enfants, elle vit avec sa famille dans le quartier d’atikoumé qui est un quartier périphérique de la ville de Lomé. Elle a ouvert depuis 2006, un bar qu’elle a appelé « MAQUIS CLEVER », elle réalise beaucoup de recette les week-ends, elle veut réaménager son local  et acheter des casiers de bière raison pour laquelle elle s’adresse à WAGES pour solliciter son premier crédit pour acheter 15 casiers de bière et des matériaux pour réapprovisionner son bar.
texts.en:
This lady is married and the mother of 2 children. She lives with her family in the Atikoumé neighborhood, an outlying district of the city of Lomé. Since 2006 she has been running a bar that she calls « MAQUIS CLEVER ». She takes in a lot of money on the weekends. She would like to refurbish her bar and buy some crates of beer, which is why she has come to WAGES to ask for her first loan to buy 15 crates of beer and some materials to outfit her bar.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of crates of beer and materials for refurbishing the bar

loans.name: Maximiliana

texts.es:
Maximiliana es socia del Banco Comunal La Kantuta.
Maximiliana es separada, tiene 48 años y 5 hijos, Maximiliana vende ropa en las diferentes ferias de la región, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de sus hijos, y los días domingos vende en la feria dominical de las Américas.
Maximiliana necesita un préstamo de 2100 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de pantalones, casacas.
Los sueños de Maximiliana son educar a sus hijos y construir su casa.
texts.en:
Maximiliana is a member of the community bank "La Kantuta."

Maximiliana is separated, is 48 years old, and has 5 children. She sells clothing in the different markets in her region, something she has been doing with the help of her children. On Sundays, she sells in the Americas market. Maximiliana seeks this loan of 2100 Peruvian soles in order to invest in the purchase of pants and jackets.

She dreams of providing an education for her children and building her home.

Translated from Spanish by Michelle Harrison, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of pants and jackets

loans.name: Samer

texts.en: Samer is a 27-year-old married man with one child, living in Al Maghayreh, Mount Lebanon. He has owned his own supermarket since 2004. Today, he is requesting to borrow US$ 500 to purchase a new refrigerator for the supermarket to better serve his clients.

loans.use: to purchase a new refrigerator

loans.name: Yolonisa

texts.en: 35-year-old Mrs. Yolonisa P. is a new member of Paglaum co-op.  She is married and blessed with two children; both of them are in grade school. She has an existing "sari-sari" (variety store) business in her residence.  She has requested a loan intended to purchase additional stock for her business so as to have more income for the family.

loans.use: purchase of grocery inventory for resale

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa es socia del Banco Comunal La Kantuta.
Rosa es casada, tiene 51 años y 7 hijos, Rosa tiene una tienda en su casa en donD. venD. abarrotes en general, verduras, frutas, condimentos, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda D. sus hijos.
Rosa necesita un préstamo D. 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. arroz, azúcar.
Los sueños D. Rosa son brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the La Kantuta Community Bank. Rosa, 51, is married and has seven children. Rosa has a store in her house where she sells general groceries, vegetables, fruits, and condiments. She does this everyday with her children’s help. Rosa needs a loan for 900 PEN to buy rice and sugar. Rosa’s dream is to give her children a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy rice and sugar

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia es socia del Banco Comunal La Kantuta.
Julia es casada, tiene 36 años y 2 hijos, Julia vende productos medicinales naturales mediante catálogos, sus ventas son al crédito y contado. Además Julia en época de producción de tuna vende dicho producto en la ciudad de Lima, también compra cereales que luego comercializa en la selva ayacuchana.
Julia necesita un préstamo de 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de productos naturales.
Julia sueña con ser empresaria y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Julia is a member of the La Kantuta Communal Bank. Julia is married, 36 years old, and has two children. Julia sells natural medicinal products through catalogues. Her sales are on credit and cash. Furthermore, Julia at this time grows prickly pears and sells them in the city of Lima. She also buys cereal grains which she later sells in the Ayacuchana jungle. Julia needs a loan of 600 PEN which will be invested in the purchase of natural products. Julia’s dream is to be a businesswoman and that her children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by William Gray, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of natural products.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es:
Elsa es socia del Banco Comunal La Kantuta.
Elsa es casada, tiene 27 años y 2 hijos, Elsa viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región, 4 veces por semana, en donde vende ropa variada y de las ferias compra animales menores y quesos que vende en los mercados de la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Elsa necesita un préstamo de 2100 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de pantalones y casacas.
Elsa sueña con tener un carro para transportar sus productos y tener una tienda estable.
texts.en:
Elsa is a partner in the La Kantuta Community Bank. She is 27 years old and married, with two children. Elsa travels to various markets in the region four times per week. There she sells a variety of clothing and buys small animals and cheeses to sell in the city market of Ayacucho. Elsa needs a loan of 2100 soles, which she'll invest in pants and jackets. She dreams of having a car to transport her products and of having a stable store.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy pants and jackets

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en: Mohamad is a 19-year-old man living in KeterMaya, Mount Lebanon. He started working as a farmer when his father first taught him the business when he was 11 years old and he now owns his own farm. Today, Mohamad is requesting to borrow US$ 1,200 to purchase fertilizer etc.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers etc.

loans.name: Domitila

texts.es:
Domitila es socia del Banco Comunal La Kantuta.
Domitila es casada, tiene 29 años y 3 hijos, Domitila junto a su esposo venden productos de pasamanería como bolsas, ganchos, candados, linternas, útiles de escritorio, etc, ellos viajan a las diferentes provincias con su carro vendiendo sus productos al por mayor a las tiendas.
Domitila necesita un préstamo de 450 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de candados, bolsas.
Los sueños de Domitila son ser empresaria, tener una tienda mayorista y que sus hijos estudien administración de empresas.
texts.en:
Domitila is a partner in the La Kantuta community bank.She is 29 years old and married, with three children. Domitila and her husband sell items such as bags, clothing hangers, padlocks, flashlights, office supplies, etc. They travel to different provinces in their car, selling wholesale to local stores. Domitila needs a loan of 450 soles, which she'll invest in padlocks and bags. She dreams of being a business owner, having a wholesale store, and helping her children study business administration.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy padlocks and bags

loans.name: Soleil Plus Group

texts.fr: Brigitte M. est entrain de développer un restaurant en vendant des shikwangues (l’un d’aliments principaux à Kinshasa) accompagnées des condiments. Le nombre de ses clients ne cesse de croître de jour en jour à cause de sa bonne cuisine. C’est pourquoi elle a planifié avec le crédit du mois de mai courant, de renforcer le stock de son restaurant en vue de satisfaire le besoin de sa clientèle et d’accroitre le revenu. Elle a aussi dans le même souci, planifié de diversifier son activité en y ajoutant des épices qui se vendent bien dans son quartier qui se situe au nord-est de Kinshasa. Brigitte a débuté à vendre pour la première fois en 1983. Le capital initial qui lui avait permis d’acheter 2 kilos de viande pour griller et vendre des brochettes jusqu’en 1987 était de $4. De 1987 – 2002, Brigitte  a obtenu le diplôme d’Etat de l’école secondaire en 1987, a changé le milieu et a décidé de convertir son activité en fabriquant des beignets. La hausse exorbitante du prix d’huile végétale qui constitue l’une des matières premières de fabrication des beignets, a mis fin à cette activité. De 2002 à ce jour, Brigitte a ouvert un service de restauration qui génère actuellement $10 par semaine. Son ambition est d’ouvrir une alimentation pour satisfaire le besoin de la population de son quartier. Elle a 42 ans, divorcée et mère de 5 enfants dont leurs âges varient entre 4 et 17 ans. Quatre d’entre eux vont à l’école.
texts.en:
Brigitte M. is growing a little restaurant by selling "shikwangues" (one of the main foods in Kinshasa) accompanied by condiments. Her clientele is growing quickly beause she is a good cook. That is why she plans, with this month-of-May loan, to build up the stock of her restaurant so as to better satisfy her clientele and earn more money. With the same goals in mind, she would like to diversify her business by adding the sale of spices, which sells well in her neighborhood in the north-east of Kinshasa.

Brigitte began her career in sales for the first time in 1983. The initial capital that allowed her to buy 2 kilograms of meat to grill and sell as brochettes up until 1987 was US$ 4.

From 1987-2002, Brigitte attended secondary school and received her diploma. In 1987 she moved and decided to change over to selling fritters. The exorbitant hike in the price of vegetable oil, one of the main raw materials for making fritters, ended this business. From 2002 until today, Brigitte has been running a cooked food business which presently generates US$ 10 per week. Her ambition is to open a grocery store to satisfy the needs of the people of her neighborhood. She is 42, divorced, and the mother of 5 children, aged between 4 and 17. Four of them are enrolled in school.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: bolster the raw materials for her restaurant so as to earn more

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Lani

texts.en: Lani E. is 42 years old and married to Antonio, a civil engineer. They are blessed with three children; all are studying. Lani was already  business-minded before she became a member of Paglaum Co-op. She has a grocery store located at their house. She wants to borrow the amount of PHP 20,000 for additional capital to buy some stock of grocery items. She is a good and hard-working mother and always helps her husband in supporting the needs of the family.

loans.use: To buy additional stocks of grocery items for her store

loans.name: Rana

texts.en: Rana is a 25-year-old woman living in Gharifeh, Mount Lebanon. She has owned her own jewelry shop since 2003 where she produces hand-made jewelry and knits requested products for the neighboring villages. Today, Rana is requesting to borrow US$ 1,200 to increase her inventory.

loans.use: to increase her inventory

loans.name: Essi Félicité

texts.fr:
Dame A. Essi Félicité est âgée de 33 ans, mariée et mère de deux (2) enfants. Depuis 1982, elle a ouvert un magasin de vente des produits pharmaceutiques à Lomé. Ce commerce lui procure assez de revenu ce qui lui permet d’aider son mari dans les dépenses de la famille. Elle a une fois bénéficié du crédit auprès de WAGES et a bien remboursé. Ayant son lieu d’approvisionnement à Accra au Ghana, elle souhaite faire le ravitaillement afin de pouvoir bien vendre et ouvrir d’autres point de vente.
A cet effet, ce second crédit qu’elle sollicite lui permettra d’acheter 3 cartons des produits antibiotiques et 2 cartons de vitamines et 1 carton de différents produits pharmaceutiques.
texts.en:
Ms A. Essi Félicité, age 33, is married and the mother of two. In 1982, she opened a store selling pharmaceutical products in Lomé. This business brings in enough income to enable her to help her husband cover family expenses. She once benefited from a WAGES loan and has repaid it. Her source of supplies is in Accra in Ghana, and she would like to stock up again in order to be able to do better in her sales and to open another sales outlet. In this regard, this second loan she's requesting will enable her to buy three boxes of antibiotics, two boxes of vitamins, and a box of different products.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pharmaceuticals

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en: Alicia O. is already 59 years of age, married and blessed with five children, all of whom are married. Her husband is a fisherman and she is a port vendor. She wishes to borrow PHP 10,000 for the acquisition of a new fishing net and accessories for her husband's fishing. She has newly become a member of Paglaum Co-op. But she is very good and pays her obligations in a timely fashion during the meetings.

loans.use: To buy a fishing net and battery for her husband's fishing

loans.name: Amal

texts.en: Amal is a 34-year-old married woman with two children living in Harrar, northern Lebanon. She has owned her own electrical goods store for one year but has 15 years of experience in the field. Today, Amal is requesting to borrow US$ 1,200 to purchase merchandise for her store.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en: Evangeline V., 38 years old, is married to Mr. Nestor V., a fisherman. They are blessed with four children; two of them are studying. They live in the town of Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. Mrs V. is working with her neighbor as a baby sitter; she has a salary of 3,000 php a month. She is a member of Paglaum Co-op and has requested a loan amounting to 15,000 php to finance the needs of her husband's fishing. She is very thankful for the assistance and trust given  her by Paglaum and Kiva. She hopes to improve their family's living conditions and hopes to see her children finish school.

loans.use: To buy materials for new fishing boat and fishing accessories

location.town: Lao Sta. Cruz, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Daniel Antonio

texts.es: El Señor Daniel Antonio Paz P. tiene la edad de 57 años, su estado civil es casado. Daniel tiene 3 hijos y todos estudian. La actividad económica es  una pulpería. Hace más de 7 años que se dedica a este negocio. La ubicación de su negocio es el mercado municipal, en donde vende los productos como granos básicos, perecederos, y otros, el negocio es atendido por familiares y vende de contado. Los propósitos de Daniel son de mantener a sus clientes para que siempre recurran a su negocio. El financiamiento es destinado para capital de trabajo y así comprar productos como arroz, azúcar, aceite, frijoles, refrescos naturales y pan. El deseo de Daniel es de mejorar cada día la atención al cliente y además espera seguir con este negocio.
texts.en:
Mr. Daniel Antonio Paz P. is 57 years old and married. He has three children, all of whom are in school. Daniel owns a local store, which he has managed for more than seven years. His business is located in the main city market, where he sells products such as grains, perishables, and others. Daniel's family members mind the store and sell in cash. Daniel would like to keep his clients so that they always return to his business. This loan will be used as working capital, buying products such as rice, sugar, oil, beans, natural soft drinks, and bread. Daniel would like to improve customer service on a daily basis, and thereby continue in this business.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Abra

texts.fr:
K. abra exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de produits cosmétiques, elle a commencé cette activité en 2007. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé, elle fait face présentement à une rupture de stock. Elle veut se réapprovisionner et sollicite  de WAGES son premier crédit pour acheter 10 cartons de crème « VIT FEE », 15 boîtes de lait « CACAO BOETER » et divers produits cosmétiques.
Elle est célibataire, c’est avec le revenu de son activité qu’elle subvient à ses propres charges.
texts.en:
K. Abra earns revenues from commerce in cosmetics. She started this business in 2007. She stocks up at the grand marketplace of Lome. Presently, she faces inventory shortages. She wants to resupply herself and is requesting her first loan from WAGES to buy ten boxes of VIT FEE cream, fifteen boxes of CACAO BOETER milk, and various cosmetic products. She is unmarried. With the revenues from her business, she supports herself.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cosmetics

loans.name: Yousef

texts.en: Yousef is a 44-year-old man living in Rahbe, northern Lebanon. He has owned his own general store for one year, with 26 years of experience in the field. Today, Yousef is requesting to borrow US$ 1,200 to increase his inventory.

loans.use: to increase his inventory

loans.name: Esra

texts.en:
Esra A. is 55 years old and lives in Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro. She has eight children: three of them live with her and the others are married and working. Esra’s husband left eight years ago. This is one reason why she lives with full determination to raise her children well.

Esra makes native foods, locally called “kakanins.”  These include biko (sweetened rice), puto (steamed rice), and other cooked snacks. She sells her food in the school canteen. During the summer, she peddles her snacks around the village and to the mines where miners work. 

Esra is applying for a loan through Kiva partner HSPFI. She is looking for additional capital before the school year starts next month. She looks forward to the great help that Kiva lenders may extend to her.

loans.use: Purchase ingredients for her food products

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Sakponou

texts.fr:
Monsieur F. Sakponou né en 1978 à EGLIMEY dans la préfecture du moyen mono au Togo est marié et père de trois (3) enfants. Il a ouvert un magasin de vente des produits de consommation courante dans le quartier d’Adidogomé à Lomé. Depuis le début de son commerce, il réalise toujours des bénéfices grâce à la position géographique de son magasin.
Son premier crédit qu’il sollicite lui permettra d’acheter 7 cartons de boîtes de conserve et 9 cartons de savon afin d’augmenter son stock et mieux vendre
texts.en:
Mr. F. Sakponou was born in 1978 in EGLIMEY, in central Mono prefecture in Togo. She is married and the father of three. He opened a store selling common consumer goods in the Adidogomé district of Lomé. Since his business began, he has always realized profits, thanks to the location of his store. His first loan he's requesting will enable him to buy seven boxes of canned food and nine boxes of soap in order to augment his inventory and to do better in his sales.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy common consumables

loans.name: Luz Adilia

texts.es: La Señora Luz Adilia V. tiene la edad de 55 años, su estado civil es soltera. Doña Luz tiene 2 hijos y todos trabajan. La actividad económica es elaboración y venta de tortillas. Hace más de 4 años que se dedica a este negocio. La ubicación del negocio de Doña Luz es en su vivienda, ya que muchos de sus clientes son sus vecinos, pero fue con el paso del tiempo que a Doña Luz le gusto su negocio, y lo realiza las treces al día. Los propósitos de Luz son de incrementar su inventario y además mejorar la calidad de sus tortillas. El financiamiento que solicita es destinado para capital de trabajo para la compra de maíz, leña y comal. Los sueños de Luz son de siempre salir adelante con su negocio y proporcionarle mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Luz Afilia V. is 55 and single. She has two children, and they work. She makes and sells tortillas. She has been doing this for more than four years. Luz’s business is located in her home. Lots of her customers are her neighbors. As time passed, Luz liked her business. She makes tortillas three times a day. Luz plans to increase her inventory and improve the quality of her tortillas. The loan she is asking for is for working capital to buy corn, wood, and a comal (a cast iron grill used to make tortillas). Luz’s dreams are to always get ahead with her business and to make improvements on her home.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Girlyn

texts.en:
Mrs. Girlyn S., a wife and a mother of 2 children, has a sari-sari store in her village. With the help of her husband, who is an employee of a small entrepreneurial company, they manage to make their small business grow. They cater to the needs of neighbors and new customers. 

Girlyn is requesting a loan of Php 10,000 for additional capital. She and her husband dream of making their business successful.

loans.use: Additional capital for sari-sari store

loans.name: Rajaa

texts.en: Rajaa is a 33-year-old married woman with four children, living in D. El Ahmar, in the Bekaa Valley. She has owned her own electrical and home products store for the past two months, and she brings 15 years of experience in the field. Today, Rajaa is requesting a loan of $1,200 to increase her inventory.

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Jeffrey

texts.en:
Jeffrey C. is from the town of Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. He is 39 years old and single. To make a living, Jeffrey raises livestock. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Jeffrey has been engaged in his business for more than four years and earns approximately 7,000.00 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Jeffrey joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jeffrey has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,400.00 PHP from PMPC. Jeffrey is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Jeffrey from PMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Essenam

texts.fr:
Mariée et mère de trois (3) enfants, madame A. Essenam est née le 31 décembre 1951 à Ahlon, Localité située à 180 Km de Lomé. Elle est une femme dynamique qui exerce le commerce quasiment mené par les hommes. Elle fait le commerce de planche qu’elle achète au Ghana et revend au menuisier de la capitale togolaise.
Compte tenu de l’évolution de son activité, elle veut acheter une scie électrique et des planches afin de procéder à leur commercialisation.
texts.en:
Married and the mother of three children, Ms. A. Essenam was born on December 31, 1951 in Ahlon, a town located 180 km from Lomé. She is an energetic woman who has a business almost always run by men. She does commerce in planks that she buys in Ghana and resell to cabinet makers of the capital of Togo. Given her business improvements, she wants to buy a power saw and some boards in order to market them.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy planks and a power saw

loans.name: Rukiya

texts.en:
Greetings from N. Rukiya, a 42-year-old married woman. She and her husband have four children: a 15 year old, a 1 year old and two orphans who are 16 and 17 years old. This family currently lives in the Nyakabanda sector, Nyarugenge district in Kigali city, the capital of Rwanda.

Mrs. N. does her operations in Nyarugenge district. In her business she sells women clothes and all kinds of shoes. Her husband is a driver and produces a monthly salary of approximately $275. She doesn't have any employees since she started this business in early 2007. From her business, N. earns $365 as monthly profit. The loan amount requested is 500000 Rwf.

This entrepreneur starts her business at 7 a.m and finishes at 7 p.m every day. With the loan, Mrs. N. intends to expand her business and with the increased profit, she will reinvest in the same business.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Akouwa

texts.fr:
En 2003, cette femme a commencé le commerce de mèches et de tissages qu’elle vendait en détail, elle a une façon très attirante d’accueillir les gens qui viennent acheter chez elle ce qui lui permet de gagner tous les jours la confiance de nouvelles clientes. Présentement la demande de ses clients est élevée, raison pour laquelle elle veut augmenter son stock avec l’achat de 10 cartons de mèches et 10 cartons de tissages et 3 cartons de perruques.
Elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants.
texts.en:
In 2003, this woman began doing commerce in hair extensions and weaves that she used to sell retail. She has a very winning way of welcoming people who buy from her, and this allows her to earn the trust of new customers every day. Presently, customer demand is high, which is why she wants to increase her inventory by buying ten boxes of hair extensions, ten boxes of weaves, and three boxes of wigs. She is married and the mother of two.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy hair extensions and weaves

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites E. is from the town of Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 33 years old and married, with two school-aged children. To earn a living, Marites owns and operates a business selling home products. Her revenue comes primarily from selling personal home products to local community members. She has had her business for over 2 years, and earns approximately 8000 PHP per month.

In 2007, Marites joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help her improve her living situation and engage in business activities. Marites successfully repaid a previous loan of 2,000 PHP from PMPC, which she used to purchase additional products to sell. She is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, to be used for the same purpose. This loan will be the 5th loan taken out by Marites from PMPC. She plans to use any additional revenue generated from the business to pay tuition fees for her children. 

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Elna

texts.en:
Elna P. is from the village of Kauswagan. She is 30 years old and married with three infant children. To make a living, Elna sells home products to tourists and local community members. She has just started this business.

Elna joined PMPC in 2008 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Elna is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her third PMPC loan. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her general living conditions.

Elna is shown in the picture wearing the yellow shirt with a customer beside her.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional home products to sell.

loans.name: Erika Ivania

texts.es: La joven y madre de familia Erika Ivania A. M. tiene 31 años de edad ya esta casada y solamente tiene un hijo menor de edad. Ella esta dedicada a la venta de mercadería en general. Inicio su negocio con ventas al contado pero al hacer clientela empezó a vender al crédito lo que le permitió expandir sus horizontes comerciales, saliendo de vendedora  lugares como El Viejo, Corinto, El Realejo, Chichigalpa y Jiliquillo, pueblos de Chinandega, se dedica a este negocio desde hace 12 años vendiendo ropa usada. Los créditos que Fundación León 2000 le ha otorgado le han ayudado a comprar ropa nueva, pero esta vez ella desea invertir el crédito en capital de trabajo comprando cremas y perfumes y más ropa para prosperar más económicamente.
texts.en:
A young woman and the mother of a family, Erika Ivania A. M. is 31 years old, is already married, and only has a young son. She is in the sale of general merchandise. She started her business with cash sales, but to expand her clientele she started to sell on credit which has allowed her to expand her commercial horizons by selling in places such as El Viejo, Corinto, El Realejo, Chichigalpa, and Jiliquillo, towns in Chinandega. She has been in this business for 12 years selling used clothes.

The loans that Fundacion Leon 2000 has granted her have helped her to buy new clothes, but this time she would like to invest the loan in working capital purchasing lotions, perfumes, and more clothes in order to prosper more financially.

Translated from Spanish by William Gray, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Ermilinda

texts.en:
Ermilinda C. is from the village of Unidos. She is 41 years old and married with three school-aged children. To make a living, Ermilinda owns and operates a business providing construction services to local community members. She has just started this business.

Ermilinda joined PMPC in 2008 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. She is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP, which will be used as working capital and to purchase additional inventory. This will be the second PMPC loan. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her general living conditions.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To use as working capital and purchase additional inventory.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en: Moses G. is 58 years old. He is married with five children: three sons and two daughters. Some have completed university and the others are in junior high school. He lives with his wife and children in a rented apartment in a town called Kofiase. It is a farming/trading community near Dormaa, the district capital, in the Brong Ahafo region. His wife works as a farmer to help them financially. Moses is an auto mechanic. He repairs damaged cars. He has a workshop in his community. He is requesting a loan to purchase spare parts. He has been in business for over 21 years and has a number of apprentices in training. Moses is hopeful to expand his business and give his children the best education.

loans.use: Purchase spare car parts

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa B. is from the village of Tipolo. She is 46 years old, married, and has four adult children. To make a living, Rosa has a business providing construction services to local community members. She has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Rosa joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC, which was used to purchase materials needed to expand her services. She is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP, which will be used for the same reason. This loan will be her third PMPC loan. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to expand her construction business.

loans.name: Antoinette Yawa

texts.fr: Dame T. Antoinette Yawa est née à Badou qui est une ville fruitière de la région des plateaux au Togo. Elle est mariée et mère de deux (2) enfants. Elle a pour activité la vente des produits de consommation courante à Lomé. Elle a commencé cette activité depuis 2007 et a connu beaucoup de succès. Elle désire augmenter son stock afin de mieux vendre et sollicite de KIVA un premier crédit pour acheter cinq (5) bidons d’huille, 5 cartons de lait et d’autres boîtes de conserve.
texts.en:
Antoinette Yawa T. was born in Badou, a fruit-producing town in the Plateaux Region in Togo. She's married and the mother of two children. Her money-making business consists in selling food staples in Lomé. She started this business in 2007, with great success. She wishes to bolster her stock to sell more, and she's seeking her first loan from Kiva, in order to purchase 5 cans of oil, 5 boxes of milk, and other canned food products.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 5 cans of oil, 5 boxes of milk, and other canned food products

loans.name: Andresa

texts.en:
Andresa T. is from the village of Clarin. She is 58 years old. Andresa is married and has two adult children. To make a living, Andresa raises livestock. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Andresa has been engaged in her business for more than eight years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2003, Andresa joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Andresa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from PMPC. Andresa is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be the ninth taken out by Andresa from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Kofi

texts.en:
Kofi G. is fifty-five years old. He is married and has four children, two sons and two daughters. Three of them have already completed school. The last born is currently in senior high school. He lives with his wife and children in a rented apartment in a town called Kofiase. It is a farming/trading community near Dormaa, the district capital, in the Brong Ahafo region.

Kofi's wife works to help him support the family financially. She is a food vendor. Kofi is a craft man. He makes artifacts for sale. He weaves baskets from canes. He buys the canes from nearby communities. Kofi supplies the baskets to the market women. He wants a loan to procure working materials such as cane in bulk. He has been in business for over twenty years. He is hopeful to expand his business and give his children the best of education.

loans.use: To buy cane in bulk

loans.name: Gustavo Adolfo

texts.es: Gustavo Adolfo B. tiene la edad de 35 años, su estado civil es soltero. Don Gustavo tiene 1 hijo cursa el 6 grado de primaria. La actividad económica es el servicio de taxi. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio. Don Gustavo inicio este negocio por cuenta propia ya que tenia que hacerse cargo de su familia y fue así como le gusto este oficio. Los propósitos de Gustavo son de brindar el mejor servicio a sus clientes ya que en algunas ocasiones son personas muy amigables y eso es lo que le gusta. Es por eso que solicita financiamiento para capital de trabajo para la compra de repuesto como llantas, espejos, focos entre otros. Los sueños de Gustavo son de seguir adelante con su negocio para dale la oportunidad de que su hijo estudie.
texts.en:
Gustavo Adolfo B. is 35 years old, and his civil state is single. Mr. Gustavo has one son who studies in the 6th grade of elementary school. His business activity is a taxi service. He has been in this business for more than five years. Mr. Gustavo started this business for himself as he already had to transport his family and he enjoyed the role. Gustavo’s proposition is to provide the best service to his customers who in some cases are very friendly people and that is what he enjoys. Therefore, he asks for financing for working capital to purchase replacement parts such as tires, mirrors, headlights, and other items. Gustavo’s dream is to get ahead with his business so that he can give his son the opportunity to study.

Translated from Spanish by William Gray, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Mamunatu

texts.en:
Mamunatu A. is thirty-seven years old. She is married and has given birth to five children, two sons and three daughters. Mamunatu says some are in the junior high school while others are in the primary schools. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a town called Kofiase. Kofiase is a farming/trading community near Dormaa, the district capital, in the Brong Ahafo region. Her husband is a farmer.

Mamunatu is a petty trader. She sells onions. She sells on a table top in the market square. Mamunatu procures her onions from farmers in nearby communities at reasonable prices. She also sells plantains. Mamunatu has been in business for four years and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk. She is hopeful to expand her business and give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To procure vegetables for resale

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en: Lydia M. has a "sari-sari" (variety store) to generate her daily income. She is 45 and married, living in Calube, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. Out of four, two of her children are still schooling. She has applied for a loan of 10,000 PHP. The money will be used as additional capital for her store. She hopes to replace her present "sari-sari" store with a concrete one and she also plans to save for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy additional goods for sale

loans.name: Mariela

texts.es:
Mariela es socia del Banco Comunal Huascahura.
Mariela es conviviente, tiene 19 años y 1 hija, Mariela junto a su esposo venden mercería como linterna, candados, ganchos, etc, Mariela viaja a una feria para comercializar sus productos mientras que su esposo vende diariamente en el mercado central de la ciudad de Ayacucho, actividad que realiza de manera ambulatoria.
Mariela necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de betún, crema dental y candados.
Los sueños de Mariela son tener una casa propia y tener un puesto estable para comercializar sus productos.
texts.en:
Mariela is a member of the Huascahura Community Bank. She is 19, in a common law marriage, and has a daughter. Mariela and her husband sell merchandise like flashlights, padlocks, hooks, etc. Mariela travels to a fair to sell her products. Her husband sells daily in a market in the center of the city of Ayacucho. He is a street vendor. Mariela needs a loan for 900 PEN to buy shoe polish, tooth paste, and padlocks. Mariela’s dreams are to have her own house and to have her own fixed place to sell her products.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy shoe polish, tooth paste, and padlocks

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.en:
Mr. Rogelio T., 45 years old, is married and lives at Calube, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. He is blessed with only one child. His primary source of income comes from a "sari-sari" (general) store. He has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative since June 1999. He has taken out 23 loans already. Pepe has proved his worth, being a Member in Good Standing of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative.

Rogelio said, he is thankful for the cooperative because of the financial assistance given to his family. Today, he is applying for PHP 40,000 to buy additional goods for his sari-sari store business. He hopes for a bountiful life ahead. He also dreams of expanding his “sari-sari” store into a General Merchandise store someday.

loans.use: to buy additional goods for "sari-sari" (general) store

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace A. is twenty-three years old. She is single and lives alone in a rented apartment in a town called Kofiase. Kofiase is a farming/trading community near Dormaa, the district capital, in the Brong Ahafo region.

Grace is a petty trader. She sells textiles – printed and designed fabrics. She hawks her fabrics and also treks to other towns to sell.
