Grace procures her materials from Dormaa, the district capital. She has been in business for one year now and wants a loan to procure textiles in bulk. She is hopeful to expand her business and have some savings for her future.

loans.use: To procure textiles

loans.name: Maximiliana

texts.es:
Maximiliana es socia del Banco Comunal Huascahura.
Maximiliana es conviviente, tiene 35 años y 3 hijos, Maximiliana viaja semanalmente a la selva ayacuchana en donde vende cereales en los diferentes pueblos y de la selva compra frutas que vende en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Maximiliana necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de haba, maíz, papa.
Los sueños de Maximiliana son salir adelante, tener un mototaxi para alquilar y que sus hijos culminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
Maximiliana is a member of the Huascahura Community Bank. She is 35, in a common law marriage, and has three children. Maximiliana travels weekly to the Ayacuchana jungle to sell grains in the different villages. She buys fruit in the jungle and sells it at the wholesale food market in the city of Ayacucho. Maximiliana needs a loan for 2,000 PEN to buy beans, corn, and potatoes. Maximiliana’s dreams are to get ahead, have a "mototaxi" (a motorcycle with a covered seated area attached to carry passengers) to rent, and that her children finish their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy beans, corn, and potatoes

loans.name: Orbelina

texts.es: La emprendedora Orbelina R. S. tiene 50 años, su estado civil es soltera. Doña Orbelina tiene 3 hijos y todos trabajan. La actividad económica de Orbelina es la costura. Hace más de 10 años que se dedica a este negocio. Doña Orbelina inicio por cuenta propia, por lo que tenia que mantener a una familia y además seguir con este negocio. Hasta los momentos ha manejado muchos créditos con Fundación León 2000 y en su mayoría han sido para su negocio. El financiamiento es para la inversión de su negocio como tela, agujas y repuestos para su maquina de coser. Los sueños de Orbelina son de seguir con esta actividad ya que ahí dependen sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The enterprising Orbelina R. S. is 50 and single. Orbelina has three children who all work. Orbelina is a seamstress. She has been in this business for over ten years. She started working for herself because she had to take care of her family and continue with this business. Up until now she has had many loans from Fundación León 2000, and the majority of them have been for her business. The loan is for investment in her business like buying fabric, needles, and replacement parts for her sewing machine. Orbelina dreams of continuing this business because she depends upon its income.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes E. is a store owner in Pk.2, Canubay, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental, where she lives. She’s seventy-six years old, a widow and mother of six children. Despite her age, she’s still determined to survive for the sake of her family.

Lourdes, who has operated a "sari-sari" (variety) store for almost nine years, is requesting a loan of PHP 17,000, her fourth loan from Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative. She will use the money as additional capital for her store, extending the space available for her stock of goods.

loans.use: to expand her "sari-sari" store

loans.name: Vida

texts.en:
Vida B. is thirty years old. She is divorced and has given birth to two children, both of whom are sons. She says both are in primary school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a town called Kofiase. Kofiase is a farming/trading community near Dormaa, the district capital, in the Brong Ahafo region.

Vida is a petty trader. She sells all kinds of vegetables – tomatoes, peppers, garden eggs (small eggplants), etc. She sells on a table top in the market square. Vida procures her vegetables from farmers in the nearby communities at effective prices. She has been in business for two years and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk. She is hopeful to expand her business and give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To procure vegetables for resale

loans.name: Jerry

texts.en: Jerry I. is a 32-year-old business man from Burgos, Oroquieta City, Mis. Occ. He is married and has 2 children. He operates a “sari-sari” (general) store business. He plans to use the loan from Paglaum to buy additional goods for sale. His regular customers are his friends, neighbors, and passersby. He dreams of expanding his business someday to provide for his children's future.

loans.use: to buy additional goods for sale

loans.name: Franck

texts.fr: Marié et père de 02 enfants, monsieur B. franck a ouvert en 2007 un dépôt de produits laitiers FAN MILK, cette activité est très rentable pour ce dernier car il réalise de grosses recettes et est le seul dans son quartier a exercé ce genre d’activité,les gens à Lomé aiment ces produits laitiers et ils ne sont pas aussi coûteux, il s’approvisionne auprès de la société FAN MILK, il veut se réapprovisionner et sollicite de WAGES son premier crédit pour renouveler  son stock avec des produits FAN MILK.
texts.en:
Married and the father of 2 children, Mr. B. Franck opened a depot for milk products (of the brand FAN MILK) in 2007. This business is very profitable for him, as he earns a lot and is the only one in his neighborhood to have this sort of business. People in Lomé like milk products and they are not expensive. He buys his merchandise from the FAN MILK company. He would like to stock up and is asking WAGES for his first loan to replenish his stock of FAN MILK products.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of milk products for resale

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Mrs. Corazon A. is a 48-year-old from Labo, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is married to a carpenter/ farmer and blessed with seven children. Due to financial difficulties, she decided to engage in food vending. She started a business with a minimal amount only. Being a member of Paglaum MPC she is able to acquire additional capital for her business.

She sells a variety of viands to neighbors, friends, and relatives. She is coping well with the challenges of her business. Now, she wants a loan of PHP 4,000. Determination in life is what she has. Her heart’s desire is to have a small stall for a sari-sari (variety) store and to send their children to school and witness them be successful in the future.

loans.use: additional capital for food vending

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
Lucia es socia del Banco Comunal Huascahura.
Lucia es casada, tiene 38 años y 6 hijos, Lucia viaja a las ferias de la región en donde vende ropa variada y de las ferias compra cereales, queso, productos que comercializa en las tiendas de la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Lucia necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de chompas, mandiles, faldas.
Lucia sueña con que sus hijos estudien y tener una casa propia.
texts.en:
Lucia is a member of the Huascachura Community Bank. Lucia is 38, married, and has six children. Lucia travels to the regional fairs and sells various clothes there. She buys grains and cheese in the fairs, and she sells those products in the stores in the city of Ayacucho. Lucia needs a loan of 900 PEN to buy sweaters, aprons, and skirts. Lucia dreams of her children getting an education and having their own houses.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sweaters, aprons, and skirts

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome P. is thirty-eight years old. She is married and has given birth to three children, two sons and a daughter. She says some are in junior high while others are in primary school. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a town called Kofiase. Kofiase is a farming/trading community near Dormaa, the district capital, in the Brong Ahafo region. Her husband is a mason by profession.

Salome is a petty trader. She sells all kinds of vegetables – tomatoes, peppers, garden eggs (small eggplants), etc. Salome sells on a table top in the market square. She procures her vegetables from farmers in nearby communities at cost-effective prices. She has been in business for one year now and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk. She is hopeful to expand her business and give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To procure vegetables for resale

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha es socia del Banco Comunal Tulipanes.
Martha es casada, tiene 38 años y 3 hijos, Martha junto a su esposo tienen una tienda de repuestos de carros en un local alquilado, su esposo es mecánico. Además Martha vende cosméticos por catálogos y también brinda servicios de corte y confección de prendas de vestir.
Martha necesita un préstamo de 2100 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de repuestos de carro.
Los sueños de Martha son ampliar su tienda, tener otra sucursal y construir su casa.
texts.en:
Martha is a member of the community bank of Tulipanes. She is 38, married, and has 3 children. She and her spouse (a mechanic), rent a store out of which they sell spare auto parts. Besides that, Martha sells mail-order cosmetics, and also offers tailoring services. Martha needs a loan of 2100 soles which she will invest in the purchase of car parts. Her dreams are to expand her store, open another branch, and build a house.

Translated from Spanish by Cyrus Maher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of car parts

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana K. is 31 years old. She is married and has given birth to 7 children - 4 sons and 3 daughters. Some are in the junior high while others are in primary school. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a town called Kofiase, a farming/trading community near Dormaa, the district capital, in the Brong Ahafo region. Her husband is a farmer.

Susana is a trader. She trades in all kinds of vegetables – tomatoes, peppers, garden eggs, etc. She sells on a table top in the market square. Susana procures her vegetables from farmers in nearby communities at cost effective prices. Susana has been in business for over 10 years and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk. She hopes to expand her business and give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To procure vegetables in bulk.

loans.name: Criselda

texts.en:
Mrs. Criselda C., is 41 years old and resides in Dapitan City, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married and blessed with 3 children. Her husband is a carpenter and at the same time a fisherman. 

Criselda engages in oyster (commonly known as "talaba") culture. During harvest she sells her cultured oysters in nearby restaurants and even Dakak Park and Beach Resort in Dapitan City. She also sells oyster in a stall along the street where many people pass by.

loans.use: To have additional capital for oyster culture for food.

loans.name: Señor De Torrechayoc Ii Group

texts.es:
Este banco se encuentra ubicado en la provincia D. Urubamba, en pleno corazón del valle sagrado, a 1 hora del departamento D. Cusco.

Los socios del banco comunal “SEÑOR D. TORRECHAYOC II”, son un grupo conformado por 8 mujeres y 4 varones, todos ellos amigos y vecinos, estos señores alternan sus actividades del hogar con el comercio D. granos secos, artesanía, panadería, transporte, y servicio D. Internet; Los socios solicitan el préstamo como capital D. trabajo, el cual puedan ellos reinvertir en sus diferentes negocios, parea una mayor producción y mejorar sus establecimientos.

Nuestros socios son un grupo D. personas, muy amenas y trabajan mucho, ellos agradecen y valoran el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y así mismo se comprometen a cumplir con el pago total D. su deuda en el tiempo establecido.
texts.en:
This bank is located in the Urubamba Province, in the heart of the Sacred Valley an hour from the Department of Cusco. The members of the communal bank “Señor D. Torrecha Yoc II” are a group maD. up of 8 women and 4 men, all friends and neighbors. The members alternate their household activities with commerce dealing in dry grains, handicrafts, a bakery, transportation, and internet services. The members request a loan to use as work capital, which they can invest in their different business to increase production and make improvements to their various establishments. Our members are a group of pleasant and hardworking people; they are thankful and value the loan granted to them through these means, and in the same manner they promise to complete the total payment of their loan in the established time.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital.

loans.name: Vidalina

texts.es:
Vidalina es socia del Banco Comunal Tulipanes.
Vidalina es soltera, tiene 36 años y 2 hijos, Vidalina de dedica a la agricultura de verduras en terrenos alquilados, la venta de sus productos los realiza en el mercado de abastos al por mayor y también compra las verduras de los productores y luego los comercializa. Además Vidalina viaja a las ferias y compra cereales.
Vidalina necesita un préstamo de 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la reparación de su carro con el cual trasporta las verduras.
Los sueños de Vidalina son comprar un puesto en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad de Ayacucho y construir su casa.
texts.en:
Vidalina is a member of the community bank of Tulipanes. She grows vegetables in a rented field, and sells what she harvests, as well as what she purchases from other farmers, in the wholesale food market. Vidalina also travels to fairs and buys grains. Vidalina needs a loan of 600 soles which she will invest in the repair of the car that she uses to transport her vegetables. Her dreams are to buy a place in the wholesale market of Ayacucho and to build a house.

Translated from Spanish by Cyrus Maher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair of the car she uses to transport vegetables

loans.name: Tania Isabel

texts.es:
Tania es socia del Banco Comunal Tulipanes.
Tania es soltera y tiene 36 años, Tania tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende ropa variada, regalos, golosinas, cosméticos, actividad que realiza todos los días. Además Tania hace manualidades.
Tania necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de telas y cartulinas.
Los sueños de Tania son tener una cadena de tiendas y equipar su tienda.
texts.en:
Tania is a member of the Communal Bank Tulipanes (Tulips). Tania is single and 36 years old. Tania runs a store in her home where she sells various clothes, gifts, sweets, and cosmetics; she carries out this activity every day. Tania also makes handicrafts. Tania needs a loan of 3,000 PEN, money that will be invested in the purchase of fabrics and cardboard. Tania dreams with owning a chain of stores, and stocking her current store.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fabrics and cardboard.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: Mrs. Erlinda R. is 61 years of age, widowed, and without dependents. She operates a sari-sari store and she also deals NFA (National Food Authority) rice. As a member of Paglaum, she has applied for loans four times. She will use this loan to purchase additional stock to sell so she can have more income and more savings especially for her old age survival.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock to sell.

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en:
Faustina Y. is thirty-one years old. She is married and has given birth to one child, a son, who is currently in primary school. She lives with her child and husband in a rented apartment in a town called Kofiase, a farming/trading community near Dormaa, the district capital, in the Brong Ahafo region. Her husband is a commercial driver.

Faustina is also a trader, trading in vegetables: onions, tomatoes, pepper, garden eggs, etc. She sells on a table in the market square. She procures her vegetables from farmers in the nearby communities at cost effective prices.

Faustina has been in business for three years and wants a loan to procure vegetables in bulk. She is hopeful to expand her business and give her children the best of education she can afford.

loans.use: To procure vegetables in bulk

loans.name: Atsoupé

texts.fr: Née en 1957 à Adzralakopé dans la préfecture de Zio au Sud du Togo, Mme Atsoupé S. est mariée et a à sa charge neuf (09) personnes. C’est une femme qui ne connaît comme activité que l’agriculture, principalement la culture du mais et du manioc. C’est à travers cette activité agricole, qu’elle pratique depuis des années, qu’elle arrive à soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge des besoins de la famille. Actuellement ses terres cultivables sont très pauvres et nécessitent l’apport de fertilisants. C’est pourquoi elle sollicite un crédit pour l’achat des engrais et d’autres intrants agricoles. Cela lui permettra d’augmenter ses rendements et ses revenus agricoles.
texts.en:
Born in 1957 in Adzralakopé in the prefecture of Zio in the south of Togo, Mrs. Atsoupé S. is married and supporting 9 people. This is a woman who knows only agriculture, principally the cultivation of maize and manioc. It is through this agricultural business, that she has been in for many years, that she manages to help her husband support the family. Presently, her arable land is expended and needs the support of fertilizer. That is why she is requesting a loan to buy manure and other agricultural inputs. This will allow her to increase her yield and her agricultural revenue.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: cultivating maize and manioc

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter B. is sixty-nine years old. He is married and has seven children: three sons and four daughters.  According to him, the last two are currently in the senior high school while the rest have completed school and are working.

He lives with his wife and children in a family house in a town called Kofiase. It is a farming/trading community near Dormaa, the district capital, in the Brong Ahafo region. Peter’s wife works to support him financially. She is a trader.

Peter runs a pharmacy in his community. He sells all kinds of drugs such as tablets and syrups. He wants a loan to procure many drugs to increase his stock. Peter has been in business for one year. He buys from big pharmacy shops and vans that come around to supply him. He is hopeful to expand his business and give his children the best education.

loans.use: To procure drugs for his pharmacy

loans.name: Deonisia

texts.es:
Deonisia es socia del Banco Comunal Tulipanes.
Deonisia es casada, tiene 42 años y 4 hijos, Dionisia junto a su esposo tienen una tapicería en el cual brindan servicio D. tapizado D. carros, para lo cual cuenta con la ayuda D. un personal. Además Dionisia tiene un carro con el cual realiza transporte publico.
Deonisia necesita un préstamo D. 1200 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. esponja, corrofan.
Deonisia sueña con educar a sus hijos para que sean profesionales, mejorar su negocio y traer materiales al por mayor.
texts.en:
Deonisia is a member of the Communal Bank Tulipanes (Tulips). Deonisia is married, 42 years old, and has 4 children. Deonisia and her husband own an upholstery business in which they offer car upholstery services and count with the help of one employee. Deonisia also own a vehicle in which she offers public transportation services. Deonisia needs a loan of 1,200 PEN, money that will be invested in the purchase of corrofan foam. Deonisia dreams with educating her children so that they become professionals, improving her business, and purchasing materials wholesale.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase corrofan foam.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
La señora Antonia V. tiene 26 años de edad y está casada con Agustín Riberos de 30 años, ambos son padres de una nena de un año de edad.
Antonia es de profesión modista, además cuenta con una despensa en su propio domicilio y  su marido es constructor de obras. El dinero del préstamo será invertido en la compra de telas para la confección de uniformes, ya que tiene pedidos de una escuela.
 Con el tiempo desea ampliar  su negocio y vender artículos de mercería, ya que cuenta con clientela formada y no tiene mucha competencia en la zona.
 Confía en que mejorarán muchas cosas en nuestro país, especialmente en la educación y la creación de mayores fuentes de trabajo.
texts.en:
Antonia V. is 26 years old and is married to Agustín Riberos who is 30 years old; both are parents of a one-year old baby girl. Antonia is by profession a seamstress, and also counts with a store in her home; her husband is a construction worker. The money from this loan will be invested in the purchase of fabrics to make uniforms, given that she has a purchase order from a school. With time Antonia hopes to expand her business and sell sowing wares given that she counts with a solid clientele and does not have much competition in her area. Antonia hopes that many things in her country will improve, especially when it comes to education and creating larger sources of employment.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fabrics

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase of fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Karla Vanessa

texts.es: Karla Vanessa D. Sánchez tiene la edad de 28 años, su estado civil es soltera. Doña Karla tiene 4 hijos. La actividad económica es la venta y compra de bolsas plásticas y verduras. Hace más de 9 años que se dedica a este negocio. Doña Karla inicio este negocio por cuenta propia, ya que siempre le ha gustado y con el tiempo fue incrementando sus productos. Es por eso que el propósito de Karla es invertir cada día en su negocio. Y así solicita un financiamiento para capital de trabajo en la compra de bolsas plásticas y verduras. Sus deseos son de obtener un lugar que sea propio y acondicionarlo humildemente.
texts.en:
Karla Vanessa D. S. is 28 years old and unmarried. Karla has 4 children, and for the past 9 years she has bought and sold plastic bags and vegetables to make a living. She started this business on her own, since she has always liked selling things, and with time she has been able to increase her sales volume. It is to this end that Karla is going to invest every day in her business. She is asking for a loan to finance the purchase of more plastic bags and vegetables. Her dreams are to have a place that is her own and to fix it up, however modestly.

Translated from Spanish by Cyrus Maher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of plastic bags and vegetables

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Emilia

texts.en:
Emilia A. is forty years old. She is married and has given birth to five children: three sons and two daughters. According to her, one is in the senior high school while the rest are in the junior high and primary schools.

She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a town called Kofiase, a farming/trading community near Dormaa, the district capital, in the Brong Ahafo region. Her husband is a teacher by profession.

Emilia is a trader. She runs a provision store in her community. She procures her products from Dormaa, the district capital. She has been in business for two years and wants a loan to procure provisions in bulk. Emilia also runs a cold store alongside. She is hopeful to expand her business and give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To procure provisions for her store

loans.name: Ami

texts.fr: Cette femme habite avec son époux et ses 03 enfants dans le quatier d'avédji à Lomé, l’activité génératrice de revenu qu’elle exerce est la vente de charbons de bois, elle a associé à ce commerce la vente de maïs, elle vend à ses plus fidèles clients à crédit et récupère son argent dans les huit jours suivants. Ne disposant pas en ce moment de beaucoup de marchandises, elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour se réapprovisionner avec 25 sacs de charbons de bois et 10 sacs de maïs.
texts.en:
This lady lives with her husband and their three children in the Avédji district in Lomé. Her business is selling charcoal; in addition, and she also sells maize. She sells to her most faithful customers on credit and recuperates her money over a week's time. Not having much inventory at present, she is asking for a loan from WAGES to stock up with 25 sacks of charcoal and 10 sacks of maize.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of charcoal

loans.name: Jannett

texts.es:
Jannett es socia del Banco Comunal Tulipanes.
Jannett es soltera, tiene 21 años y vive con sus padres, Jannett junto a su hermano tienen una cerrajería que esta en su casa, la producción es de acuerdo a pedidos de sus clientes, Yaneth se encarga de la administración del negocio.
Jannett necesita un préstamo de 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de fierros.
Los sueños de Jannett son ampliar su negocio y comprar su casa.
texts.en:
Jannett is a member of the community bank of Tulipanes. She is 21, unmarried, and lives with her parents. She runs a locksmith shop with her brother out of their house, and their production is in accordance with the wishes of their clients. Yaneth is in charge of the administrative side of the business. Jannett needs a loan of 1050 soles which she will invest in the purchase of iron. Her dreams are to expand the business and buy her own house.

Translated from Spanish by Cyrus Maher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of iron

loans.name: Olivia

texts.en:
Olivia A. is thirty-five years old. She is married and has given birth to one child, a girl. According to her, her daughter is in the junior high school.

She lives with her husband and daughter in a rented apartment in a town called Kofiase, a farming/trading community near Dormaa, the district capital, in the Brong Ahafo region. Her husband is a mason by profession.

Olivia is a trader. She runs a provision store in her community. She procures her products from Dormaa, the district capital. She says her store is by the road side.

Olivia has been in business for two years and wants a loan to procure provision in bulk. She is hopeful to expand her business and give her daughter the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To procure provisions in bulk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase of fertilizer for the cultivation of maize and manioc

loans.name: Muloma Group

texts.en:
This is Fatmata B. and Sinneh B.. They named their group Muloma. They are both local entrepreneurs in the small town of Waterloo, 20 miles from Freetown. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are requesting from SMT/Kiva. They are requesting a loan of Le 500,000.00 each. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses both in terms of size and quality. Consequently they can make better profit and improve their standards of living.

Fatmata (left) is the leader of this group. She is 46 and was born in Freetown, Sierra Leone’s capital city. She is a widow. Her husband was killed during the Ten Years Old civil war. She has two children who are already married. Fatmata currently lives in Waterloo, where she owns a small shop. She sells dishes, buckets, bowls, etc. She has 15 years of experience in this business.

loans.use: Invest in her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: growing root crops

loans.name: Alfredo Antonio

texts.es: Alfredo Antonio Z. González tiene la edad de 45 años, su estado civil es casado. Alfred tiene 2 hijos y todos trabajan. La actividad económica es tenería. Hace más de 14 años que se dedica a este negocio. Alfredo inicio este negocio por cuenta propia para que sus hijos no tuvieran problemas para estudiar. Alfredo tiene los propósitos de incrementar sus ganancias. El financiamiento es destinado para capital de trabajo y comprar cromo, vaquetas entre otros. El sueño de Alfredo establecer una negocio en su vivienda para que su esposa se haga cargo de este pequeño negocio.
texts.en:
Alfredo Antonio Z. G. is 45 years old and married with 2 children, both of whom work. For the past 14 years he has worked tanning leather. He started this business on his own so that his children would have access to a good education. Alfredo would like to increase his profits, and the loan that he is asking for will be used for working capital, as well as the purchase of chromium and veal hide, among other things. Alfredo's dream is to set up a business in his home so that his wife can be in charge of it.

Translated from Spanish by Cyrus Maher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca B. is forty-four years old. She is married and has three children, one son and two daughters. She says some are currently in senior high school while others are in junior high school. Francisca lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a town called Kofiase. Kofiase is a farming/trading community near Dormaa, the district capital, in the Brong Ahafo region. Her husband is a policeman.

Francisca is a trader. She trades in food stuffs such as yams, plantain, cassava, vegetables, etc. She sells on a table top at the local market square. She procures her goods from Kintampo, a nearby market at cost-effective prices. She has been in this business for one year now and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk. Francisca is hoping to expand her business and give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase of fertilizer

loans.name: Luis Ivan

texts.es:
Ivan es socia del Banco Comunal Tulipanes.
Ivan es soltero, tiene 23 años y vive con sus padres, Ivan se dedica al procesamiento de cereales en harinas, actividad que realiza en el horno de sus padres, sus ventas los realiza de acuerdo a pedidos. Ivan estudia administración de empresas en la universidad y en asociación con otras personas tiene una academia de música.
Ivan necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de trigo cebada.
Los sueños de Ivan son fortalecer la academia de música con métodos innovadores y culminar sus estudios.
texts.en:
Ivan is a member of the community bank of Tulipanes. He is 23, unmarried, and lives with his parents. Ivan uses his parents' oven to process grains into different kinds of flour, which he sells according to the orders that he receives. He is a college student, and studies business administration in addition to belonging to an unofficial musical academy. Ivan needs a loan of 1500 soles which will be invested in the purchase of barley. His dreams are to strengthen the musical academy with innovative approaches and to graduate from college.

Translated from Spanish by Cyrus Maher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of barley

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary A. is forty-seven years old. She is divorced and has five children, one son and four daughters. She tells us that some are in the senior high while others are in the junior high and the primary schools. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a town called Kofiase. Kofiase is a farming/trading community near Dormaa, the district capital, in the Brong Ahafo region.
Mary is a trader. She trades in all kinds of fruits and vegetables – oranges, pineapples, tomatoes, pepper, garden eggs, etc. She sells from a table in the market square and also supplies to retailers. She buys her products from farmers in nearby communities at cost effective prices. Mary has been in business for three years and wants a loan to purchase her goods in bulk. She is hopeful to expand her business and to give her children the best of education she can afford.

loans.use: To purchase fruits and vegetables in bulk.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es: Ana María S. tiene la edad de 36 años, su estado civil es casado. Doña Ana tiene 2 hijos y todos estudian. La actividad económica de Ana es una pulpería. Hace más de 7 años que se dedica a este negocio. Doña Ana inicio vendiendo pocos productos y con los financiamientos fue mejorando su inventario para ofrecerles a sus clientes lo que ellos pedían. La ubicación de su negocio es en su vivienda. Es por eso que solicita un financiamiento con el motivo de mejorar su inventario y comprar productos como granos básicos, gaseosas, jugos, pan, leña y otros. Sus sueños son de mejorar las condiciones de su negocio.
texts.en:
Ana Maria S. is 36 and married with 2 children, both of whom are in school. For the past 7 years Ana has run a small neighborhood grocery store out of her home. She started out selling only a few products, but as her income has increased, she has been able to offer her clients what they ask for. Ana is seeking financing to expand her inventory and to buy products such as staple grains, soft drinks, juices, bread, firewood, etc. Her dream is to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Cyrus Maher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of goods

loans.name: Big Family Group

texts.en:
This is Frances N., Christiana K. and Hawa J.. They named their group Big Family. They are all local entrepreneurs in Waterloo, a small town situated twenty miles from Freetown. This is the first loan that these entrepreneurs are requesting from SMT/Kiva. Each of them is requesting a loan of SLL 500,000. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses both in terms of size and quality. Consequently they can make better profit and improves on their standards of living. 

Frances (middle) is the leader of this group. She is twenty-nine years of age. She was born in Kenema City, in eastern Sierra Leone. She is divorce with five children to look after. Some of her children are in secondary schools and some in primary schools. Frances is a nurse and owns a small pharmacy. She has been a nurse for four years now. She will invest this loan in her pharmacy.

loans.use: To invest into her pharmancy.

loans.name: Komlavi

texts.fr: Mr Komlavi K. est un vieil agriculteur né en 1942 à Adzralakopé. Marié et père de sept (07) enfants, c’est rien que par l’agriculture et principalement la culture du mais qu’il tire les revenus lui permettant de scolariser ses enfants et faire face aux charges de sa famille. Après plusieurs années de cultures, ses terres cultivables s’appauvrissent réduisant considérablement ses rendements. Pour y remédier, il sollicite un financement pour l’achat des engrais. Cela va accroître ses rendements et ses revenus.
texts.en:
Mr. Komlavi K. is an elderly agriculturist born in 1942 in Adzralakopé. Married and the father of 7 children, he has managed to support his family and send his children to school thanks to farming, principally maize-growing. After many years of crops, his arable land is getting expended, which reduces his yield. To remedy that situation, he is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer. This will increase his yield and his revenue.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of fertilizer for growing maize

loans.name: Akouyo

texts.fr: Agricultrice, Mme Akouyo A. est née en 1954 à Adzralakopé. Mariée et mère de deux (02) enfants, elle pratique la culture du mais, activité qui lui procure les revenus indispensables pour se prendre en charge et sa famille. Aujourd’hui ses rendements diminuent à cause de l’appauvrissement de ses sols. Elle demande donc un crédit pour acheter les engrais et autres intrants agricoles en vue d’accroître ses rendements et ses revenus.
texts.en:
Agriculturist, Mrs. Akouyo A. was born in 1954 in Adzralakopé. Married and the mother of 2 children, she grows corn, which brings in indispensable revenue to support herself and her family. Today, her yields are diminished because her soil is expended. She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and other agricultural inputs in view of increasing her yield and her revenue.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of fertilizer for growing maize

loans.name: Asieduaa

texts.en:
Asieduaa T. is forty-seven years old. She is married and has five children: three sons and two daughters. She tells us that her children are in senior high, junior high and primary schools. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a town called Kofiase. Kofiase is a farming/trading community near Dormaa, the district capital, in the Brong Ahafo region.
Asieduaa is a trader. She trades in salt. She buys bags of salt from dealers who distribute in cargo cars. She also supplies to retailers and sells from a table in the market square. Asieduaa has been in business for over twenty years and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk. She is hopeful to expand her business and give her children the best education that she can afford.

loans.use: To purchase bags of salt to re-sell.

loans.name: Emerciana

texts.es:
La Sra. Emerenciana Martínez de 48 años de edad, está casada con el Sr. Eladio Silvero de 47 años de edad, ellos tienen 2 hijos que ya tienen mayor de edad y por lo tanto ya no viven con ellos.
   Doña Emerenciana empezó  a trabajar como vendedora ambulante con el capital que ellos junto trabajando como empleada de una yerba matera de la ciudad, aproximadamente en el año 2.002; en la actualidad ya tiene su clientela formada.
   Ella utilizaría este crédito para comprar más mercaderías varias como ropas de invierno, calzados, entre otros atendiendo a que estamos en la época de frio y tienen muchos pedidos.
texts.en:
Emerenciana Martínez is 48 years old, and is married to Eladio Silvero who is 47 years old; they have 2 children who are both adults and currently no longer live with them. Emerenciana began working as a street vendor with the capital that she put aside working as an employee at a Yerba Mate tea factory located in the city around the year 2002. Currently she has her own clientele. She will use this loan to purchase sorted merchandise such as winter clothing, and shoes amongst others, paying attention to the fact that it is the cold season and they have many orders.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase winter clothing and shoes.

loans.name: Tatasu Group

texts.en:
This is Kadiatu K., Isatu K. and Isatu B.. They called their group Tatasu. They are all local entrepreneurs in Waterloo, a small town twenty miles from Freetown. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are requesting from SMT/Kiva. Each of them is requesting a loan of SLL 500,000. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses both in terms of size and quality. Consequently they can make better profit and improves on their standards of living. 

Kadiatu (middle) is the leader of this group. She is thirty-five years of age. She was born in Makeni City, in northern Sierra Leone. She is married to a plumber and they have four children. All of their children are in secondary schools. Kadiatu sells market food: palm-oil (the most popular cooking oil), pepper, rice and many more in Waterloo market. She has been a businesswoman for four years.

loans.use: Invest in her business

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes N. is thirty years old. She is married and has given birth to one child, a girl. She says her daughter is yet to start school. She lives with her husband and daughter and husband in a rented apartment in a town called Kofiase. It is a farming/trading community near Dormaa, the district capital, in the Brong Ahafo region. Her husband is a carpenter by profession. Agnes is a professional hairdresser. She has her salon on one of the streets in her community where she serves her clients. She says she also trades in second hand textiles. She wants a loan to buy some hair products (such as pomades, lotion, creams, artificial hair, etc.) to give her clients the best of services. Agnes has been in business for one year now. She is hopeful to expand her business and improve upon standard of living.

loans.use: To buy hairdressing products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To open a grocery store selling basic provisions

loans.name: Emilio

texts.es:
El señor Emilio Falcón de 31 años de edad vive hace 4 años con su pareja, la señora Liduvina Cañete de 25 años. La pareja tiene un hijo de 2 años de edad.
   Desde hace ocho años, Don Emilio se encuentra al frente de un taller de Motos donde también tiene venta de repuestos para motos. En dicho rubro se inició con un pequeño ahorro con el que contaba de su antiguo empleo en donde se desempeñaba como mecánico de motos para otro taller. En su taller recibe la ayuda de su hermano y un empleado más que le ayuda, para ofrecer los que exige la clientela. 
 Actualmente ya cuenta con una clientela bien formada gracias a su personalizada atención y de buena calidad.
Como sueño personal desea ampliar el negocio de venta de repuestos, teniendo en cuenta que este rubro lleva mucho capital. 
   El cliente solicita el crédito para la compra de Repuestos.
texts.en:
Señor Emilio Falcón is 31 years old, and for 4 years he has lived with his wife, Señora Liduvina Cañete, who is 25 years old. The couple has one 2-year-old son. For the past 8 years, Don Emilio has been in charge of a garage for motorcycle repair, where they also conduct sales of spare parts for motorcycles. He started his business with a small savings from his old job, where he worked as a motorcycle mechanic for another garage. In his new garage, he receives help from his brother and an additional employee, so that they can meet the demand of their customers. Today he services a solid clientele thanks to his personalized attention and the good quality of his work. A personal dream of his is to grow the spare parts sales side of his business, bearing in mind that this side of the business generates a lot of income. Don Emilio requests this loan for the purchase of spare motorcycle parts for him to sell.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Lenhart, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Para la compra de repuestos para motos.

loans.name: Socorro Paz

texts.es: Socorro Paz López tiene la edad de 57 años, su estado civil es soltera, Doña Socorro no tiene hijos. La actividad económica de Socorro es la venta de comida. Hace más de 10 años que se dedica a este negocio. Doña Socorro es una mujer muy emprendedora, y con este negocio ha hecho muchas cosas, porque con el mismo negocio ha logrado  realizarles mejoras a su vivienda. Los propósitos de Socorro son de salir adelante con su negocio. El financiamiento es destinando para capital de trabajo y así realizar compra de arroz, frijoles, aceite, refrescos naturales, queso, repollo y otros. El sueño de Socorro mejorar el servicio brindado a sus clientes para que estos queden satisfechos con su comida.
texts.en:
Socorro Paz López is 57 years old and single with no children. She has been selling food for more than ten years. She is a very enterprising woman, and has been able to do many things thanks to her business, including make home improvements. Soccoro wants to get ahead in life with her business. She will use the money from this loan as working capital to buy rice, beans, oil, natural drinks, cheese, cabbage and other ingredients. Socorro's dream is to improve her customer service in order to leave her customers satisfied with their meals.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy rice, cheese, oil, beans, cabbage and natural drinks

loans.name: Moses

texts.en: Moses K. is 29 years old. He is single and lives independently. He lives alone in a rented apartment in a town called Kofiase. It is a farming/trading community near Dormaa, the district capital, in the Brong Ahafo region. He takes care of some younger siblings. Moses is a trader of hardware such as cement, plywood, nails, roofing sheets, etc. He sells in a store on one of the streets in his community. Moses procures his wares from suppliers in the big cities. He wants a loan to procure materials such as plywood, foam, nails, etc., in bulk. He has been in business for one year. He is hoping to expand his business and save for his future before he gets married.

loans.use: To buy hardware

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To grow peanuts

loans.name: Together As One Group

texts.en:
This is Confort C., Cecilia C., and Hawa M.. They call their group Together as One. They are all local entrepreneurs in Waterloo, a small town twenty miles from Freetown. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are requesting from SMT. Each of them is requesting Le 500,000. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, both in terms of size and quality. Consequently they can make better a profit and improve on their standards of living.

Confort (pictured on the left) is the leader of this group. She is forty-six years old. She was born in Koya, about twelve miles from Waterloo. She is married to a teacher and they have five children. One of their children is in college and the rest are in secondary schools. Confort sells market food like palm-oil (the most popular cooking oil), pepper, rice, and many more items in Waterloo market. She has been a businesswoman for more than fourteen years.

loans.use: To expand her business selling food in the market.

loans.name: Eusebio

texts.es:
El señor Eusebio Céspedes tiene 50 años de edad, es separado y tiene 8 hijos, actualmente está acompañado con la Sra. Leani Navarro con la cual tiene una hija de 1 año llamada Noelia.
 El cliente se dedica a la venta de mercaderías en forma ambulante hace más de 12 años, trabajó 10 años como empleado y con su liquidación inició su propia micro empresa. 
 El ideal que aspira el cliente, es tener un local propio para realizar sus ventas y así ampliar su negocio, y este préstamo le ayudará a acercarse más a ese ideal ya que realizará la compra de más mercaderías a buen precio para volver a venderlas y así aumentar sus ganancias 
Sueña con un país con mayor seguridad y fuentes de trabajo.
texts.en:
Mr. Eusebio Céspedes is 50 years old and separated with eight children. He is currently living with his partner, Mrs. Leani Navarro, with whom he has a one-year-old daughter named Noelia. For the past twelve years, Eusebio has been selling merchandise on the street. He had been working as an employee for ten years, and with his severance pay he launched his own micro-business. Eusebio's goal is to expand his business by opening his own store to sell his merchandise. This loan will help him get closer to achieving this goal, since he will use the loan money to buy more merchandise at a low price and resell that merchandise to earn more in profits. He dreams of living in a safer country with better job opportunities.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy women's and men's athletic shoes

loans.name: Hagar

texts.en:
Hagar K. is thirty-eight years old. She is married and has given birth to four children, one son and three daughters. According to her, some of her children are in the junior high school while others are in the primary school. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a town called Kofiase, a farming and trading community near the district capital of Dormaa in the Brong Ahafo region.

Hagar's husband is a professional carpenter and she is a trader. She trades in second-hand women's clothing. Hagar sells by hawking locally and also treks to other towns to sell. She procures bales of textiles from Dormaa. She has been in business for six years and wants a loan to procure more textiles in bulk. She is hopeful that she can expand her business and give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To buy second hand clothing in bulk.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To grow cassava

loans.name: Jorge Fausto

texts.es: Jorge Fausto P. M. tiene la edad de 55 años, su estado civil es soltero. Don Jorge tiene 1 hijo y estudia. La actividad económica de Jorge es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 8 años de dedicarse a este negocio. Jorge ha tenido otros negocios los cuales ha venido dejando por el hecho que no le dan los resultados esperados, por lo que decidió dedicarse a la venta de mercadería. Los propósitos de Jorge son de proporcionarles la satisfacción a sus clientes. El dinero que solicita es para capital de trabajo por lo que ropa interior, calzado, perfumes y otros. El deseo de Jorge es seguir adelante con su negocio ya que el es un hombre muy trabajador.
texts.en:
Jorge Fausto P. M. is 55 years of age, and he is single. Don Jorge has 1 son, who is in school. Jorge's economic activity is the sale of general goods. He has worked in this business for more than 8 years. In the past, Jorge has tried other businesses, all of which he eventually left because they did not provide him with the success he had hoped for. This pushed him to the decision to work in general sales. Jorge's goal is to adapt his inventory to his customers' desires in order to better satisfy them. The money that he requests will be capital to buy merchandise such as underwear, footwear, perfume, and other such basic items. Because he is a very hard worker, Jorge wants very much to develop and grow his business.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Lenhart, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Yawavi

texts.fr: Agricultrice très dynamique et courageuse, Mme Yawavi N. est née en 1967 à Adzralakopé. Mariée et mère de sept (07) enfants, elle pratique la culture du mais, activité qui lui procure les revenus nécessaires pour prendre en charge les dépenses de son ménage et la scolarisation de ses enfants sa famille. Aujourd’hui ses rendements diminuent à cause de l’appauvrissement de ses sols qui sont intensément utilisés. Elle sollicite un crédit pour acheter les engrais pour fertiliser les sols en vue d’accroître ses rendements et ses revenus.
texts.en:
A very energetic and courageous farmer, Ms. Yawavi N. was born in 1967 in Adzralakopé. She is married and the mother of seven. She grows corn, a business that brings in the revenues necessary for her to cover household expenses and the schooling costs for the children. Today, her crop yields are declining because of the poor soil, which is intensely used. She's requesting a loan to buy manure to fertilize the soil with the goal of increasing her yields and her revenues.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To grow corn

loans.name: Salt Sellers Group

texts.en:
This is Isatu K., Isha K., Isatu T. and Abu K.. They named their group “Salt Sellers”. They are all local entrepreneurs in the small town of Waterloo, twenty miles from Freetown.

This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are requesting from SMT/Kiva, each of them requesting a loan of Le 500,000. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses both in terms of size and quality. Consequently they can make better profit and improve their standards of living. 

Isatu (right) is the leader of this group. She is thirty-five years of age and was born in Makeni City, in northern Sierra Leone. She is married to a vehicle driver and they have three children who are attending primary and secondary schools.

Isatu sells both in wholesale and in retail. She sells salt in Waterloo market and has been a businesswoman for more than twenty years. She will invest this loan into her business. A bag of salt usually costs her Le 50,000.

loans.use: To invest in her salt business

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet M. is forty years old. She is married and has given birth to two children: one son and one daughter. According to Janet, one of her children is in the junior high school while the other is in teacher training college.

She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a town called Kofiase, a farming/trading community near Dormaa, the district capital, in the Brong Ahafo region. Her husband is a farmer.

Janet is a trader. She trades in charcoal and firewood and supplies retailers and food vendors in her community. She also treks to sell in other towns. She procures charcoal from nearby communities.

Janet has been in business for three years and wants a loan to procure charcoal and firewood in bulk. She is hopeful to expand her business and give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To procure charcoal and firewood in bulk

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena K. is fifty–five years old. She is widowed and has given birth to four children, two sons and two daughters. She says some are currently in the senior high while others are in the junior high schools. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a town called Kofiase. It is a farming/trading community near Dormaa, the district capital, in the Brong Ahafo region.

Abena is a trader. She trades in game meat. She procures the bush meat from hunters in her community and nearby communities. She supplies to local restaurant operators in her community. Abena has been in business for four years and wants a loan to procure game meat in bulk. She hopes to expand her business and give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To buy game meat

loans.name: Julio

texts.es:
El Señor Julio Velázquez de 41 años de edad esta casado hace 19 años con la señora Juana Caballero de 45 años, el matrimonio tiene dos hijos de 17 y 13 años de edad, el primero está en el primero de la media y el otro en el quinto  grado. 
El señor Julio hace siete años que se dedica a la venta de verduras y frutas, también comercializa productos agrícolas como mandioca, batata, maíz y otros que el mismo produce porque el señor siempre se dedica a la agricultura, sus mercaderías la comercializa por la zona de Pastoreo y J. Eulogio Estigarribia para eso cuenta con un carrito movido a Caballo, ya cuenta con clientela formada a quien le provee en forma periódica sus productos. 
El cliente solicita el préstamo para la compra de cebolla, locote, tomate, papa, naranja, banana y en gran parte utilizarlo en la agricultura ya que él produce gran parte de lo que comercializa. De esta forma ofrecer variedad y calidad de sus productos  a sus clientes
texts.en:
Julio Velásquez, 41, has been married for nineteen years to Juana Caballero, 45. They have two children ages seventeen and thirteen. The first is in the first year of middle school, and the other is in fifth grade. For seven years Julio has been selling vegetables and fruits. He sells other agricultural products like cassava, yams, corn, and others that he grows himself. He has always been a farmer. He sells his merchandise in the Pastoreo and J. Eulogio Estigarribia zone. He uses a horse drawn cart to do this. He has a customer base that he periodically provides with his products. He is asking for a loan to buy onions, peppers, tomatoes, potatoes, oranges, bananas and to use primarily in his farming. He produces the biggest part of what he sells. This way he will offer his customers variety and quality.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fruit and vegtables like onions, peppers, tomatoes, potatoes, oranges, and  bananas

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama A. is 42 years old. She is married and has three children; one just completed the senior high school, but the others are still schooling. She lives with her husband in her matrimonial home at Dorma Ahenkro. She is an achiever and a resourceful young woman. She loves selling goods, the business through which she makes a living.

Ama trades in crate of eggs in the community market. She has been in business for four years. She buys her stock of eggs in bulk from the surrounding poultry farmers and retail to her customers. For lack of adequate working capital, she is not able to pick enough stock to make enough profit to support her family. She wants to use part of the profit to support her kid’s education. She would be grateful for your assistance because with the loan, she wants to purchase a bulk supply of crates of egg to enable her scale up her sales. She belongs to a village bank called ‘Prosperity’.

loans.use: To purchase bulk crates of eggs.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary B. is twenty–six years old. She is married and has given birth to one child, a son who is yet to start school. She lives with her husband and her son in a rented apartment in a town called Kofiase. It is a farming/trading community near Dormaa, the district capital, in the Brong Ahafo region. Her husband is a teacher by profession.

Mary is a trader. She trades in eggs. She procures crates of eggs from poultry farms in her community and nearby communities at affordable prices and sells them in the local market. She also treks to other towns to sell. Mary distributes some eggs to retailers and beverage sellers. She has been in business for four years and wants a loan to procure crates of eggs in bulk. She hopes to expand her business and give her child the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To buy crate of eggs

loans.name: Gara Tie Dyeing Group

texts.en:
This is Aminata K., Gladys C., and Isatu K.. They named their group Gara Tie Dyeing. They are all local entrepreneurs in the small town of Waterloo, twenty miles from Freetown. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are requesting from SMT/Kiva. Each of them is requesting a loan of Le 500,000.00. With this loan, they will be able to increase the sizes and qualities of their businesses and consequently make better profit and improve their standards of living. 

Aminata (middle) is the leader of this group. Animata is forty-seven years of age. She was born Kambia, in northern Sierra Leone. She is married to a businessman and they have three children. One of their children (a daughter) is married, one is in primary school, and the other is in secondary school. Aminata has been a businesswoman for over twenty years. She sells dyed t-shirts. She buys bales of second-hand t-shirts, dyes (or gara) them, and sells them.

loans.use: Invest in her t-shirt business

loans.name: Angela Del Socorro

texts.es: Ángela del Socorro M. tiene la edad de 51 años de edad, su estado civil es soltera. Doña Ángela tiene 2 hijos y todos estudian. La actividad económica es una pulpería. Hace más de 6 años que se dedica a este negocio. Doña Ángela inicio este negocio en su vivienda con muy pocos productos, a ella siempre le ha gustado este tipo de negocio, ya que se relaciona con sus vecinos. Sus propósitos son que sus clientes se encuentren satisfechos con su servicio. El financiamiento es destinado para capital de trabajo y comprar golosinas, refrescos naturales y un poco de granos básicos. El sueño de Ángela es obtener un restaurante que sea propio.
texts.en:
Ángela del Socorro M. is a single, 51-year-old woman. She is the mother of two children who are both in school. For six years she has been making a living from a small store she has in her house. Ms. Ángela started this business with very little stock and says she has always liked this type of job because she can socialize with her neighbors. Her goals are to keep her clients satisfied. The loan is for working capital to buy sweets, natural drinks, and some basic grains. Angela dreams of having her own restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: capital de trabajo

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en: Yaa T. is a married mother of seven children; two are currently in school. She is a 46-year-old trader. She trades in handkerchiefs and scarfs. Handkerchiefs and scarfs are very useful for wiping sweat and are a head-covering for many Christians.  For lack of adequate working capital, Yaa buys a small stock of handkerchiefs and scarfs and sells them through hawking. She believes this loan will enable her to grow her business to the expected level. With the loan, she wants to purchase a bulk quantity of the scarfs. She hopes to use part of her profit to provide her children with a quality education. She belongs to a village bank called ‘Prosperity’.

loans.use: To purchase handkerchiefs and scarfs in bulk

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort K., 28, a married mother of three children who are in school, has been hawking washing detergents such as Unilever washing powder, soaps, bleaches etc. for a year now. She balances her stock on her head and walks miles to her customers' doorsteps to sell her products and is requesting this loan to inject more capital into the business so it can grow. Comfort plans to use the loan to increase her stock of detergent supplies in order to earn more income to provide her children with a good education. She belongs to a village bank called ‘Prosperity’.

loans.use: To buy more detergent supplies for her business.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret A. is thirty-six years old. She is married and has given birth to five children, three sons and two daughters. She says they are in junior high and primary schools. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a town called Kofiase. It is a farming/trading community near Dormaa, the district capital, in the Brong Ahafo region. Margaret’s husband is a farmer while she is a petty trader.

Margaret sells maize. She procures bags of maize from the farmers in nearby communities and sells in the local market to retailers. She also treks to other towns to sell. Margaret has been in business for ten years and wants a loan to procure bags of maize in bulk. She is hopeful to expand her business and give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.en:
Jonathan A. is forty years old. He is married with three kids who are currently in school. Jonathan is a dealer in electric car parts like speakers, transistors, flashing lights, tail lights etc. He works hard at providing good service relation for his customers. He buys his supplies from importers at wholesale prices and uses them to service his customers' cars.

Jonathan requests the loan to enable him to procure increased stock of car parts. He hopes to increase his savings to expand his shop to include car interior decoration parts. Jonathan belongs to a village bank called ‘Promise’.

loans.use: To procure an increased stock of car parts

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en:
Dorcas A. is forty years old. She is married and has given birth to five children, three sons and two daughters. She says they are in junior high and primary schools. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a town called Kofiase. It is a farming/trading community near Dormaa, the district capital, in the Brong Ahafo region. Her husband is a farmer while she is a petty trader.

Dorcas trades in maize. She procures bags of maize from the farmers in the nearby communities and sells in the local market to retailers. She also treks to other towns to sell. She has been in business for over ten years and wants a loan to procure bags of maize in bulk. Dorcas is hopeful to expand her business and give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize in bulk

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James T. is 35 years old; he is married and father of two children. Currently both his children are schooling. James says he is blessed with God-given talent to heal the sick and most especially those that are suffering from skin rashes like boils, pimples etc. Currently James is a specialist in herbal medicine with specialization in skin rashes. He prepares his medicine with the use of some special tree bark and special leaves from the bush which are known to him alone. Through that, he has healed lots of people with skin rashes.

James has three years' experience in herbal ointment medicine. He used to sell his ointments in paper but now he has designed a smaller container in which he packages the herbal ointment medicine. In view of his performance and the quality of his medicine, lots of people have come to him for treatment. Fortunately those that came and had their healing are doing well.

James needs the loan to buy production materials like containers to package the ointment. With your help he believes others will have their treatment and will be happy too. He belongs to the village bank called ‘Nana Doma’.

loans.use: to buy shea butter for processing of herbal medicine

loans.name: Talananeh Group

texts.en:
These are Marie K., Mabinty B., Nenneh B., Fatmata K., and Kadiatu K.. They named their group "Talaneneh". They are all local entrepreneurs in Waterloo, a small town twenty miles from Freetown. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are requesting from SMT/Kiva. Each of them is requesting a loan of Le 500,000. With this loan, they will be able to increase the sizes and qualities of their businesses and consequently make better profit and improve their standards of living.

Marie (right) is the leader of this group. Marie is thirty-seven years of age. She was born in Port Loko, in northern Sierra Leone. She is married with two children who are still in primary school. Marie sells palm-oil (the most popular cooking oil), gari (a food produced by grinding cassava) and palm kernels. She has been a businesswoman for over seventeen years now.

loans.use: Invest in her business

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet A. is thirty-nine years old. She is widowed and has given birth to three children, two sons and one daughter. She says they are in junior high and primary schools. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a town called Kofiase. It is a farming/trading community near Dormaa, the district capital, in the Brong Ahafo region.

Janet is a petty trader. She trades in maize. She procures bags of maize from farmers in the nearby communities and sells in the local market to retailers. Janet also treks to other towns to sell. She has been in business for six years and wants a loan to procure bags of maize in bulk. Janet is hopeful to expand her business and give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize

loans.name: Samuel Escalante

texts.es: Samuel Escalante A. tiene la edad de 48 años, su estado civil es soltero. Samuel tiene 2 hijos y todos estudian. La actividad económica de Samuel es una pulpería. Hace más de 4 años que se dedica a este negocio. Don Samuel tiene ubicada su pulpería, en la comunidad de la carreta, el negocio nació cuando Samuel  se encontraba en momentos difíciles económicamente y además sus hijos tenían que estudiar y fue esto lo que le llevo a tomar la decisión de establecer una pulpería. Sus propósitos son de incrementar su inventario. El financiamiento es destinado para capital de trabajo para la compra de golosinas, refrescos naturales, pan, gaseosas y granos básicos. Los sueños de Samuel son de construir un local adecuado para acondicionar su negocio en que tenga mas espacio para mostrar todos sus productos.
texts.en:
Samuel Escalante A. is a single, 48-year-old man. Samuel has two children who are both students. Samuel has a small store in his home, which is how he makes a living. He has had this business for more than four years. Samuel decided to start this business because he found himself in hard times and also his children had to study. He hopes to increase his inventory. Therefore, this loan is meant for working capital to buy sweets, natural drinks, bread, soft drinks, and basic grains. Samuel’s dream is to build a place with air conditioning for his business, that is bigger so he can display all of his merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is 38 years old; she is married and mother of four children. Her husband is a farmer. All her children are in school, possibly because of government free compulsory education. She is a very hard-working young mother who works all day by dressing hair and selling eggs to provide for her children. Janet operates hair dressing salon in front of her house and also sells crates of eggs there.

Currently she concentrates more resources on the eggs sales because patronization of the hair salon has been low. She has been in the egg business for 22 years now. She takes stocks of eggs from the poultry farmers and retails to her customers at retail prices. Demand for her goods is on the high side but she doesn't have adequate cash to buy more. She is therefore appealing to you for your support to buy more eggs. It is her desire to help her husband in taking care of the children's education needs. She belongs to the village bank called ‘Promise’.

loans.use: To buy a bulk supply of eggs and hair extensions, etc.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana K. is fifty-six years old. She is divorced and has given birth to five children, four sons and one daughter. According to her, one of her children is in the university while the others are in senior high and junior high schools. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a town called Kofiase. Kofiase is a farming/trading community near Dormaa, the district capital, in the Brong Ahafo region.

Susana is a petty trader. She trades in charcoal and also sells provisions on a table top. She supplies the charcoal to retailers and food vendors in her community. She also treks to sell in other towns. Susana procures charcoal from nearby communities. She has been in business for over twenty years and wants a loan to procure charcoal and provisions in bulk. She is hopeful to expand her business and give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To procure bags of charcoal in bulk

loans.name: Grupo Solidario Los Mangles Group

texts.es: Las señoras del Grupo Solidario Los Mangles esta conformado por la Señora Victoria Nicolasa Pérez P. tiene la edad de 40 años, es una mujer esforzada que ha sacado adelante a sus 5 hijos de los cuales cuatro de ellos aun estudian y dependen de ella.Victoria se dedica al destace de cerdos desde hace 10 años, este negocio esta ubicado en su casa de habitación, luego de dedicarse a la crianza de cerdos destazo uno para vender la carne, al ver que este negocio le dio resultado resolvió poner en su vivienda el negocio de destace.Con el préstamo que le otorgue Fundación León 2000 tiene pensado aumentar la crianza y destace de cerdos. Y Carla del Socorro García Rodríguez tiene la edad de 40 años, su estado civil es casada. La actividad económica de de Carla es una pulpería. Carla inicio este negocio hace 15 años que se dedica a este negocio, ella inicio vendiendo golosinas, y con el tiempo las personas comenzaron a pedirles otros productos. Con el financiamiento invertirá en su negocio. sus deseos son de seguir trabajando con Fundación León 2000 ya es por medio de ella que ayudan las organizaciones amigas.
texts.en:
Victoria Nicolasa Pérez P. and Carla del Socorro García Rodríguez are the women who make up Grupo Solidario Los Mangles.
Victoria is 40 years old and a very hard-working woman who has raised 5 children, 4 of whom still attend school and depend on her. Victoria has worked as a pork butcher for 10 years from her home. Having only raised pigs she decided to try selling the meat of one of them; seeing that this business was profitable she decided to set up a butcher’s shop in her home. With this loan granted through Fundación León 2000, she plans to increase the number of pigs she raises and butchers.
Carla del Socorro García Rodríguez is 40 years old and married. Carla runs a small grocery store. She started off selling sweets 15 years ago, but as time went on people began to ask for other products. She will invest the funding in her business. She wishes to continue working with Fundación León 2000 since it is through them that partner organizations are able to help.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en:
Felicia T. is 40 years old and a petty trader. She is married and mother of five children. Three of her children are currently in school, whilest the other two are learning a trade. Her husband is a cocoa farmer and crop farmer. She trades in bunches of plantains on top of a table in the local market of Dormaa in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana where she lives.

Felicia says that through this business, she has endeavored to support her eldest son who is about to finish senior high school. She takes stocks of plantains from the farmers and retails them to her customers. She needs the loan to buy more bunches of plantains. With the loan she believes she can save more to pay for her children's education, and she would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: to buy increased stocks of plantains

loans.name: Rodrigo

texts.es:
El señor Rodrigo I. M. es comerciante el vende accesorios para automóvil desde hace cinco años el negocio es llamado “Lavado y accesorios 60 segundos”. El esta solicitando un préstamo para surtir mercancía como focos, esteros, bocinas, vistas para autos, etc. Su deseo es cuando el cliente recurra a su negocio encuentre lo que busque y que se pueda llevar otra cosa y así el cree que tendrá mas ventas.
Su esposa también se dedica al negocio ella es vendedora de producto para control de peso y entre los dos sostienen su casa y desean tener hijos pero antes de tenerlos quieren asegurar su economía.
texts.en:
Señor Rodrigo I. M. is a businessman who sells automobile accessories. For 5 years, he has run his business, called "60 Second Wash and Accessories." Rodrigo is requesting a loan to stock inventory like headlights, stereos, horns, custom interiors, etc. He hopes that when a customer enters his store they find what they are looking for, and to be able to carry more items. This way, he believes he will be able to sell more.

Rodrigo's wife also devotes her time to a business. She sells weight control products, and between the two they are able to sustain their home. They hope to have children, but first they want to be financially secure.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Novesky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stock his store

loans.name: Augustina

texts.en:
Augustina A. is 44 years old, married and mother of five children who are in school. Her husband is a teacher at Dorma primary school. Currently one just completed senior high school and the second is still in junior high school. She has been a food vendor for eight years. She prepares and sells rice and stew and she has also added beans and gari to her menu. This is a delicacy many Ghanaians enjoy every day either as breakfast, lunch, or dinner. She also sells fried rice.

Augustina's business is doing well and she wants to expand her operations to serve more customers. With the loan, she wants to buy more beans, grains, vegetables, rice and assorted meat for her operation. She hopes this loan will help her increase her savings to improve her family's well being. She would be very grateful for your assistance. She belongs to the village bank called Promise.

loans.use: To buy bags of dried maize grains, rice, vegetables, assorted meats, etc

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome A. is 44 years old. She is married and has given birth to four children, all males. She says some are in senior high while others are in junior high and primary school. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a town called Kofiase. Kofiase is a farming/trading community near Dormaa, the district capital, in the Brong Ahafo region. Her husband runs a provision store in the community.

Salome is a food vendor. She cooks and sells rice and yam with stew. She prepares the food in her house and sells on a tabletop at the market square. She procures her ingredients from the local market. She has been in business for four years now and wants a loan to procure bags of rice and tubers of yam in bulk. She is hoping to expand her business and give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To procure bags of rice

loans.name: Akosua

texts.en:
Akosua O. started her fish sales a year ago in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana. Akosua prepares and serves her customers with very tasty and good quality fish and because of that many customers buy from her stand. She buys stocks of fish from the fishermen and smokes them. She has a large customer base which travels from other parts of the community to buy her fish. She has also added the sale of cooking spices to her inventory to attract more customers.

She is now 48 years old, married, and the mother of two children. All her children have completed senior high school. She wants to use the loan to increase her stock of assorted fishes and make increased sales. She will use the additional income to support her children's education and her business' growth. She belongs to the village bank called Promise.

loans.use: For fish to cook and sell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary K. is fifty-two years old. She is married and has four children, one son and three daughters. She says some are in senior high school while others are in a polytechnic. She lives with her children and husband in a family house in a town called Kofiase. Kofiase is a farming/trading community near Dormaa, the district capital, in the Brong Ahafo region. Her husband is a farmer.

Mary is a food vendor. She prepares and sells kenkey. Kenkey is prepared from corn dough. It is served hot with ground pepper and fried fish. She prepares the food in her house of residence and hawks to sell in her community. She procures bags of maize from the nearby communities. Mary also deals in all kinds of utensils. She has been in business for over ten years and wants a loan to procure bags of maize in bulk. She is hoping to expand her business and give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To buy maize in bulk

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort A. is a forty-four-year-old woman. She is married with six children, three of whom are in school. She lives with her family at Dorma Ahenkro in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana. She is a food vendor and sells banku with fried fish. Banku is prepared from milled maize grains and it is taken with hot pepper or soup.

She has many customers since it is enjoyed by many Ghanaians as breakfast, lunch and supper. She wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials like bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood. She hopes to raise increased income to support her children education. She has been in business for four years now. She belongs to the village loan group called ‘Promise’.

loans.use: For raw materials to cook banku

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret P. is 54 years old. She is married and has given birth to three children, one son and two daughters. She says all are in senior high or junior high school. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a town called Kofiase. Kofiase is a farming/trading community near Dormaa, the district capital, in the Brong Ahafo region. Her husband is a farmer.

Margaret is a trader. She trades in gari, a food supplement from cassava dough. It is normally eaten with cooked beans mixed with palm oil. Margaret buys the gari from producers in nearby villages and supplies to food vendors and retailers in the big cities. She has been in this business for one year now and wants a loan to procure bags of gari in bulk. Margaret is hoping to expand her business and give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To procure gari

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en:
