She is 30 years old and has a son that is still in school. Her husband is in military service in Lima. She makes a living selling clothing door to door, she does not have a space from which to sell. Her first loan was for 300 new soles, two years ago. She bought some more outfits and capitalized her business. Her husband helps her with the business by sending her merchandise from Lima. With this loan of 1,200 new soles, she will purchase 2 dozens pairs of shoes, 3 packages of shirts and pants. During the short time that she has been with Manuela Ramos, she has felt happy with the help that Manuela Ramos gives to the women in getting ahead, helping their husbands and children and economics of running a home.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of shoes and clothing for resale.

loans.name: Javier Antonio

texts.es: El señor Javier Antonio C., tiene la edad de 40 años, habita en el barrio San Pedro en la comunidad de Ticuantepe, junto a su esposa la cual trabaja como domestica en una casa particular , para apoyarlo con los gastos del hogar , ellos tiene dos hijos uno de 14 años que actualmente estudia y el otro de 7 años que estudia su primaria , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida de su pequeños y apoyarlo siempre es sus estudios, don Javier , desde hace cinco años se dedica en  trabajos agrícolas , el inicio esta actividad con sus propios esfuerzos su esposa lo apoya para poder salir hacia delante con sus hijos , la mayor dificultad es la falta de financiamiento . Con el préstamo va a comprar fertilizantes e insumos para mejorar el cultivo y poder vender a buen precio en el mercado.
texts.en:
Don Javier Antonio C. is 40 years old. He lives in the neighborhood of San Pedro in the community of Ticuantepe, with his wife, who works as a housekeeper to help him out with the family expenses. They have two sons, a 14 year-old student and a 7 year-old who attends elementary school. His family plans are to improve living conditions for his little ones and support them with their studies. Don Javier has been a farmer for five years, he began this activity with his own efforts, supported by his wife, in order to get ahead with his children. The most difficult part is lack of financing. With the loan he will buy fertilizers and farm supplies to improve crops and be able to sell at a good price on the market.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase farm supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Rita Liseth

texts.es: Rita Lisseth esta solicitando refinanciamiento de su 2do crédito para construir una habitacion, labora desde hace 2 años como docente de Educación primaria, inicio dando clase a niños de un centro infantil en la zona # 7 de Nueva Guinea; Rita  es madre de un niño de 2 añitos de edad, a pesar que no tiene la ayuda del papa de su hijo ha luchado para que a el no le falte nada, se caracteriza por ser una buena maestra, humilde,  responsable, honesta y muy trabajadora, despues que llega de dar clases termina de hacer los quehaceres del hogar ya que su salario es poco y no le alcanza para pagar una empleada domestica, con este pretende contruir un cuarto y asi mejorar sus condiciones de vida y de su familia, actualmente esta estudiando su segundo año en ciencias de la Educacion en la Universidad URACCAN,  su sueño es seguir estudiando, ir mejorando su vivienda con cada crédito otorgado por AFODENIC, salud para su familia y estabilidad laboral.
texts.en:
Rita Lisseth is requesting refinancing of her 2nd loan to build a room. She has been working for 2 years as an elementary school teacher. She began teaching children at a children's center in zone #7 of Nueva Guinea. Rita is a mother of a 2 year-old boy and in spite of not receiving support from the boy's father she has struggled to fulfill his needs. She is a good teacher, humble, responsible, honest, and very hard-working. After teaching she does her chores as her salary is low and she cannot affort to pay domestic help. With the loan she will build a room to improve her family's living conditions. At the present she is studying the second year of Science of Education at the university URACCAN. It is her dream to continue studying, improve her house with each loan from AFODENIC, health for her family, and work stability.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Building a room.

loans.name: Francisca Maria

texts.es: la Señorita  Francisca Maria  es originaria de la comunidad de Juchanep a nueve Kilometros de la ciudad ella manifiesta que necesita un credito para ampliar su negocio ya que hoy tiene dos operarias y necesita contratar a otros dos personas  la Señorita ademas de trabajar en las artesania ser una persona profesiona  maestra de eduacion primaria, en la cual esta solicitando su plaza en el gobierno miestra que esto pasa ella se decia a la elaboracion y venta de su producto en los municipios de Totonicapan, Salcaj Quetzaltenango
texts.en:
Miss Francisca María is from the community of Juchanep, located nine kilometers from the city. She requests a loan to increase her business. She has two workers and needs to hire two more. Doña Francisca, apart from working in crafts, is a professional, an elementary school teacher presently requesting a position with the government. Meanwhile she manufactures and sells her products in the municipalities of Totonicapan, Salcaj Quetzaltenango.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase work capital

loans.name: Bismarck Antonio

texts.es: Don Bismarck  labora como guarda de seguridad en la escuela Francisco Aaron Joce desde hace 6 años  este cliente tiene dos hijos  el mayor de 11  años estudia su tercer grado y la niña menor de 7 añitos estudia 2 do grado de educación primaria, está solicitando refinanciamiento de su 4to crédito para invertirlo en la construcción de una habitación y asi tener mejor comodidad en su casa,  en los dias libre  trabaja como agricultor cultivando la tierra para asi mejorar las condiciones de vida de el y su familia, su esposa se encarga de los quehaceres del hogar, tiene munchos deseos de superación personal se caracteriza por se muy humilde, trabajador, honesto  bien responsable con sus deberes, a pesar que son una familia de escasos recursos economicos son una familia  muy unida,  Su sueño es  tener una casa con mejores condiciones como todo cuidadano aspira, tener salud,trabajo y que su hijos estudien para que lleguen hacer personas de bien.
texts.en:
Don Bismarck has been working as a security guard for the school Francisco Aaron Joce for 6 years. He has two children, the oldest, 11, is in third grade and the girl, 7 years-old, is in second grade. He is requesting refinancing of his 4th loan to be invested in building a room and thus improve the comfort of home. On his free time he works as a farmer to improve his family's living conditions. His wife is responsible for the chores. He wishes to achieve personal improvement, he is humble, hard-working, honest, and very responsible with his duties. In spite of being a family of restricted economic resources, it is a very united family. His dream to to have a house with better conditions, which every citizen wants, have health, work, and that his children study to become good individuals.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a room.

loans.name: Nubia Del Carmen

texts.es: Nubia del Carmen  está solicitando refinanciamiento de su cuarto crédito para Construcción de una habitacion, trabaja como docente desde hace 5 años en la Escuela Francisco Aaron Joce ,  tiene un hijo de 6 añitos de edad estudiando 1er grado en la escuela donde ella labora, Nubia es una mujer muy  responsable, honesta, trabajadora, vive en colonia Naciones a 28 km de Nueva Guinea donde la población cada dia crece mas; la profesora Nubia vive con su mama la cual se encarga del cuido de ella ysiempre esta pendiente de comprarle sus alimentos y  medicamentos de su anciana madre y  actualmente  esta estudiando una licenciatura en ciencias sociales  en la Univesidad  URACCAN Recinto Nueva Guinea,    su sueño es   seguir  estudiando, salud y en el futuro tener una casa bonita   y tener estabilidad laboral para así ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
Nubia del Carmen is requesting refinancing of her fourth loan to build a room. She has been working as a teacher for 5 years at the school Francisco Aaron Joce. She has a 6 year-old son who is in 1st grade in the school where she is working. Nubia is very responsible, honest, and hard-working. She lives in the neighborhood of Naciones, 28 km from Nueva Guinea, where population is in constant growth. Mrs. Nubia lives with her mother, and is responsible for her well-being, always paying attention to buying her ancient mother's food and medicines. At the present she is studying a bachelor's degree in social science at the University URACCAN in Nueva Guinea. It is her dream to continue studying, have health, and in the future a nice house as well as work stability to be able to help her family.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a room

loans.name: Heidy

texts.es:
HEIDY VASQUEZ D. V., pertenece al Banco Comunal “LORETO” vive en el Jr comandante suares Nº 620, en la ciudad D. Pucallpa, tiene 52 años D. edad, tiene 1 hija y su esposo es mecánico.

Ella y su hija trabajan juntas en el negocio D. preparación D. comidas tales como juanes, tacacho y pescado asado, esto lo hacen por la tardes y noches. Por las mañanas venD. frutas. Con el primer préstamo D. S/. 300.00 le permitió  implementar este último negocio.

La buena atención que la caracteriza ha hecho que tenga muchos clientes.
Con este préstamo D. S/. 1,000.00 Nuevos Soles,  lo invertirá en la compra D. madera para hacer arreglos en su local y pintarlo para tener una mejor presentación, además comprará mas frutas D. la Región.
 
Dice que Manuela Ramos es la única Institución con la que trabaja por los bajos intereses que tiene y la facilidad que les da al obtener un préstamo.
texts.en:
Heidy V. D. V. belongs to the Loreto Communal Bank. She lives on Comandante Suares Avenue in the city of Pucallpa. She is 52 years of age and has one daughter. Her husband is a mechanic. She and her daughter work together at her business of preparing meals such as "juanes" (rice and meat cooked in a banana leaf), "tacacho" (grilled plantain) and grilled fish. They do this in the afternoon and evening, and in the morning they sell fruit. With her first loan of 300 Sols she was able to get this business started. The good service which she is known for has brought her many customers. This loan of 1,000 New Sols will be used to buy lumber to fix up her shop and to paint it in order to have a better appearance. She will also buy locally grown fruits. She says that Manuela Ramos is the only institution that is working to proviD. low-interest loans and that makes it easy to obtain them.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy lumber and fruits.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
La señora Yolanda T. está agradecida por su gran apoyo que le brindaron con sus anteriores créditos. 
Ella está solicitando su cooperación para esté nuevo préstamo ya que desea invertir en el negocio más variedad de mercancía como (Verduras, Frutas y Lácteos), ya que sus clientes se lo están pidiendo que venda estos productos, que es el único negocio de la colonia.
Así tendrá más ingresos a su negocio y posterior mente para la familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Yolanda T. is grateful for all the support offered with previous loans. She is requesting your cooperation for this new loan as she wants to invest in a larger variety of goods for her business (vegetables, fruits, and dairy products). Her customers are already demanding that she sell these products, and her business is the only one in the neighborhood. This will increase revenue for her business and then her family.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Hopkins, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase goods.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es: La señora Maribel
texts.en: Mrs. Maribel

loans.use: To build a room on the top floor of the house.

loans.name: Aurora

texts.es:
A la vivienda de la señora Aurora E. le está haciendo falta los acabados del interior de un cuarto que es el de su hija que vive con ella.
Doña Aurora E. trabaja en limpieza en casa particular y su hija María De Los Ángeles Cura se dedica a la venta de ropa usada en el mismo domicilio, estos son los ingresos de la familia. 
Están solicitando el préstamo para poder realizar la mejora ya que en esté momento no cuentan con el dinero necesario y reparar la recamara.
texts.en:
At Mrs. Aurora E.'s house they are missing the interior finishings on her daughters room who lives with her. Mrs. Aurora E. works cleaning homes and her daughter María De Los Ángeles Cura sells used clothing at the same address, these make up the family income. They are requesting a loan to make improvements, as they currently do not have the necessary funds to repair the bedroom.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Hopkins, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Interior finishings in the bedroom.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia tiene 52 años, se caracteriza por su facilidad D. relacionarse con las personas y D. brindar  a sus hijos el cariño necesario por su parte y por su padre, ya que su pareja viaja mucho por su trabajo. La falta D. su compañero la ponía muy triste, y su deseo D. ocupar su tiempo en alguna actividad e incrementar sus ingresos económicos la motivaron a iniciar un negocio propio, el cual hizo posible gracias al dinero que su pareja le enviaba todos los meses, fue ahorrando hasta tener el capital necesario para abrir una tienda D. comestibles, donD. ahora viene trabajando desD. hace dos años. Este negocio logró animarla y asumir nuevas responsabilidades como comerciante fomentó en ella un espíritu comprometido con el progreso D. sus seres queridos. Ahora, Julia tiene pensado  incrementar su negocio con nueva mercadería, dando a su local una nueva imagen que atraiga a nuevos clientes, además cuenta con el espacio necesario para ampliar su bodega, la que quiere convertir en un minimarket, negocio que le ayudará a mejorar su calidad D. vida. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, y su permanencia le ayudó a mejorar sus relaciones con las personas, sobre todo con su grupo, quienes están trabajando D. manera unida con la finalidad D. mejorar la organización que conforman como banco comunal. Con los 1000 soles que solicita comprará mayor cantidad D. mercadería y un mueble para acomodar sus nuevos productos.
texts.en:
Julia is 52 years old and is characterized by her ease in relating to people and giving the necessary care to her kids on her part and their father's part, as her partner travels a lot for his job. She misses her companion and it makes her very sad. Her desire to occupy her time with some type of activity and to increase her income motivated her to start her own business, which was maD. possible by her partner sending her money every month. She saved the necessary capital to open a grocery store, where she has now been working for two years. This business has encouraged her to accept new responsibilities as a trader, and it fostered a spirit committed to the progress of her loved ones. Now, Julia has been thinking of expanding her business with new merchandise and giving the space a new image to attract new customers. Furthermore, she would like the store space to be larger and wants to convert it into a minimarket, the business would help improve their quality of life. This is her second loan with MFP, and it has helped to improve her relations with people, especially with this group, where everyone works in unity with the aim of improving the organization that makes up the village bank. With the requested 1000 soles loan she will buy most of the requested goods and furniture to accomodate new products.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Hopkins, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase in merchandise.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: Margarita está casada y tiene dos hijos por quienes trabaja muy duro, pues la satisfacción de sus necesidades es la prioridad en su vida. Este año empezó a vender productos de belleza, actividad que la obliga a salir a las calles para visitar a diversas personas que van haciéndole pedidos cada mes, pero debido a la lejanía de su casa no puede trasladarse todos los días al centro de la localidad, teniendo que hacerlo sólo los fines de semana. Trabaja con esmero para incrementar sus ingresos, los cuales, con el tiempo, le permitan cumplir sus deseos de abrir una bodega en su hogar, aprovechando que en la zona donde vive no cuentan con tiendas cercanas, oportunidad que no desea dejar pasar y que está segura tendrá gran acogida. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, y lo que le agrada de su banco comunal es la manera de trabajo, pues la responsabilidad y empeño son aspectos que caracterizan a sus compañeras. Los 600 soles que solicita le servirán para incrementar sus productos y aprovechar las ventas  por las festividades próximas a celebrar, como el día del padre.
texts.en:
Margarita is married and has two children for whom she works very hard, because their satisfaction and needs are the proirity in her life. This year she began to sell beauty products, an activity that obligates her to go into town and visit diverse people that are making monthly requests, but due to the remoteness of her home she cannot get to the center every day, she has only been able to do it on the weekends. She works diligently to earn more income, which over time will permit her to fulfill her desire to open a store in their home, taking advantage of living in an area where there are no nearby stores. This is an opportunity she does not want to pass up and it will surely have a great reception. This is her second loan with MFP, she likes the way the village bank works because the partners are characterized by responsibility and commitment. The 600 soles she requests will serve to build her products and to take advantage of sales for upcoming festivities to celebrate, such as father's day.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Hopkins, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase merchandise.

loans.name: Noemí

texts.es: Noemí es una joven que a sus 23 años tiene un hijo, por quien trata de ser padre y madre, ya que su pareja la abandonó; encontrando en sus padres el apoyo necesario para salir adelante junto a su hijo. Desde que se repuso del abandono de su pareja decidió trabajar para solventar los gastos de su pequeño hijo, por lo que sus padres le brindaron un espacio en su casa para iniciar un negocio. Ahora tiene una pequeña librería que viene funcionando desde hace 1 año, y en este corto tiempo le ha generado los ingresos necesarios para vivir, y sobre todo le está dando la posibilidad de ampliar y mejorar su local, en el cual están puestas todas sus esperanzas para progresar. Pero para lograr esto tuvo que pasar por muchos días de sacrificio y necesidades con su hijo, ya que las ganancias que tenían las invertía en la compra de nueva mercadería, y no les quedaba mucho para ellos. Pero ahora, Noemí está ambicionando tener una bazar, pero para ello tendrá que ambientar su local y construir su propia casa. Ella es nueva en MFP, este es su primer préstamo, y tiene muchas ganas de trabajar responsablemente junto a las señoras que conforman su grupo. Los 1000 soles que solicita serán invertidos en la compra de mercadería para su librería y mejorar la apariencia de su local.
texts.en:
Noemí, a 23 year old young woman, has a son. She tries to be both mother and father to him because his father abandoned her. Her parents helped her and her son get ahead. Once she got over the abandonment, she decided to work to cover her small son’s expenses. Her parents offered her a space in their house to start a business. She now has a small bookstore. In the short time she has had the store, one year; she has generated enough income to live on. Above all, it has given her the possibility of expanding and improving her store. She has put all of her hopes for progressing in the store. She and her son had to sacrifice a lot. She used her earnings to buy new merchandise, and there was not much income left for them. Now, Noemí wants to have a variety store. To do so she will have to adapt her location and build her own house. She is new in MFP, and this is her first loan. She really wants to work responsibly with the women who form her group. The 1,000 PEN is to buy merchandise for her bookstore and to improve its appearance.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise and fix up her store

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es: Ricardo es un noble trabajador dedicado al bienestar de su familia, ya que el progreso de su hogar es su prioridad y en este tiempo logró brindar a sus seres queridos una casa propia donde habitar. Desde que contrajo matrimonio trabaja muy duro para solventar los gastos de su familia, sus múltiples actividades le dieron la posibilidad de ahorrar para comprar un carro, con el que hace 2 años viene trabajando brindando el servicio de taxi. Sin embargo, esta actividad suele ser  arriesgada, por los asaltos, pero Ricardo aprendió a tomar las precauciones necesarias, en especial por las noches, donde es más peligroso, pero también hay mayor demanda de sus servicios. Su deseo para más adelante es adquirir nuevas movilidades para alquilar y administrar sus ganancias, por ello, le resta importancia a las horas de sacrificio que pasa fuera de casa. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, y junto a sus compañeros y compañeras trabajan de manera efectiva con el fin de hacer de su banco comunal, uno de los mejores dentro de la institución. Los 700 soles que solicita los invertirá en la compra de repuestos para su carro, y mandará a hacerle un mantenimiento.
texts.en:
Ricardo is a noble worker dedicated to the well-being of his family, and as the progress of his household is his priority, he worked until he was able to provide his loved ones with a house of their own to live in. Since his marriage, he has been working very hard to pay off his family's household expenses. His multiple jobs provided him with the possibility to save up for a car, with which he has for the past two years been using to provide a taxi service. This work is often at risk of robbery, however, Ricardo learned to take the necessary precautions, especially at night, when it is most dangerous yet his services are also most in demand. His wish for the future is to acquire new means of transportation to rent and to manage, and for his earnings to be enough to make the hours he sacrifices away from his home more worthwhile. This is his first loan with MFP, and together with his partners he has worked very hard, the result being that their communal bank is one of the best available. The 700 soles that he requests will be invested in the purchase of replacement parts for his car and to do maintenance work on it.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Lenhart, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de repuestos y mantenimiento de su carro

loans.name: Mirthala

texts.es: Mirthala de 39 años, soltera, esta trabajando como consultora en el Instituto Rural del Tropico con 14 meses de servicio, tiene 3 hijos, uno ya se mantiene solo, uno estudia el 5to año de secundaria y un pequeño de 2½ años de edad, no cuenta con apoyo de nadie, hace frente a sus necesidades con su salario; esta solicitando su 1er credito que sera utilizado para levantar 2 paredes que le hacen falta para destinar ese local para su vivienda, ya que ella tiene en el centro de la construccion una pequeña casa de madera, la que desaparecera una vez haya concluido la construccion de la vivienda.  Sabemos que es una persona responsable, honesta y sabra honrar su credito.
texts.en:
Mirthala is 39 years old, single, and has been working as a consultant at the Rural Institute of the Tropics for the past 14 months. She has 3 children, one of which now supports himself, one who is in his 5th year of secondary studies, and a small one who is 2½ years old. Mirthala does not count with the support of anyone, and confronts her needs with her own salary. She is requesting her 1st loan that will be utilized to erect two walls that are missing to build a home on her construction site. Currently at the center of the construction site she has a small wooden house that will disappear once she has finished construction on her new home. We know that she is an honest and responsible person that will honor her loan commitment.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build 2 walls.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa tiene 50 años, hace 2 años se separó de su pareja, pero el apoyo que tiene de sus tres hijos, con quienes vive, la ayudaron a retomar sus actividades diarias. Cuando sufrió el abandono de su pareja tuvo pérdidas muy grandes en su negocio, por el descuido que tuvo en su trabajo y ahora que se recuperó está luchando por salvar su ferretería, la cual cerró por falta de mercadería, pero aun así sigue vendiendo algunos productos a pedido. Pero a pesar de esto, aun no tiene el capital necesario para volver abrir su ferretería, sin embargo, está segura de conseguirlo, pues sale todas las mañanas en busca de las grandes proveedoras que le dan la facilidad de algunos materiales a crédito, lo que ella aprovecha al máximo para incrementar sus ganancias. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, y a su vez es su primera experiencia en un banco comunal, donde se está adaptando a las exigencias del grupo, pues es un equipo muy responsable y organizado. Los 1000 soles que solicita le darán la posibilidad de incrementar la cantidad de materiales que vende, y así atender a muchos más clientes, para pronto abrir las puertas de su negocio.
texts.en:
Rosa is 50. Two years ago she separated from her husband. She lives with her three children, and the support they give her helped her resume her daily activities. When she suffered from her husband’s abandonment, her business had big losses due to neglect. Now that she has recovered, she is fighting to save her hardware store. She closed the store because of lack of merchandise, even though she keeps selling some products if requested. In spite of this, she still does not have enough money to reopen her hardware store. Nevertheless, she is sure she can get it. Every morning she goes out looking for big providers who will give her some materials on credit, which she takes the utmost advantage of to increase her earnings. This is her first loan with MFP, and this is her first experience in a community bank. She is adapting to the group’s requirements. It is a responsible and organized team. The 1,000 PEN will give her the opportunity to increase the quantity of materials that she sells. This way she will tend to the needs of many of her customers by opening the doors to her business soon.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Alejandro Nestor

texts.es: Don Alejandro es casado, de 46 años de edad, con 4 hijos de los cuales 2 estudian y 2 trabajan, su esposa se dedica a los trabajos de la casa.  El trabaja como operador de pozos en ENACAL Acoyapa, con 17 años de servicio, sus turnos son de 12 horas de 6:00 am. a 6:00 pm., tiene un dia libre cada 2 dias.  Esta solicitando su 3er credito para la construccion de una cocina, levantara paredes y pondra techo para de esta manera dar un poco de comodidad a su esposa, ya que con el invierno la situcion se pone un poco dificil.  Sus 2 creditos anteriores los utilizo para remodelar su vivienda, pero no fue suficiente para cumplir con todo lo planificado, por tal razon esta solicitando este nuevo credito para ir cumpliendo con las condiciones necesarias de su vivienda, estos fueron pagados en tiempo y forma.
texts.en:
Don Alejandro is married, 46 years old and has 4 children, two of them students and two working. His wife works in the home. He works as a well operator in ENACAL Acoyapa, where he has 17 years of service. His shifts are 12 hours long, from 6:00 am to 6:00 pm, and he gets a day free every two days. He is requesting his third loan for the construction of a kitchen; he will build walls and put on a roof this way providing a little bit more comfort to his wife, since in the winter the situation gets a bit difficult. The previous two loans he used for the remodel of his home, but they were not enough to satisfy all his plans. He is requesting this loan to be able to go on improving the conditions of his home. The previous loans were properly repaid on time.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of a kitchen.

loans.name: Sandra

texts.es: Sandra tiene 21 años, junto a su esposo trabajan duro para la construcción de su casa, la cual está a punto de concluir. Ella se dedica a la venta de comida junto a una tía, con quien viene trabajando por más de 2 años, y en el tiempo que viene realizando esta actividad aprendió a preparar diversidad de platos. Es así que todos los días sale por la mañana a preparar los alimentos en la casa de su tía, donde también está instalado el pequeño restaurante donde trabajan hasta altas horas de la noche, ya que a esas horas tienen mayor cantidad de clientes. Con sus ahorros, Sandra tiene pensado  invertir en la compra de un carrito de comida para vender en la puerta de su casa, y este es el motivo por el que solicita este préstamo, para completar el monto necesario. Para el futuro quiere instalar un restaurante en su domicilio para estar más cerca de su familia.
texts.en:
Sandra is 21 years old. Sandra and her husband have been working hard to build a house and are almost done. To make a living, Sandra sells food with her aunt. They have been working together for 2 years and in this time Sandra has learned to make many different dishes. Sandra goes to her aunt’s house every morning to prepare food. Her aunt has a small restaurant in her home and Sandra works there late into the night because late a night they have more customers. Sandra is planning to buy a food cart with her savings so she can sell from her front door. This is why she is requesting a loan, so she can get the rest of the money necessary. In the future, she would like to have a restaurant in her home so she can be closer to her family.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de un carrito de comida

loans.name: Cesar Agusto

texts.es: Cesar Augusto es casado, de 36 años de edad, tiene 2 hijos de 14 y 3 años, la mayor estudia la secundaria, su esposa no trabaja, el es quien asume los gastos familiares, es trabajador de la Alcaldia Municipal de Juigalpa, con 11 años de servicio como cobrador de impuestos, habita en casa propia y esta solicitando su 1er credito el que utilizara para la construccion de un muro, embaldozdo y drenaje de aguas servidas de su casa.  Cesar Augusto esta claro que con el credito quizas no pueda cubrir los gastos del trabajo que quiere emprender, pero esta seguro que una vez que cancele su credito podra solicitar otro con un monto mayor para finalizar la bora y dar comodidad y seguridad e higiene a su familia.
texts.en:
Cesar Augusto is married, is 36 years old, and has 2 children, who are 14 and 3 years old. He has studied through secondary school. His wife doesn’t work, so he takes on the family’s expenses. He works in the mayor’s office in the town of Juigalpa and has eleven years of service as a tax collector. He lives in his own house and is requesting his first loan, which he will use to build a tiled wall and water draining services for his house. Cesar Augusto is clear that with the loan he perhaps won’t be able to cover the expenses for the work that he wants to do, but he is certain that when he repays the loan, he will be able to request another for a larger amount to finish the project and provide comfort, security, and hygiene to his family.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a wall

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es: Victoria tiene 55 años, se caracteriza por su optimismo y su dedicación a su familia, con quienes vive en la casa que tanto sacrificio le costó obtener. Su gusto por la fotografía, pues siempre contaba con una cámara de fotos en todas las fiestas a donde la invitaban, se ha convertido en su fuente de ingresos económicos, pues su pareja le dio la idea de dedicarse a la venta de fotografías para eventos especiales. Es así que hace 20 años prestar sus servicios como fotógrafa, y es muy reconocida, debido a su experiencia. Además, ahora está diseñando nuevas formas de marcos digitales para fotografías, lo cual es un adicional que ofrece para ganar mayores ingresos, y es un trabajo en equipo, ya que son sus hijos quienes elaboran estos diseños en la computadora. Para un futuro cercano, Victoria y su familia, tienen la ambición de abrir una tienda fotográfica donde brinden diversos servicios fotográficos. Este es su sexto crédito con MFP, y este tiempo de permanencias le han servido para aprender cómo generar mayores ingresos, pero también para conocer a sus compañeras de grupo, con quienes mantiene una buena amistad, pues el banco comunal que conformaron las llevó a trabajar unánimemente. Con los 1000 soles que solicita adquirirá una video grabadora, pues sus clientes le están pidiendo no sólo fotografías, sino también videos.
texts.en:
Victoria is 55 years old and is characterized by her optimism and dedication to her family, with whom she lives in a house that she sacrificed a lot to obtain. She enjoys photography, as she always has a camera at all the parties that she is invited to. She has converted photography into a source of income, because her partner gave her the idea to sell photographs for special events. It is in this way that she has spent 20 years offering her photography services. She is very well-known because of her experience. Also, now she is designing new forms of digital frames for photographs, which are a supplement that she offers in order to earn more income. This is a team effort, since her children are the ones who produce these designs on the computer. For the near future, Victoria and her family want to open a photography store where they will offer diverse photography services. This is her sixth credit with MFP. In this time, she learned how to generate more income. She also got to know the members of her group, with whom she has a good friendship, since the community bank they belong to brings them to work together. With the 1000 soles that she requests, she will buy a camcorder, since her clients are asking not only for photographs, but also for videos.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a camcorder

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es: Antonio S. esta preocupado por el bienestar de su familia su esposa esta embarazada y el quiere construir una habitación para cuando el bebe crezca tenga un lugar donde dormir. La casa que el tiene es de interés social por lo que es muy pequeña y quiere que este mas amplia para darle confort a sus hijos. El señor es trabajador de maquiladora, la esposa es ama de casa  se queda al cuidado de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Antonio S. is concerned for the well-being of his family. His wife is pregnant, and he wants to build a room, so that when the baby grows, it can have a place to sleep. The house that he has is public housing, so it is very small. He wants it to be bigger to provide comfort for her children. He is a machine worker, and his wife is a housewife, who takes care of the children.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a room

loans.name: Narcedelia

texts.es: La señora Narcedelia Galván desde hace 9 años se dedica a la venta de ropa usada y artículos para el hogar, ahora ella recurre ya que ella quiere innovar mas su negocio desea comprar mas mercancía nueva para ofrecerle a los clientes. Así tendrá más ventas y aumentara más sus ingresos. El esposo trabaja en Estados Unidos y le manda la mercancía o ella va a comprarla hasta la ciudad donde el se encuentra o ya sea en otras ciudades.
texts.en:
For nine years, Mrs. Narcedelia Galván has sold used clothes and articles for the home. Now she wants to innovate her business. She wants to buy more new merchandise to offer to her clients. This way, she will have more sales and will increase her income more. Her husband works in the United States and sends her merchandise or she buys it in her city or in other cities.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Martha Alejandra

texts.es: Martha Alejandra S. es un señora que esta al tanto de la educación que se le da a sus hijos, Ella cree que al ponerlos en una escuela particular aprenderán mas y a parte aprenderá una lengua extrajera. Su hijo esta en preescolar pero esta requiriendo el pago para la colegiatura de este mes. Ella trabaja en una guardería  de cocinera y su esposo a la venta de automóviles.
texts.en:
Martha Alejandra S. is a woman that is attentive of the education that she gives to her children. She thinks that by putting them in a particular school they will learn more, in addition to learning a foreign language. Her son is in pre-school, but she requires the payment for school fees this month. She works in a nursery kitchen, and her husband sells cars.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay school fees for her son

loans.name: Joserecto

texts.en:
"I was just renting a farm before. Because of hard work and blessings from God, I finally own the land that I till," says Mr. Joserecto P., a 49-year-old father of four children. "I started tilling a 1-1/4 hectare farm. And from my harvest I was able to pay the school fees as well as the books for my children," he said. 

He would like to ask for a loan from CEVI. He will use the loan to purchase hybrid seeds, herbicides, fertilizers and insecticides. The loan will truly help him improve his harvest. 

Through CEVI, Mr. P. was able to sustain his farm. He continues to avail loans from CEVI and receive training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase hybrid seeds, herbicides, mouluscide, fertilizers and insecticides

loans.name: Danilo

texts.en:
"I am a tenant and I till the land that I never own. Someday, I wish I could have my own farm so that I could give more support to my family especially my three children," says Danilo G., a farmer from Bunawan, Agusan Del Sur. From his harvest, Danilo has been able to pay for school, books and other needs of his family.

He is asking for a loan of 10,000 PHP from CEVI. He will use the loan to purchase certified seeds, ammonia, herbicides, insecticides and fertilizers. The loan will really help improve his harvest and income as well. 

CEVI aims to help small businesses to grow. They provide more than just loans. They make sure that their clients are trained and covered with insurance.

loans.use: To purchase certified seeds, ammonium, herbicides, insecticides and fertilizers

loans.name: Mae

texts.en:
"I started farming using a 3-hectare farm. My husband and I are tenants. We are working in the farm of our friend. During harvest, we decide for share. From our experiences, farming is the only thing that sustain our family," says Mae S., a farmer and mother of two children.

Mae would like a loan of Php 8,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy certified seeds, complete fertilizers, and herbicides. The loan will greatly help the family improve their harvest.

CEVI provides not just loans to their clients. It also offers training and insurance coverage.

loans.use: To purchase certified seeds, complete fertilizers, and herbicides.

loans.name: Wenlove

texts.en:
Wenlove L. is from the village of Canicapan Clarin Misamis Occidental. She is 51 years old and married with one school-aged child. To make a living, Wenlove has a vocational school. Her main source of income comes primarily from providing quality education to the local community. She has had her business for over two years and earns approximately 50000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Wenlove joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting her first loan for 20,000 PHP to purchase school equipment. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve fund for school improvement.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase school equipment.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
"My husband and I are tilling a 3-hectare farm. Now, we are busy preparing the land for our next planting. We hope to grow our farm so that we could easily send our two children in school. We are grateful to Community Economic Ventures Inc. (CEVI) for always there to support our livelihood and make it grow," says Helen O., a 25 year old farmer from Agusan Del Sur in Mindanao.

Helen would like a loan of Php 8,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to purchase fertilizers, insecticides, and herbicides. "With my loan, I hope I could improve our harvest even more," she said.

CEVI helps small business grow. They provide their clients with not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, insecticides, and herbicides.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna D. is from the village of Puntod, Lopez Jaena Misamis Occidental. She is 39 years old and married with three school-aged children. To make a living, she has a a "sari-sari," or retail store, selling daily use products, such as shampoo, soap, and toothpaste in the local community. She has had her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Edna joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from GDMPC and is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell in her store. This will be her third GDMPC loan. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children for the coming school year.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Vergie

texts.en:
Vergie P. is from the village of Segatic Daku Clarin Misamis Occidental. She is 49 years old and married with three school-aged children. To make a living, Vergie raises crops, primarily from planting and harvesting corn and bananas for sale. Vergie has been engaged in her business for over nine years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Vergie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting her first GDMPC loan of 8000 PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business and pay for her children's education.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Hilary

texts.en:
"Since I was just a small kid, I already farm. Now, I continue farming to be able to support the needs of the family," says Hilary A., 27-year-old father of two children. Hilary told CEVI that the farm they are tilling was given to him by his father. "It is a gift. When I decided to get married, my father gave me a small parcel of land that my wife and I could use to support the needs of our family." 

Hilary would like a loan of 10,000 PHP from CEVI. He will use the loan to purchase urea fertilizers, herbicides and insecticides. The loan will truly help a lot to improve their harvest. Hilary is also looking for other possible income sources to be able to earn additional money for the family.

CEVI gives its clients credit assistance to support their small businesses. They also provide training and insurance coverage.

loans.use: To purchase urea fertilizers, herbicides and insecticides

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida C. makes a living mainly from selling fish to the local community. She is 39 years old, married and has one school-age child. They are from the village of Mobod, Oroquieta City Misamis Occidental. Adelaida has been in this business for over 20 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2007, Adelaida joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Adelaida has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from GDMPC. Adelaida is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Adelaida from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to expand her business and support her family.

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Rizalina

texts.en:
Rizalina G. is from the village of Cabungaan Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 60 years old. Rizalina is married and has five adult children. To make a living, Rizalina raises swines. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising swines for fattening. Rizalina has been engaged in her business for more than two years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2004, Rizalina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rizalina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14000 PHP from GDMPC. Rizalina is requesting a new loan of 27000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 23rd loan taken out by Rizalina from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business and to sustain her family's financial needs.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie L. is from Mayor's Village, Lapasan, Clarin Misamis Occidental. She is twenty-six years old and married with two infant children. To make a living, Elvie owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a "sari-sari" or general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Elvie is just starting this business.

Elvie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Elvie is requesting a new loan which will be used to purchase additional products to sell in her store. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Elvie from GDMPC. She plans to save the additional revenue generated from the business as a reserve for future emergencies and to sustain her family's basic needs. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
"I am dreaming of having a big farm someday. What we have now is only a one-hectare rice field. I want to make it larger so that we will have a bigger harvest and more income to enjoy", says Jocelyn C., a forty-seven year old mother of three children. 

She would like a loan from CEVI, one of Kiva's field partners. She will use the loan to purchase urea fertilizers, ammonium sulfate and herbicides. The loan will truly help her whole family achieve maximum yield on their farm.

CEVI gives their clients more than just loans. They provide training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase urea fertilizers,ammonium sulfate and herbicides

loans.name: Aquilina

texts.en:
"I have a friend named Oliver. My husband and I work on his farm. Together, we till a two-hectare farm in order to provide for the needs of our family," says Aquilina A., a forty-two year old mother of two children.

She would like a loan from CEVI, one of Kiva's field partners. She will use the loan to purchase urea fertilizers, insecticides, and herbicides. She also considers venturing into another line of business to help contribute to the family income.

CEVI helps small businesses to grow. They provide not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase urea fertilizers, insecticides, and herbicides

loans.name: Maria Eloisa

texts.en:
Maria Eloisa L. is from the village of Guba, Clarin Misamis Occidental. She is thirty-three years old and married with one school-age child. To make a living, Maria Eloisa owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a "sari-sari" or general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products like soap, shampoo, toothpaste, etc., in the local community. Maria Eloisa has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately $70 a month for these activities.

In 2009, Maria Eloisa joined the Kiva field partner, GDMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Maria Eloisa has successfully repaid a previous loan  from GDMPC. She is requesting a new loan to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the second loan taken out by Maria Eloisa from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business and to support her family's basic needs. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Paquito

texts.en:
Paquito S. is from the village of Kinangay, Norte Clarin Misamis Occidental. He is fifty-eight years old and married with three grown children. To make a living, Paquito owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a "sari-sari" or general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Paquito has been engaged in his business for over six years and earns approximately $23 a month for these activities.

In 2008, Paquito joined the Kiva field partner, GDMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. Paquito has successfully repaid previous loans from GDMPC. He is requesting a new loan to purchase additional products to sell in his "sari-sari" or general store. This loan will be his fourth loan from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve his business and to meet his family's basic needs. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

loans.name: Florenda

texts.en:
"I have a farm with a total land area of 15,552 square meters. Since my husband died, it has been only me managing our rice farm. This is how I am able to send all my children to school as well as provide for their other needs," says Florenda A., a mother of three children. 

She would like a loan from CEVI, one of Kiva's field partners. She will use the loan to purchase fertilizers, herbicides and insecticides. The loan will help her produce a bigger harvest on her farm and more income for her family.

CEVI helps small businesses grow. It helps provide not just loans, but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, herbicides and insecticides.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
"I have a rice farm, and its total area is 14,826 square meters. My husband and I work together in order to feed and clothe our four children," says Francisca M., a forty-five-year-old mother from Bunawan, Agusan Del Sur, in Mindanao.

She wants a loan to use for purchasing fertilizers, herbicides and insecticides. "With a loan, I have a better chance of harvesting a good crop," she said.

CEVI's aim is to help small businesses grow. They provide their clients with loans as well as training and insurance coverage.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer, herbicide and insecticide.

loans.name: Adriano

texts.en:
"I own a one-hectare farm where I grow rice in order to provide for my family's needs. I continue working on the farm even if it's too hot. I hope that I will have an abundant harvest so I can save enough to buy another farm," says Adriano T., a forty-nine-year-old father of three children.

He wants a loan from CEVI, one of Kiva's field partners. He will use the loan to purchase urea fertilizers and insecticides. The loan will help him produce a better harvest and more income as well.

CEVI provides people a chance to start and run their own businesses. They give their clients loans as well as training and insurance coverage.

loans.use: To purchase urea fertilizers and insecticides

loans.name: Johanna

texts.en:
Johanna O. manages a small parcel of land where she and her husband, Jonathan, have been growing corn for three years. They both work very hard to provide for their needs and to take good care of their three children. Johanna is thirty-four years old. She hopes to enlarge her farm in the future.

She would like to be given a loan from CEVI. She will use the loan to purchase complete fertilizer, certified corn seeds and herbicides. The loan will help her achieve a better harvest and more income for her family.

CEVI, one of Kiva's field partners, reaches out to people so they can start and run their own businesses in order to improve their livelihood. CEVI provides their clients with loans as well as training and insurance coverage.

loans.use: To purchase complete fertilizers, certified corn seeds and herbicides.

loans.name: Aya

texts.en:
Aya H. is currently in the business of selling hair essentials at her beauty salon and is requesting a loan to increase the stock in her shop. Aya is twenty-nine years old and married with three children, who are all in school. Her husband is a peasant. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy a lorry for hire.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The micro-finance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: stock more materials in her salon

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita T., a 38-year-old mother, lives in Bunawan, Agusan Del Sur--a town of 32,233 people whose livelihood is predominantly from agriculture. She has two children and a rice farm business. Her husband, Jonie T., manages their rice farm. Their harvest is for family consumption; however, there are also times that they sell some rice to their neighbors to supplement their family income.

Mercedita would like a loan of 10,000 PHP from CEVI. She will use the loan to purchase new seeds, fertilizers and herbicides. She thinks that by doing so, she will be able to improve their harvest.

CEVI is reaching out to farmers to sustain their livelihood. CEVI gives its clients more than just loans. Training and insurance coverage are provided as well.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizers and herbicides

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
"My previous harvest reached 180 sacks of rice. Now we are busy again preparing the land to have abundant harvest," says Shirley D., a mother of three children and owner of a 1.5 hectare farm in Bunawan, Agusan Del Sur. She is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP from CEVI. She will use the loan to purchase seeds, complete fertilizers, ammonium sulfate and herbicides. The loan will really help a lot to sustain their livelihood.

CEVI helps provide loans for small business entrepreneurs. CEVI provides its clients with loans, training and insurance coverage.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, complete fertilizers, ammonium sulfate and herbicides

loans.name: Kajogo

texts.en:
Kajogo M. is currently in the business of selling bread and groundnuts (peanuts) and is requesting a loan to buy more groundnuts to make paste to sell. Kajogo is 22 years old and is married with a husband that is an army officer. She has one child and her child does not go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a hotel. 

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy more groundnuts

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
"My parents are farmers. Me being their daughter, I have no choice but to learn everything from planting seeds to harvesting the grains," says Nida N., 45-year-old mother of four children. She has a 3-hectare farm. Her husband is the one managing their rice field and she always offers help to be able to provide their children with all their needs. 

She would like to ask a loan of Php 10,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to  purchase Urea fertilizers, certified seeds and herbicides. " With my loan, I could help improve our harvest", she said.

CEVI reaches out to a lot of farmers to sustain their livelihood. CEVI provides their clients with not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, seeds, and herbicides

loans.name: Kwaje

texts.en:
Kwaje A. is currently in the business of selling rice, beans, phoso, etc. in her restaurant and is requesting a loan to build another room in her restaurant. Kwaje is 40 years old and married with a husband that is a driver. She has six children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house to rent out.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To build another room in her restaurant

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica has owned a small food vendor store in the Nzovwe neighborhood of Mbeya. She belongs to the ajengo B '1' loan group (group code 2016). Every day she works at her business for 12 hours.

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more food items to add her current stock for the improvement of her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Monica is 40 years old, married, and has three children ages 18, 15, and 5.

loans.use: To expand store inventory

loans.name: Ginabelle

texts.en:
Ginabelle S. owns a small parcel of rice farmland. She is 23 years old and has two children. Her husband, Jack S. is the one managing their business. She hopes for an abundant harvest so that they will be able to buy things they need in their household.

She would like to ask for a loan of Php 10,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to purchase complete fertilizers, Urea, and herbicides. She is also looking for other possible income areas to help her husband to pay the family expenses. CEVI provides their clients with not just loans but they also give training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase complete fertilizers, Urea, and herbicides

loans.name: Ndanyela Group

texts.en:
Queen is a clothes seller in the Nzovwe neighborhood of Mbeya. She belongs to Ndanyela group loan (Group code 2019). Daily she works at her business.

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more clothes for resale, to expand her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Queen is 40 years old, married, and has five children: ages 22, 19, 17, 15, and 12. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member, Neema, who has her own small business selling charcoal in Mbeya.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for resale, to expand her business

loans.name: Renato

texts.en:
"I am a farmer and still single. Marriage is something that I need to prepare for. My only hope is that I will have an abundant harvest always to save money for my future family," says Mr. Renato A., from Bunawan, Agusan Del Sur.

He would like a loan of Php 10,000 from CEVI. He will use the loan to purchase fertilizers, herbicides, insecticides and certified seeds. The loan will be helpful to improve the soil condition of the farm as well as to ensure a good harvest.

CEVI provides their clients with not just loans. They also give training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, herbicides, insecticides and certified seeds

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en: Mrs. Merlinda F. is a member of the co-op in good standing.  She started her membership 4 years ago, on May 12, 2005. Married and blessed with 7 children, she has two  already married and the others still in school. She is on her 8th  loan, now amounting to PHP 14,000, for financial assistance for her proposed project, rice production, which is one of their primary sources of income for their daily needs. Her loan will be used for buying fertilizers and chemicals for cultivating their rice field. Recently, they're happy to be managing and cooperating their project and they are very thankful to Paglaum Multi-Purpose Coop for lending them money for financial assistance in cultivating their rice field.

loans.use: additional capital for her rice production

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida is a firewood seller in the Nzovwe neighborhood of Mbeya. She belongs to Ndanyela group loan (Group code 2019). Every day she works at her business for 12 hours.

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more firewood for resale, to expand her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Adelaida is 40 years old, married, and has five children: ages 23, 20, 18, 16 and 10.

loans.use: To buy more firewood for resale, to expand her business

loans.name: Afia

texts.en:
Afia J. is currently in the business of selling drugs at a clinic and is requesting a loan to stock more drugs in her clinic. Afia is 19 years old and is married to a husband who is a nurse. She has no children. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a hospital.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations.

BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.name: Juvy Lynne

texts.en:
Juvy Lynne P. is from the village of Magsaysay. She is 23 years old. To make a living, Juvy Lynne owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling food products in the local community. Juvy Lynne has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month for this activity. Juvy Lynne joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Juvy Lynne has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Juvy Lynne is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell and to support also for her poultry raising. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Juvy Lynne from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
" My husband and I work together in our farm. We want to ensure that we will have an abundant harvest to provide the needs of our children. Our previous harvest is 224 sacks. We wished to improve our harvest all the more. Now, we are busy preparing our land and need additional capital to pay for farm necessities," says Mrs. Alicia M., a farmer and mother of three children.

She would like to ask for a loan of Php 10,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to purchase fertilizers, herbicides, insecticides, and seeds. " With my loan, I wish to be able to improve our harvest and increase income for the family", she said.

CEVI aims to help small business to grow. CEVI gives not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, herbicides, insecticides, and seeds

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Mrs. Evelyn R., 54 years of age, is an active member of PMPC-Ozamiz Branch. She was married before, but now is separated from her husband. With her experience being the father and mother of her 2 children, she faces this life’s challenge with courage. To support her family, she decided to engage in business. She opened up a little "Sari-sari" (variety) Store in her house with the business name "Queenth Store".

Aside from this business, she also earns income from her boarding house rentals. With skills in dressmaking, she also accepts dress repairs and dress-making that contributes a lot to their income. Now she is applying for the amount of PHP 5,000 as a loan. Her only hope is to give her children a better future and also that her business will prosper someday, not just a little Sari-sari Store but will become a mini grocery store with the help of KIVA.

loans.use: Additional capital for her Sari-sari Store

loans.name: Marry

texts.en:
Marry has been a clothes and maize seller in the Nzovwe neighborhood of Mbeya for 2 years. She belongs to DDC 1 group loan (Group code 2017). Every day she works at her business for 12 hours.

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more maize and clothes for resale, to expand her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Marry is 44 years old, married, and has five children: ages 25, 17, 14, 10, and 4.

loans.use: To buy more maize and clothes for resale, to expand her business

loans.name: Dudu

texts.en:
Dudu John is currently in the business of selling charcoal at the market and is requesting a loan to open up a charcoal store. Dudu is 34 years old and is married to a husband who is a peasant. She has 2 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations.

BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The micro-finance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: open up a charcoal store

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Mrs. Elisa S., is a resident of Gampis, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 52 years old and married and has 5 children. Her main source of income is a "sari-sari" store (mini grocery store) in good status. Her husband is engaged in the fishing business; it serves as their other source of income.

The income from these businesses is the one that sustains the education of her children and their family needs. Though her business is in good status, due to financial crisis they have encountered now, she has limited stocks and cannot cope with the needs of her customer. She decided to come into Paglaum MPC to borrow money to support her business as additional capital. And through this, she can only make her business more profitable and can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: Additional capital for her mini grocery store

loans.name: Justina

texts.en:
Justina has been a rice seller in the Nzovwe neighborhood of Mbeya for 4 years. She belongs to DDC 1 group loan (Group code 2017). Each day she works at her business for 12 hours.

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more rice for resale, to improve her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Justina is 33 years old, married, and has three children: ages 13, 9 and 1.

loans.use: To buy more rice for resale, to improve her business.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
"I grew up in the farm. My parents are farmers and my husband as well. Now, we are busy preparing for the next planting. We hope to have an abundant harvest so that we will be able to send our children to school and buy their other needs," says Delia R., 44-year-old mother of three kids.

She would like to ask for a loan of Php 10,000 from CEVI. The loan will greatly help her whole family buy the necessary farm materials to ensure an abundant harvest in her farm.

CEVI provides their clients with not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, Urea and complete  fertilizers

loans.name: Zubaida Anwar Group

texts.en:
Irshad baji wants a loan to buy seasonal vegetables to sell.

Tayyaba Iram baji wants a loan to buy raw materials (sugar and dried fruit) for her sweetmeat-making business.

Nagina baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle

Aqeela baji wants a loan to buy a buffalo for their milk-selling business.

Zubaida baji is the group leader for these above-mentioned ladies. They all belong to a historic place of the city of Lahore named Yadgar, Pakistan. Zubaida baji is married to Mr. A. who runs a sweetmeat shop. His variety of sweetmeats is famous with many people. Zubaida baji also helps him in the making of sweetmeats. She is applying for a loan to buy raw materials (cooking oil, sugar and dry fruits) to expand her husband's sweetmeat business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for sweetmeat-making business

loans.name: Salve

texts.en:
Mrs. Salve Z. is a former OFW (Overseas Filipina Worker). At the age of 31, she got married to Dominic Z., an overseas seaman, now residing in P7 Gango, Ozamiz City. Theye are blessed with 2 children, both studying in Gango Elementary School.

Even though her husband is an overseas seaman, Salve still wanted to help earn their living. She decided to put up a little Sari-sari (variety) Store with a small amount of capital. Unfortunately, she experienced a net loss. She tried to revive her business and invested again in the store. Now her business is still existing and has showed progress in sales and inventory. As an active regular member, she is now applying for the amount of PHP 20,000 as her 4th loan. As a mother, her only desire is to give her children a better education for their good future. She is very thankful to God, to PAGLAUM and to KIVA for helping fulfill her hopes and dreams in life.

loans.use: additional capital for her Sari-sari store

loans.name: Edina

texts.en:
Edina has been raising a clothes business in the Nzovwe neighborhood of Mbeya for 16 years. She belongs to Maendeleo  group loan (Group code 2023).  Every day she works at her business for 8 hours.  


She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more clothes for resale. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.  


Edina is 45 years old, married, and has three children: ages 18, 16  and 5.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for resale

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie C. has 1-hectare rice farm. She is 34 years old, widowed with no children. She would like to grow her farm. She dreams of buying another farm as well as farming equipment someday. Her husband, Albino, is already dead. She has been managing her rice farm closely monitored to achieve her expected harvest.

She would like to ask for a loan of Php 8,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to purchase Ammonium sulfate, complete fertilizers, and herbicides. The loan will also help to start a new business.

CEVI helps people to start up and run their businesses. CEVI provides their clients with not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase Ammonium sulfate, complete fertilizers, and herbicides

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Mrs. Leonila O., 54 years of age, married, is a resident of P3 Molicay, Ozamiz City. She joined PMPC in March 2007 and was able to access her 1st loan. As the sole breadwinner of the family because of the illness of her husband, she works as a cook and all-round worker in a certain food house in the city. She also makes ice candy and sells it to their neighbors and friends in their barangay (village) to add to their family income.

Now she is applying for the amount of Php 5,000 to add to her capital in their little Sari-sari (variety) Store in their house, to be managed by her husband. Her only dream in life is to be able to establish a big Sari-sari Store in her house and be able to send her only child to school through college and find a better job.

loans.use: Additional capital for her little Sair-sari Store

loans.name: Asia Aslam Group

texts.en:
Sadia Batool baji wants a loan to buy mobile phones for her mobile phone shop.

Rani baji and Rukhsana baji each want a loan to buy raw materials (lentils, cooking oil and spices) for their food businesses.

Asia baji is married to Mr. A. who runs a stationery-selling business. He buys stationery wholesale and sells it to the stationery shops and earns income. Mostly shopkeepers give him orders and he fills the orders for them. But nowadays he is out of stock, and therefore Asia baji is applying for a loan to buy stationery, so that her husband complete the order of his customers and saves his reputation on them.

Asia baji is the group leader for these above-mentioned ladies. She also handles her clothes-sewing business. She sews clothes to pay off the utilities.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy stationery to sell

loans.name: Nellie

texts.en: Mrs. Nellie D. is a bonafide resident of Tamban, Baliangao Misamis Occidental. She is 56 years old, married and blessed with 3 children who are married and have their own children. Their source of income is fishing and recently, she accessed a loan in the amount of PHP 5,000 for a motorized pumpboat. She's thankful to PMPC because through the Co-op they are able to purchase the motorized pumpboat.

loans.use: capital for motorized pumpboat

location.town: Tamban Punta Miray Baliangao Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Melita

texts.en:
Melita L. is from the town of Mohon, Aloran. She is 33 years old. Melita is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Melita owns & operates a for-hire motorcycle business.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing transport services to local community members. Melita has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2004, Melita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Melita is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP, which will be used to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. This loan will be the 10th loan taken out by Melita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.
