*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair a transport vehicle

loans.name: Anjelina

texts.en:
Anjelina has owned a small charcoal and firewood store, in addition to selling bananas, in the Nzovwe neighborhood of Mbeya for 15 years. She belongs to Maendeleo 'A' group loan (Group code 2023). Every day she works at her business for 10 hours.  


She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more bananas, charcoal and firewood to add to her current stock for the improvement of her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.  


Anjelina is married, and has three children ages 36, 35 and 30.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal, firewood and bananas

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita L. is from the town of Lopez Jaena. She is 58 years old. Lolita is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Lolita owns & operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Lolita has been engaged in her business for over 13 years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2000, Lolita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lolita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. Lolita is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Lolita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Mrs. Evelyn S. is a resident of Dapitan City, Zamboanga del Norte.  Her husband is a cargo truck driver.  She raises pigs in to supplement her husband's income.  They have no dependents right now since all of their kids are already married.  Evelyn is an active member of Paglaum coop.  All loans she has received up to this point have been dedicated to raising pigs in her backyard.  The latest loan she is requesting is going toward the purchase of construction materials to wall her house.

loans.use: The purchase of construction materials to wall her house

loans.name: Alan

texts.en:
Alan A. is a tenant on a 1-hectare farm. He is 41 years old and has four children. He hopes to have his own farm someday, which is why he is working so hard to be able to pay for the school and other needs of his children. Currently, he is very busy preparing the farm for the next planting. His only wish is to have an abundant harvest to save enough money for his family's future.

He is requesting a loan of 8,000 Philippine pesos (or about $175 US) from CEVI. He will use the loan to purchase insecticides, complete fertilizers and other farm necessities. 

CEVI helps farmers sustain their livelihood. It provides not just loans but also offers training and insurance coverage.

loans.use: To purchase insecticides, complete fertilizers and other farm necessities

loans.name: Safia Muhammad Bashir Group

texts.en:
(This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.)

Khursheed baji is requesting a loan to buy embroidering material, such as colored thread, beads, and clothes, for her decorative embroidering business.

Naziran baji is requesting a loan to buy bedsheets to sell.

Safia baji is a wife of M. B., a man who runs a grocery shop in the community. Safia baji is the group leader of these above mentioned ladies. They all live in Yadgar, a historical part of town in Lahore, Pakistan. They all independently handle their own businesses. They are responsible to pay utilities and the school fees of their kids. Safia baji is applying for a loan to buy groceries to diversify her husband's grocery store.

loans.use: To buy groceries for a grocery store

loans.name: Lucena

texts.en: Mrs. Lucena O. is a 53-year-old married mother of 3.  She currently lives in Dipolog City.  She raises pigs while her husband drives their motorcycle for hire.  Lucena has been an active member in Paglaum MPC for years and has already received several loans for her pig raising.  She is requesting what will be her 7th loan, which amounts to 14,000 Phillipine pesos (or about $300 US), to purchase spare parts and labor for their motorcycle.

loans.use: Spare parts and labor for motorcycle repair

loans.name: Editha

texts.en: Mrs. Editha A. is a 33-year-old married mother of 2.  She engaged in selling a native wine commonly known as "tuba."  Her husband is a carpenter.  Editha has been a member, in good standing, of Paglaum MPC for almost 2 years.  She is requesting her 3rd loan, which totals 7,000 Philippine pesos (or about $150 US), to purchase construction materials for her family's residential house in order to have a comfortable shelter.

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials for residential house

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita C. makes a living running a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling food products in the local community. Teresita is 51 years old, married and has one adult child. She is from the village of Clarin. Teresita has been in business for over 20 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2000, Teresita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to improve her living conditions and her ability to engage in business activities. Teresita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC. Teresita is requesting a new loan of 40,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 17th loan taken out by Teresita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Shamshad Amjad Masih Group

texts.en:
Shamshad Baji is A. M.'s wife. They live in a historical place named Yadgar in Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a blacksmith and makes iron rods on order. Shamshad Baji is a very supportive lady. She always encourages her husband whether his business goes well or not. Her support gives him strength to move forward. She is applying for a loan to buy iron to make iron rods to complete the orders of his customers. 
Razia Baji is requesting a loan to buy electrical supplies like wires, switchboards and switches for her electrical supplies business. 
Tahira Parveen Baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. The picture is of Tahira Baji's grocery shop. 
This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy iron for making iron rods

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
"I work as a tenant. My parents and I are tilling the land we never own," says Linda L., a 46-year-old farmer. She is still single but soon to be married. She hopes to have an abundant harvest so that her family will have enough food to eat despite the worsening economic crisis. She is requesting a loan of 8,000 PHP from CEVI. She will use the loan to purchase urea fertilizers, herbicides and certified seeds. The loan will help a lot to improve their yield.

CEVI helps small businesses grow. It provides not only loans but also training and insurance coverage.

loans.use: To purchase urea fertilizers, herbicides and certiifed seeds

loans.name: Charmalou

texts.en:
Mrs. Charmalou U. has a business called "Char's Lechón Retailer and Longganiza", selling pork. She is married to Mr. Ibrahim U. and they have been blessed with two children. Her husband is a waiter. Mrs. Charmalou is a hardworking person and a good mother to her two little princesses.

She started with meager capital until she become a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative on November 26, 2008. Now she plans to expand her business and she is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP to be used for additional capital.

loans.use: Capital for Lechón and longganiza business

loans.name: Vumilia

texts.en:
Vumilia has owned a small grocery store in the Nzovwe neighborhood of Mbeya for three years. She belongs to the Maendeleo group loan. Every day, she works at her business for six hours. She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania, a Kiva partner, so that she can buy more grocery items to add her current stock for the improvement of her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Vumilia is 27 years old and married with a 3-year-old child.

loans.use: To buy more grocery items to add her current stock for the improvement of her business

loans.name: Mirium

texts.en:
For many years, Mirium has been running a tailoring business in the Nzovwe neighborhood. She makes different types of dresses and sells them. She currently earns a little amount of monthly profit. She works at her business for 12 hours every day. Mirium is 32 years old, married, and has two children: ages 9 and 6. She also cares for one dependent.

Mirium is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more items for her business. She is hoping that through this loan her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business. She belongs to Majengo B1 Group loan (Group code 2016).

loans.use: To buy more items for a tailoring business

loans.name: Safia Abdul Rasheed Group

texts.en:
Sheedan baji wants a loan to buy sanitation supplies (pipes and taps) to resell. Shakeela baji wants a loan to buy blankets to sell. Shazia baji wants a loan to repair her auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Noor baji wants a loan to buy clothes to sell.

Safia baji, the wife of A. R., resides in a historical place in the city of Lahore, Pakistan, named Yadgar. She is the group leader of the above mentioned ladies. These ladies all have a good nature and give respect to each other. Safia baji's husband has a construction-supply business. Presently, he is out of stock and Safia baji is applying for a loan to buy construction supplies (sand and cement) to complete the orders of his customers.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy construction supplies to resell

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en: A 46-year-old, married woman and mother of three children, Mrs. Myrna F. is struggling to generate her own income to help her husband combat their poverty. She manages her own sari-sari store in her residence and in addition she cultivates different kinds of vegetables and root crops in her backyard, for their own consumption and for sale. She brings her children along to the garden for the help they can provide. Her sacrifices are for her children's education. She is hoping that some day they will be uplifted by virtue of their own hard work.

loans.use: To purchase assorted grocery stock

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios C. makes a living providing sea water to fish vendors in Oroquieta City market. She is 40 years old, married and has three adult children. She is from the village of Mobod. Remedios has been engaged in her business for over nine years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Remedios joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Remedios is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional gallon containers. This will be her second loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional gallon containers

loans.name: Eden

texts.en:
Eden P., from the city of Dulapo, Oroquieta City, is 31 years old and widowed. To make a living, Eden owns and operates a "sari-sari" store, selling a variety of goods in the local community. Eden has been in business for over two years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month.

Eden joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Eden is requesting a loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. This will be her third loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy additional inventory and increase working capital for a sari-sari store

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira C. is a rice grower. She is a 48-year-old mother of three children. She told CEVI about her experience in farming: "My husband and I are tilling the land of our friends. We are tenants. Someday, I wish to have our own farm to be able to support better the needs of our family."

She would like to ask for a loan of Php 10,000 from CEVI, a Kiva partner. She will use the loan to purchase seeds, herbicides and complete fertilizers. Aside from that, Mrs. C. plans to venture to some other business.

CEVI provides not just loans to their clients. They also include training and insurance coverage in their services.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, herbicides and complete fertilizers

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
Loreta M. is from the city of San Vicente, Oroquieta City. She is 39 years old, married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Loreta owns and operates a sari-sari (general store). While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Loreta has been in business for over three years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Loreta joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Loreta is requesting a loan of 3000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. This will be her second loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy additional goods to sell

loans.name: Sakin Muhammad Sarwar Group

texts.en:
Sakina Baji operates a tailoring business. She sews clothes to pay off the utilities. Her husband, M. S., runs a grocery shop in the community.  They have lived in the historical site of Yadgar in Lahore, Pakistan for the past 10 years. Sakina Baji is applying for a loan to buy groceries for her husband's grocery shop.
Rasoolan Baji wants a loan to buy a buffalo for her dairy business. 
Razia Baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle).
Nadia Baji wants a loan to buy clothes to sell.
Hamidan Baji and Razia Baji each want a loan to buy seasonal fruits to sell.
This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy groceries for a grocery store

loans.name: Pastora

texts.en:
Pastora T. makes a living primarily from selling herbs and spices in the local community. She is 55 years old, married and has six adult children. She is from the village of Tipolo. Pastora has been in business for over five years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Pastora joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and to enable her to engage in business activities. Pastora has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Pastora is now requesting a loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional merchandise. This will be her third loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional herbs and spices

loans.name: Manchuria

texts.en:
Manchuria R. is from the town of Lopez Jaena. She is 50 years old, widowed and has four adult children. To make a living, Manchuria owns and operates a fishing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Manchuria has been in this business for over eleven years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2000, Manchuria joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Manchuria has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. She is now requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be her 14th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in a fishing business

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes S. is from the village of Upper Puntod. She is 46 years old. Lourdes is married and has six school-age children. To make a living, Lourdes makes and sells food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of food products in the local community. Lourdes has been engaged in her business for more than two years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Lourdes joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lourdes has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Lourdes is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will also be used to purchase raw ingredients. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Lourdes from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Gabriela

texts.en:
Gabriela P. makes a living running a general store, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. She is 60 years old, married and has seven adult children. She is from the village of Baybay Panalsalan. Gabriela has been in business for over eight years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month.

In 2000, Gabriela joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Gabriela has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC. Gabriela is now requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 16th loan taken out by Gabriela from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Lani

texts.en:
Lani P. is from the town of Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. She is 46 years old. Lani is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Lani owns & operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, & toothpaste in the local community. Lani has been engaged in her business for over 9 years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippine Pesos (about US $85) a month for these activities.

In 2001, Lani joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lani has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Lani is requesting a new loan of 30000 PHP which will be used to purchase  additional stocks for her retail store. This loan will be the 18th loan taken out by Lani from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase  additional stocks for her retail store

loans.name: Marianita

texts.en:
"Money doesn't grow on trees. You have to work hard to earn it and spend it wisely," says Marianita D., a farmer from Agusan Del Sur in Mindanao. She and her husband are renting a farm and till the land that they do not own. She hopes that some day she and her husband will be able to buy their own rice field. She also hopes that they will have an abundant harvest to support their family.

Marianita would like a loan of 10,000 PHP from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy urea fertilizers, seeds and herbicides. The loan will really help improve the harvest and increase their income as well.

CEVI helps small businesses grow. CEVI provides its clients with loans as well as training and insurance coverage.

loans.use: To purchase urea fertilizers, seeds and herbicides

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome has been a bites seller in the Kihesa neighborhood of Iringa for three years. She belongs to the Mwenge West loan group (code 2020). She currently earns an average monthly profit of approximately $100. Every day she works at her business for 12 hours.

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so she can buy more wheat flour, sugar and cooking oil, to make different bites for resale. She hopes her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Salome is 33 years old, married, and has three children: ages 12, 7 and four. She also cares for four dependents.

loans.use: Buy more wheat flour, sugar and cooking oil.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha has owned a small charcoal store in the Sakina neighborhood of Arusha for five years. She belongs to the Amken loan group (code 2022). She currently earns an average monthly profit of approximately $185. Every day she works at her business for 12 hours.

She is requesting her third loan from BRAC Tanzania so she can buy more charcoal to add to her stock. Asha is hoping her profit will increase so she will be able to grow her business.

Asha is 23 years old, married, and has two children: ages six and five.

loans.use: Buy more charcoal.

loans.name: Marieta

texts.en:
"I am the tenant of a one-hectare farm. My husband and I work to save money to buy our own farm. I wish that we will always have an abundant harvest. We really wish we could send all our children to school and provide them all their needs," says Marieta G., 38, and mother of four children.

She requests a loan of Php 10,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to purchase fertilizers, Urea and certified seeds. The loan will truly help the couple improve their harvest and income.

CEVI helps small business grow. It provides loans, training and insurance coverage to its clients.

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers, Urea and certified seeds.

loans.name: Redemtda

texts.en:
Redemtda has been a tomato and vegetable seller in the Sakina neighborhood of Arusha for two years. She belongs to the Serengeti loan group (code 2080). She currently earns an average monthly profit of approximately $90. Every day she works at her business for seven hours.

Redemtda is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so she can buy more tomatoes and vegetable for resale, to expand her business. She is hoping that her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Redemtda is 30 years old, married, and has four children: ages 10, 8, 5 and 2. She also cares for five dependents.

loans.use: Buy tomatotes and vegetables.

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi has sold fruit and vegetables in the Sakina neighborhood of Arusha for three years. She belongs to the Amken loan group (code 2022). She currently earns an average monthly profit of approximately $50. Every day she works at her business for eight hours.

She is requesting her third loan from BRAC Tanzania so she can buy more vegetables and fruit to resell, to expand her business. She is hoping that her profit will increase and she will be able to get more food for her family.

Naomi is 23 years old, married, has two children: ages 4 and 1.

loans.use: Buy more vegetables and fruit for resale.

loans.name: Nasmah

texts.en:
Nasmah has run a tailoring business, and she is a hen and breaks seller in the Sakina neighborhood of Arusha. She belongs to the Juhudi loan group (code 2026). She currently earns an average monthly profit of approximately $530. Every day she works at her business for eight hours.

She is requesting her third loan from BRAC Tanzania to buy more tailoring items, hens and more cement and sand to make breaks. She is hoping that her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Nasmah is 43 years old, married, and has four children: ages 24, 22, 16 and 17. She also cares for five additional dependents.

loans.use: Buy more tailoring items.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Hawa Y., 37, is married and a mother. She is a food vendor who sells Kenkey in her neighborhood, and she has done so for four years. Kenkey is prepared from milled maize, cooked and taken with hot pepper, gravy stew or any kind of soup, fried fish or meat. She has many customers who enjoy Kenkey for breakfast, lunch and supper.

She wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials like maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood. She hopes to raise more income to support her husband and provide a quality education for the children. She would be grateful for your assistance. She belongs to the village bank called ‘God First.’

loans.use: Buy raw materials like maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood.

loans.name: Timothy

texts.en:
Timothy Y. is 43 year old and the father of two children. He makes soap. He combines materials like palm kernel oil, soda powder, cocoa pods and coconut oil to obtain his soaps. He is not able to produce large quantities for lack of funds.

He wants to take advantage of the loan facility to buy more raw materials and processing equipment to scale up production. He hopes to raise his income to support his children's education. He would be grateful for your assistance. He started this business some months ago. He belongs to the village bank called ‘Gyedie mu Aba’.

loans.use: Buy raw materials like palm oil, soda powder, cocoa pods and coconut oil.

loans.name: Fuseini

texts.en:
Fuseini B. is 31 years old married father of three children. All are schooling. Fuseini lives at Dorma in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana with his family. His wife is a petty trader who sells food stuffs on top of a table in the community market.

He is a professional bicycle repairer and he sells bicycle parts. Fuseini has been in this business for two years through which he obtains daily income to support his family.

He travels to Kumasi which is a nearby town to purchase his bicycle parts. He wants the loan to buy more bicycle parts to restock his inventory to avoid everyday traveling. With the loan he believes he can provide a quality education for his kids and grow his business growth. Fuseini would be grateful for your support. He belongs to the village bank called ‘Gyedie mu Aba’.

loans.use: Buy more bicycle parts for servicing.

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en:
Adwoa M. is a 55 year old widowed with five children. She is a very experienced mother who demonstrates motherhood with a sense of responsibility.

For five years, she has been selling Kenkey. Kenkey is a favorite food of many Ghanaian. It is tasty and so satisfying. It is prepared from milled maize grains, cooked and taken with hot pepper and fried fish.

Adwoa will use the loan to purchase raw materials such as maize, vegetable oil, vegetables and firewood in bulk. This will help her avoid constant price hikes resulting from the current food crisis in the country. She belongs to the village bank called ‘Gyedie mu Aba’.

loans.use: Buy raw materials such as maize, vegetable oil, vegetables and firewood in bulk.

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es: La Sra. Silvia R. y su conyuge Evan Cesar tienen dos hijos pequeños , de los cuales uno va al colegio, ella atiende su venta en su domicilio y su cónyuge es técnico en mantenimiento de heladeras, esta pareja jóven hacen de sus actividades la principal fuente de ingresos y gracias a la ayuda de Emprender que le da financiamiento han logrado sobresalir economicamente. La Sra. Silvia es socia antigua de emprender.
texts.en:
Silvia R. and her spouse Evan Cesar have two small children, one of which attends school. She attends to her sales in her home and her spouse is refrigerator maintenance technician. This young couple has made their principal activities their source of income and thanks to the help from Emprender who has granted them loans they have been able to get ahead economically. Silvia is an old member of Emprender.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase work capital and purchase a phone booth.

loans.name: Cirila

texts.es:
La Sra. Cirila vive en la comunidad “Cañada Strongesrt”, hace mas de 29 años en la cual tiene formada su familia,  cuenta con una parcela de 20 hectáreas de tierra, en la cual vive con su esposo El Sr. Román Grande y sus nueve hijos.
Esta familia se dedica netamente a la agricultura, el préstamo que están solicitando es para la siembra de papa, fuera de sembrar papa asimismo siembran, maíz yuca y camote. También cuentan con 3 cabezas de ganado y dos chanchitos.
texts.en:
Cirila has lived in the “Cañada Strongesrt” community for over 29 years where she has formed a family, and counts on a 20 hectares plot of land on which she lives with her husband Román Grande and their nine children. This family dedicates itself distinctly to agriculture; the loan that they are requesting is to plant potatoes, aside from which they also plant corn, manioc, and sweet potato. They also have 3 head of cattle, and two small pigs.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase potato seed.

loans.name: Gilda

texts.en:
Gilda is a 50-year-old client of ASKI. She raises hogs and lives in Minallo, Naguillan, Isabela. She is married to Pedro V. who is a 56-year-old farmer. She is blessed with three children. Her eldest has already finished college while the other two are still studying. Gilda wants to sustain her business by purchasing enough feed to raise her swine. 
To accomplish this, she is requesting a loan of 19,000 PHP. She also hopes that with this loan she will be able to reopen a general store that she was forced to close. Gilda hopes to slowly improve her circumstances by working very hard, having patience, and through a good working relationship with her husband.

loans.use: To purchase hog feed

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
To assist her husband in providing for their family, Lilibeth started a business selling vegetables. She has already successfully paid back her previous loan and is requesting a second loan to add needed capital to her business. She is requesting a loan of PHP 6,000 for her business and for the cultivation of her vegetable garden where she also gets some of her produce. Lilibeth says that her business is very helpful to her family. She is glad that she has a husband who is very supportive of her business. They are working together very hard and hope that they will be able to start saving a little for the education of their children.

Lilibeth is from the village of Minallo Naguillan, Isabela. She is 23 years old and is married to John G. who is 35 years old. Her husband works in Cauayan, Isabela, generating a small daily salary. The couple has already been blessed with one daughter, Joanna G., who is 3 years old. At the moment, Joanna is serving as their inspiration, giving them the will to persevere and to be more diligent in their work.

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en: Lolita is a 44-year-old vendor in the village of Minallo Naguilian, Isabela. She is married to Delfin M. and they were blessed with two children who are now both married. In her youth, Lolita was only able to finish elementary school. Despite this, Lolita strives for the fulfillment of her business dreams. She is requesting a second loan of PHP 10,000 to expand her business. Right now she earns just PHP 500 every week, which is no longer enough to support their daily expenditures. She is hoping to increase her weekly income through the loan and hard work. She knows that through her diligent resourcefulness, she can gradually achieve all her goals in life.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna has two businesses: she raises hogs and sells vegetables in her village. Her husband, Artemio S., is sick at the moment with two years of medical treatment. Angela, her eldest daughter, will soon enter college. She hopes to support all her needs. Myrna also hopes to do the same for her younger children when they enter college. According to Myrna, her children’s ambition in life is also her ambition, and their achievements are also hers. These occurrences in her life really challenge her to work harder, sacrifice and practice patience.

Myrna is requesting a second loan of 12,000 PHP to further expand both businesses. The money will be a big help to her business and her family, especially for the education of her children. Myrna has been in business for ten years and hopes that she can now expand and obtain a higher level of income. Her goals in life motivate her to work harder and learn to sacrifice in order to become successful.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is 30 years old. Her family lives happily in the village of Minallo, Naguillan, Isabela. She is married to Elybert A. and they have a 5-year-old child. Rowena is requesting a loan of PHP 7,000. This is her second loan request and she says it will be very helpful in sustaining her general store. Selling has been her passion since before she was married. She has also just started a hog-raising business and hopes that it will be able to help pay for her child’s schooling in the future.

She believes in the quotation that says, “a family that prays together stays forever.” Rowena believes that through praying together her family will create a strong bond and always have a good relationship. Moreover, Rowena also hopes that someday her child and future children will be successful with their studies and goals in life. This is why, together with her husband, she is working hard for the future welfare of their family.

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Mañaneras Group

texts.es:
Aida C..- es la presidenta del banco comunal, se dedica a la actividad D. la panaderia la misma que hace 10 que viene realizando el negocio.
Enviudó hace 5 años atrás ahora en la que se convirtió en el único sustento para su hogar.
Ella cuenta con casa propia, su objetivo es aumentar su capital y agrandar su panaderia, ya que empezó a diversificar sus productos con repostería.
Bernarda C..- vive en el barrio 3 D. mayo en la localidad D. la Guardia a 20km. D. la cuidad D. Santa Cruz. En casa alquilada en la que vive con sus dos hijos y esposo el Sr. Mario Méndez, D. profesión chofer.
Tiene como actividad la venta D. masitas esto lo realiza en la misma zona al frente D. la H.A.M. D. la Guardia.
Rosa Aceri.- tiene como actividad la venta D. cosméticos, el destino D. préstamo fue para la compra D. una maquina D. costura, oficio el cual  esta empezando a adquirir .Es madre soltera, la misma que tiene la responsabilidad, D. su familia es una persona muy trabajadora ya que la misma es la que sostiene a toda su familia. Su sueño D. la Sra. Es llegar a comprarse su casa propia.
texts.en:
Aida C. is the president of this communal bank. Aida was widowed 5 years ago and became the sole breadwinner for her household. She has maD. her living with a bakery for ten years. She is also a homeowner and would like to increase her capital so she can grow her bakery. Aida has already begun to diversify what she sells in the bakery. Bernarda C. lives in the 3 D. mayo neighborhood of Santa Cruz in a home she rents. She lives with her two children and her husband, Mr. Mario Méndez. Her husband works as a driver. Bernarda sells dough for a living. She works in the same area she lives in, in front of H.A.M. D. la Guardia. Rosa Aceri sells cosmetics for a living. She is just starting a business as a seamstress and has asked for a loan so she can buy a sewing machine. Rosa is a single mother. She has total responsibility for her family and is therefore a very hardworking woman. She dreams of buying her own house.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Aumento de capital

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is 36 years old and married to Renato C., who is 42 years old. Renato is a local farmer in their agriculture-based community village, Barangay Minallo Naguillan, Isabela . They are blessed with three children: the eldest, Rhea Joyce, is 14 years old and a high school student; Rosalie is 10 years old and is studying in the primary level, while Ryan is 4 years old.

In addition to farming, her family also earns a living selling vegetables. Susana manages the vegetable sales daily in order to supply her family with their immediate necessities. She is about to renew her loan with ASKI and is requesting PHP 6,000 as additional working capital for her business. Susana happily shares with us that her sales really are a big help paying for the studies of her children. She hopes that her business will grow and last for a very long time. With the new loan, she hopes to improve their whole house and assist her children as they pursue their education.

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is currently involved in selling vegetables. She goes from house-to-house in their village to sell her produce. She has found that vending house-to-house is much more effective than just displaying her produce in an improvised vending stall in front of their house. 
Teresita is 53 years old and married to Juanito P. who is 57 years old. They reside in the village of Minallo, Naguillan, Isabela, and they have been blessed with five children. Their first child, Lorely, is 34 years old; Arnel is 32 years old; Gerlie is 30 years old; Madeline is 26 years old and Arjay is 13 years old. Teresita hopes that her business grows so that she can pay for her youngest child’s education.
She is requesting a loan of PHP 6,000 for the improvement of her business. She will utilize the loan as additional working capital and it will enabling her to purchase different kinds of vegetables.

loans.use: Business improvement

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
“Time is gold” is Violeta J.'s motto. Time is running fast and she doesn't want to waste it. She thinks taking out a loan will be a great advantage for her family. Violeta is 21 years old and married to Leny, a construction worker. They currently live in Barangay, Minallo Naguillan, Isabela, Phillipines with their two children, Mark Justine and Precious. 

Violeta raises hogs. She helps earn additional income for the welfare of their children. She is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase additional piglets to raise in her pig pen. Violeta is sad because she no longer has her vending business. However, she has hope and believes there is always a way to overcome difficulties in life. She plans to improve her pig business so she can continue providing financial needs for her children and keep them in school.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Arturo De Jesus

texts.es: El señor Arturo de Jesús Rodríguez , tiene la edad de 39 años , habita en el barrio Medardo Andino , junto a su esposa la cual es comerciante y le apoya con los gastos del hogar , ellos tiene  tres hijos ; dos de ellos ya casados y un de 18 años que todavía esta a su cargo , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida y darle un mejor bienestar , el desde hace 17 años se dedica a la activad agrícola , la mayor dificultad que se le presenta son las plagas y el mal tiempo ya que esto le ha provocado muchas perdidas. Inicio con sus propios esfuerzos esta actividad. Los planes futuros son poder diversificar su cultivo. Con el financiamiento va a comprar insumos y fertilizantes para aplicar al cultivo y poder obtener una producción para vender a mejor costo.
texts.en:
Mr. Arturo de Jesus R. is 39 years old, lives in the Medardo Andino neighborhood with his wife, who is a business woman and helps him with the expenses of the home. They have three children, two of them already married and one of 18 years of age still dependent on them. His plans for his family are to improve their living conditions and well being. He has been a farmer for 17 years. His greatest difficulties are the pests and bad weather, both of which have caused many losses. He started this activity on his own. He plans to be able to diversify his crops. With the proceeds of the loan he will buy supplies and fertilizers for his fields, in order to obtain better production and ability to sell at a better price.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies and fertilizers to apply to his crops.

loans.name: Nemecia

texts.es: La señora Nemecia L. V. es una persona jóven y dinámica, se dedica a la venta de abarrotes en una pequeña tienda de barrio que no esta muy surtida, el crédito le ayudará a comprara más productos para su negocio, en la misma casa tiene una  cabina de teléfonos desde hace dos años, es conocida en su barrio como una persona solidaria. Ella es casada y su esposo se dedica a la venta de celulares los cuales los vende ambulando, tienen 2 hijos y viven en casa propia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nemecia L. V is a young and dynamic person. She makes a living selling groceries in a small store in the neighborhood, a store that is not very well stocked. The loan will help her to buy more products for her business. In the same house, for the last two years she has had a telephone booth. She is known in the area as a very supportive person. She is married and her husband sells cell phones door to door. They have 2 children and live in their own home.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of groceries for resale (Rice, noodles and others)

loans.name: Lucrecia Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Lucrecia O.  Alemán, tiene la edad de 46 años, habita en los altos de la ciudad de Masaya, junto a su esposo el cual es comerciante y le apoya con los gastos del hogar, ya que ellos tienen cuatro hijos , dos mayores de edad independientes y dos que todavía tienen a cargo , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condicione de vida , ella desde hace veinte años se dedica a la actividad agrícola , la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es la falta de financiamiento y la sequilla afecta gran parte. Con el financiamiento va a comprar fertilizantes e insumos para aplicar al cultivo y poder tener una mejor cosecha la cual seria de gran beneficio para  poder proyectarse en sus meta, da las gracias a la institución por el apoyo que le ha brindado.
texts.en:
Lucrecia O. Alemán is 46 and lives in Los Altos in the city of Masaya, along with her husband who is a shopkeeper and pays for the household expenses. They have four children: two are of age and independent, and two are still in their care. Their plan is to improve their family's standard of living. Lucrecia has worked in agriculture for twenty years. The hardest thing is about that is the lack of finances, and drought also has a big effect. Lucrecia plans to use her loan to buy fertilizers and supplies for her crops so she can have a better harvest, which will be very beneficial to helping her achieve her goals. She is thankful to AFODENIC for all the support it has given her.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies and fertilizers for her crops.

loans.name: Rosmery

texts.es: LA SEÑORA ROSMERY, VIVE EN VILLA SEBASTIAN PAGADOR, ZONA SUR DE LA CIUDAD, SE TRASLADA TODOS LOS DÍAS AL MERCADO LA PAMPA, DONDE TIENE SU NEGOCIO DE VENTA DE LIBROS NUEVOS Y USADOS, DESARROLLA ESTA ACTIVIDAD JUNTO CON SU ESPOSO, QUIEN EN OCASIONES TAMBIEN REALIZA TRABAJOS DE MECÁNICA AUTOMOTRIZ. TIENEN 2 HIJOS PEQUEÑOS. POR EL ESFUERZO LA PAREJA LOGRO TENER CASETA PROPIA EN EL MERCADO, LO QUE ES MUY IMPORTANTE PARA ELLOS PORQUE ES SU MEDIO DE GENERAR INGRESOS.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rosmery lives in Sebastian Pagador, in the south zone of the city. Everyday, she travels to the La Pampa market, where she sells both new and used books. Rosmery does this work with her husband, and they sometimes do automotive repair work as well. They have 2 small children. Due to their hard work, the couple has their own stand at the market, which is very important for them, as this is their primary source of income.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Lucas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase books

loans.name: Cristhian Gerardo

texts.es: El joven Cristian Gerardo López Z. , tiene la edad de 28 años , habita en el barrio Juan Ramón Padilla en la comunidad de Ticuantepe, junto a sus padres , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida , desde hace un año , el inicio las ventas de camisetas , gorras , stiker , entre otros accesorios , la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es la falta de financiamiento , ya que tiene una demanda superior a su alcance , el inicio esta actividad con su propios esfuerzos , el trabajaba como cocinero en los estados unidos y ahorro para poder ser el mismo jefe de su negocio . Ahora  con las ventas antes mencionadas quiere incrementar su pedido .El financiamiento lo quiere para la compra de camisetas, stiker y otros producto variado que vende lo cual espera con este tener mejores venta y mejores utilidades el cual se beneficiara en el crecimiento comercial.
texts.en:
The young man Cristian Gerardo L. Z. is 28 years old, lives in the Juan Ramon Padilla neighborhood of the Ticuantepe community, together with his parents. His plans are to improve the living conditions of his family. A year ago he started selling tee shirts, caps, decals and other accessories. His major difficulty is the lack of financing. There is a greater demand for his products that he can achieve. He started this business on his own. He used to work as a cook in the US, and saved to be able to be his own boss in his business. Now, with the before mentioned sales he wants to increase his orders. The loan is to be for the purchase to T-shirts, decals and other products that he sells. He hopes to have better sales and higher profits and benefit from the growth of his business.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of T-shirts, caps, decals and other varied products.

loans.name: Flora

texts.es:
La Sra. Flora S., vive en la localidad de Cañada Strongerst, perteneciente al municipio del Torno cuidad de Santa Cruz. Es nacida en la cuidad de Chuquisaca pero hace 8 años que se vino a vivir a esta cuidad donde ahora vive con sus esposo y su hijo.
Ella tanto como su esposo el Sr. Mariano Retamozo se dedican a la actividad de la agricultura. El préstamo que fue solicitado fue para aumentar su capital  para la siembra de papa,  se encuentran en plena época para la siembra de este producto. Tienen una parcela de 10 hectáreas. Además cuenta con tres vacas, cinco chanchos y 50 gallinas.
texts.en:
Mrs. Flora S. lives in Cañada Strongerst, in the Torno municipality of Santa Cruz. She was born in the city of Chuquisaca, and came here 8 years ago to live with her husband and her son. Alongside her husband, Mr. Mariano Retamozo, Flora works in agriculture. She is asking for a loan to increase her capital and plant her fields with potatoes, as it is currently high season for potato planting. Flora has 10 hectares of land, 3 cows, 5 pigs, and 50 chickens.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Lucas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase potato seedlings.

loans.name: Maria Samaria

texts.es: La señora Maria Samaria López, tiene la edad de 47 años, habita en le barrio San Ignacio, ubicado en la concepción, junto a su esposo el cual trabaja y le apoya con los gastos del hogar, ellos tienen a su cargo tres hijos, todos estudian actualmente y en sus tiempos libres le apoyan en los trabajos agrícolas. Los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida y darle un buen bienestar a todos, ella desde hace veinticinco años trabaja en la agricultura, la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es la falta de financiamiento, los planes hacia un futuro en su cultivo es poder diversificarlo. Con el préstamo obtenido va a compara los insumos necesarios para el cultivo y aplicar para poder obtener una buena producción.
texts.en:
Maria Samaria López is 47 and lives in the San Ignacio neighborhood in Concepción along with her husband, who works and supports her with the household expenses. They have three children, who are all currently in school but help out with the farm work in their spare time. Maria's plans for her family include improving their quality of life and providing for their well-being. For the past twenty-five years she has worked in agriculture. The hardest part about that is the lack of finances. In the future she plans to diversify her crops. She'll use her loan to buy the supplies she needs to use on her crops to improve productivity.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies and fertilizers for her crops.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es:
La Srta. Lourdes M., vive con el Sr. Paulino Cruz, ella tiene 20 años de edad. Vive en la localidad de Cañada Strongerst, donde cuenta con una parcela de 10 hectáreas, en la que siembran algunos productos como ser maíz, camote y yuca. Este préstamo fue solicitado es para la compra de semilla de papa y algunos remedios para fumigar contra plagas que le afectan a este producto. 
Ella nos comenta que se siente muy agradecida con la institución ya que se le dio la oportunidad para poder trabajar con prestamos y de esta manera poder aumentar su capital y mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Ms. Lourdes M. lives with Mr. Paulino Cruz. She is 20 years old, and lives in Cañada Strongerst, where she has a parcel of 10 hectares and plants things such as corn, sweet potatoes, and yuca. She is asking for a loan to purchase potato seeds and pesticides to combat potato pests. She told us that she feels very grateful to the microfinance institution, as it gave her the opportunity to work with loans, and therefore increase her capital and improve her revenue.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Lucas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase potato seedlings.

loans.name: Eulogia

texts.es:
La sra. Eulogia Mamani es nacida en la cuidad de Chuquisaca, pero hace mas de 20 años que se vino a vivir a la cuidad de Santa Cruz.
Actualmente vive en la Localidad de Cañada Strongesrt, en la cual cuenta con una parcela de 18 hectáreas. 
Vive con su esposo el Sr. Casiano Cruz, y sus dos hijos, ellos se dedican a la actividad de la agricultura.
El préstamo que fue solicitado fue para la compra de semilla de papa, y otros productos más como ser, yuca y maíz. También cuentan con 2 vacas, dos chanchos y 20 gallinas. Que estos les sirven para la venta y consumo propio.
texts.en:
Ms. Eulogia Mamani was born in the city of Chuquisaca, but she came to live in the city of Santa Cruz over 20 years ago.

She currently lives in the Cañada Strongesrt locality, where she has an 18-hectare plot of land.

She lives with her husband, Mr. Casiano Cruz, and their two children, all of whom are in agriculture.

She is requesting this loan to purchase potato seeds and other products, such as cassava and corn. They also have two cows, two pigs, and 20 chickens, which they sell or consume themselves.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase potato seeds

loans.name: Reyna Isabel

texts.es: La señora Reyna Isabel P. Martines , tiene la edad de 30 años , habita en le barrio el edén , ubicado en el municipio de Ticuantepe , ella es madre soltera , a su cargo tiene un hijos , el cual trabaja y le apoya con los gastos del hogar , desde hace cinco años trabaja como agricultora , la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es la falta de financiamiento y las plagas que le afecta a su cultivo,  los planes hacia un futuro es poder darle mejor condiciones de vida a su hijo y diversificar el cultivo . Con el financiamiento va comprar fertilizantes e insumos para aplicar al cultivo y poder obtener una buena producción.
texts.en:
30-year old Señora Reyna Isabel P. Martines lives in the Eden neighbourhood of Ticuantepe. She is a single mother and has a son who works and contributes to household expenses. She has worked in agriculture for five years. The greatest difficulty she faces is the lack of credit and the pests which affect her crops. She would like to be able to provide a better standard of living for her son and to plant a variety of crops in the future. With the loan she will buy fertilizer and other agricultural products to put on her fields to ensure a good harvest.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and other agricultural products to put on her fields

loans.name: Uriel Antonio

texts.es: El joven Uriel Antonio A. M., tiene la edad de 23 años, habita en el barrio Planes del Arenal, ubicado en el municipio de Nindirí, junto a su esposo , el cual trabaja para apoyarle con los gastos del hogar , ellos tiene a su cargo un hijo de tres año de edad , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida , el desde hace cinco años se dedica a la agricultura la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es la falta de financiamiento y la sequilla que le ha afectado en gran parte , su objetivo a un futuro es poder establecer diversas hortalizas . Con el financiamiento va a comprar semillas e insumos para comenzar a sembrar la cosecha,  lo cual espera tener una buena producción y poder vender a mejor precio en el M..
texts.en:
Uriel Antonio A. M. is a 23-year old young man who lives with his wife in the neighbourhood of Planes del Arenal located in the municipality of Nindirí. His wife also works to help him with household expenses. They have a 3-year old son to look after, and they would like to improve their standard of living. For five years Uriel has worked in agriculture. The biggest problem he faces is the lack of credit and the drought which has seriously affected his crops. In the future he would like to diversify and grow a variety of vegetables. With the loan he will buy seeds and agricultural products so he can begin planting his fields. He hopes to have a good harvest and sell his crops for a better price in the market.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seeds and agricultural products to improve his fields

loans.name: Guillermo Agapito

texts.es: El señor Guillermo Agapito Narváez , tiene la edad de 33 años habita en le barrio planes del Arenal , ubicado en le municipio de Nindirí , junto a su esposa , que trabaja  en la costura en su casa de habitación , ellos tiene a su cargo tres hijos , que actualmente estudian , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida , desde hace cinco años , don Guillermo se dedica a los trabajos agrícolas , la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es la falta de financiamiento , los planes hacia un futuro es mejorar las condiciones de sus tierras . Con el financiamiento va a comprar insumos y fertilizantes para comenzar a sembrar la siembra la espera sea una buena cosecha.
texts.en:
33-year old Guillermo Agapito Narváez lives with his wife in the neighbourhood of Arenal, located in the municipality of Nindirí. His wife is a seamstress and works at home. They have three children who currently attend school. In the future they would like to have a better standard of living. Guillermo has worked in agriculture for five years, and the greatest problem that he faces is the lack of credit. He would like to improve the condition of his fields, so he plans to use the loan to buy agricultural products and fertilizers and begin planting his crops. He is hoping for a good harvest.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy agricultural products and fertilizers for his crops

loans.name: Olivia

texts.es:
La señora Olivia vive con sus tres hijos y su esposo el señor Arturo, ellos son una familia muy unida y estable. 
Ella labora como maestra de una escuela, su esposo trabaja para una empresa vendedora de lácteos. 
Tienen un proyecto que están realizando, que es la ampliación de un cuarto en su casa;
Para así obtener más comodidad para la familia, ya que sus hijos están creciendo y requieren de mayor espacio. 
Por lo tanto están solicitando este crédito para la colocación de unos castillos del cuarto en construcción.
texts.en:
Mrs. Olivia lives with her three children and her husband, Mr. Arturo. They are a very close knit and stable family. She works as a school teacher and her husband works for a company that sells dairy products. They have a project that they are working on which is the extention of a room in their house. This will bring more comfort to their family, since their children are growing and need more space. The reason for this loan is to put reinforcements for the room that is under construction.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Place reinforcements for the construction of a room in their home.

loans.name: Maria Lina

texts.es: María Lina esta solicitando su 3er credito a la Institucion de AFODENIC, el año pasado fue  beneficiada  por  el fondo Kiva y con el credito que obtuvo logro invertir en la construcción de una habitación, manifiesta que se siente satisfecha de trabajar con AFODENIC ya que el interés es bajo y accesible para personas de escasos recursos economicos y estos creditos le han permitido mejorar sus condiciones de vida;  doña Maria pago dos meses adelantados para optar a un nuevo finaciamiento y asi seguir mejorando sus condiciones de vida, ella es una señora trabajadora, honesta y muy querida por los padres de familia y la comunidad, ama su trabajo como docente ya que ayuda a leer y escribir a mucho niños campesinos de su comunidad, a pesar que ella no tiene ningun hijo a cargo le ayuda a sus hijos a cuidar a sus nietos y cuando puede con algunis gastos familiares, con este credito pretende construir los servicios higienicos para asi tener una vivienda digna y mas bonita, su sueño es que Diosito le de salud, trabajo y tener una vivienda con mejores  condiciones.
texts.en:
María Lina is requesting her third loan from the AFODENIC Instuitution. Last year, she was supported by the Kiva fund and she invested her loan in the construction of a home. She says that she is very satisfied with AFODENIC because it has low interest rates and is accessible to people with limited economic resources. These loans have enabled her to improve her living conditions. Ms. Maria paid two months ahead to switch to a new financing plan and in that way continue improving her living conditions. She is hardworking, honest, and beloved by her parents and the community. She loves her job as a teacher because she gets to help many rural children from her community to read and write. Although her own children no longer depend on her, she helps with the care of her grandchildren, and whenever possible she helps her children with some of their family expenses. With this loan, she expect to install a plumbing system so that she can have more dignified and beautiful housing. Her dream is that God will bless her with health, work, and better conditions in her home.

Translated from Spanish by Leah Karlins, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To install plumbing in her home

loans.name: Rosa Amelia

texts.es: Rosa Amelia es casada, de 40 años de edad, con 2 hijas de 14 y 3 años, la niña mayor esta estudiando en la UNAN Managua el 2do año de nutricion, su esposo trabaja en Nueva Guinea y aporta para los gastos del hogar. La profesora Rosa Amelia trabaja en el instituto San Sebastian de Acoyapa como docente, con 19 años de servicio, esta solicitando su 8vo credito para utilizarlo en la construccion del porche de su casa, de todos sus creditos solo uno utilizo para compra de medicamentos, el resto los ha utilizado para invertirlos en su vivienda, ya que es la unica manera de salir adelante y darle comodidad a su familia, pues es muy dificil ahorrar para invertir.  Manifiesta sentirse satisfecha por la atencion que le ha brindado AFODENIC pues esta con la institucion desde su apertura.
texts.en:
Rosa Amelia is 40 and married with two daughters, 14 and 3. Her older daughter is in her second year studying Nutrition at UNAN Managua. Her husband works in New Guinea and contributes to the household expenses. She has been a teacher at the San Sebastian Institute in Acoyapa for 19 years. Rosa Amelia is seeking her 8th loan, which she'll use to build a porch on her house. She has used only one of her loans to buy medicines. She's invested the rest in her house; that's the only way to get ahead and provide comfort to her family since it is very hard to save for investment. She expresses her feelings of satisfaction for the service AFODENIC has provided her, and she's been with the organization since its inception.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a porch

loans.name: Jose

texts.es: El señor José P. Córdobas , tiene la edad , de 48 años , habita en el barrio planes del arenal , junto a su esposa , la cual trabaja como domestica para apoyarle con los gastos del hogar , ellos tiene cinco a hijos a su cargo , todos menores de edad , los planes hacia su familia es mejor la condiciones de vida de sus hijos , don José desde hace cuarenta años trabaja como agricultor , el inicio esta actividad con sus propios esfuerzos . Con el financiamiento va a comprar semillas y fertilizantes para sembrar y poder obtener una buena cosecha.
texts.en:
José P. Cordobas is 48 years old. He lives in the Planes del Arenal neighborhood with his wife, who works as a maid to support him with the household expenses. They have five young children to care for. Their hopes for their family are to improve the living conditions of their children. Mr. José has worked as a farmer for the past forty years, working on his own initiative. With this loan, he will buy seeds and fertilizer to plant in order to obtain a good harvest.

Translated from Spanish by Leah Karlins, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Maria del Carmen O., tiene la edad de 42 años, habita en el, barrio el edén, junto a su esposo el cual trabaja como comerciante para apoyarle con los gastos del hogar, ellos tienen a su cargo dos hijos, los cuales estudian actualmente , los planes hacia su familia es poder apoyar siempre a sus hijos , para que culminen una carrera profesional, ella desde hace once años se dedica a los trabajos agrícolas , la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es la falta de financiamiento , en un futuro si llega a mejor la dificultades quiere diversificar su cultivo . Con el financiamiento lo va a invertir en insumos y fertilizantes para mejorar la siembra.
texts.en:
Maria Carmen O. is 42 and lives in the Edén neighborhood with her husband, who works as a shopkeeper to pay for the household expenses. They have two children who are currently in school. Maria intends to always support her children so they can realize professional careers. For the past eleven years she has earned her living doing agricultural work. The hardest part is the lack of finances. In the future, if she manages to overcome her difficulties, Maria wants to diversify her crops. She plans to invest her loan in supplies and fertilizers to improve cultivation.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies and fertilizers for cultivating her crops.

loans.name: Digna Rosa

texts.es: La señora Digna Rosa Pérez M. , tiene la edad de 35 años , habita en el barrio Esquí pulas , junto a su esposo el cual trabaja como guarda de seguridad , para apoyarla con los gastos del hogar , ellos tienen a su cargo dos niñas una de 10 años que estudia su primaria y otra de un añito , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida , doña Digna desde hace cuatro años trabaja en una casa privada como ama de llaves , al inicio con sus propios esfuerzos , fue construyendo poco a poco su casa , pero se le es difícil sin un financiamiento , los sueños de ella es ver construida su vivienda y por eso que opto por trabajar con nosotros y esta contenta ya que con el primer financiamiento logro hacer parte de la vivienda y ahora con este segundo terminara parte de sala. A futuro espera terminar y tener una casa digna para su familia.
texts.en:
Digna Rosa Pérez M., 35, lives in the Esquí Pulas neighborhood. She lives with her husband, who works as a security guard to help with the household expenses. They have a ten-year old daughter, who is in elementary school, and a one-year old daughter. The family's plan is to improve their living conditions. Digna has been working as a housekeeper in a private home for four years. Through her own efforts, they have been building their house little by little. But it is difficult without financing. Her dreams are to see her house finished. That is why she has opted to work with AFODENIC. She is happy with the part of her house that she did with the first loan. Now, with the second loan, she will finish the living room. In the future, she hopes to finish and have a decent house for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials to finish her living room

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: Juan Carlos es casado, de 29 años de edad, con una niña, su esposa trabaja como alumna ayudande en la UNAN, ambos asumen los gastos del hogar, es trabajador del Banco de Credito Centroamericano, con 4 años de servicio, destacandose como un trabajador ejemplar.  Habita en su casa, la que esta pagando al credito, pero necesita realizar algunas mejoras como son: mejorar la cocina con el pantry, ceramica para la sala y la cocina y repellar una pared, esto con la intencion de brindar mayor comodidad a su familia, este es su 1er credito que solicita, con la seguridad que sabra honrar su compromiso y que este es inicio de una serie de creditos, pues son muchas las mejoras que desea hacer.
texts.en:
Juan Carlos is 29 years old and married with a daughter. His wife works as a teaching assistant at UNAN (The Autonomous National University of Nicaragua). They both share the household expenses. Juan Carlos has worked for the Banco de Credito Centroamericano (Credit Bank of Central America) for four years where he has distinguished himself as an exemplary employee. He lives in his own house which he is buying on credit, but it needs some improvements, such as fixing up the kitchen with a pantry, and ceramic tile for the living room and kitchen. This would make it more comfortable for his family. This is the first loan which he is requesting with the security that he knows how to fulfill his commitment, and that this is the first of a series of loans because there are many more improvements that he would like to make.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To extend and put tile on the roof.

loans.name: Fabiola Rosaura

texts.es: Fabiola es soltera, de 31 años de edad, trabajadora de la Corte Superema de Justicia como juez local civil  en el municipio de Acoyapa, con 7 años de servicio, por el momento habita en casa de sus padres, pero esta solicitando credito para la construccion de 200 mts de sanjeo para una tapia, con la intencion de dar mayor seguridad a su vivienda que esta ubicada en el Residencial Bosques de Juigalpan. Plantea que tiene un salario bueno y que ademas cuenta con el apoyo de su papá quien es ganadero, por eso quiere aprovechar para realizar el trabajo ahora, para que cuando en un futuro tenga su propia familia tenga comodidad. Su horario de trabajo es de lunes a vierntes de 8:00am. a 1:00p.m.
texts.en:
Fabiola is 31 years old and single. She has worked at the Acoyapa Supreme Court of Justice as a local civil judge for 7 years.
She currently lives in her parents’ home, but is requesting a loan to construct a 200m ditch for a wall that will make her home, located in the Bosques de Juigalpan residential area, more secure. She mentions that she has a good salary and has the support of her father, a cattle farmer. As such, she would like to seize the opportunity to get the work done now, so that when she eventually has a family of her own, they can live in comfort.
She works Mondays to Fridays from 8:00am to 1:00pm.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of a wall

loans.name: Denis Alfonso

texts.es: El señor Denis Alfonso R. Pérez, tiene la edad de 34 años, habita en el barrio Buena Vista Nidirí junto a su esposa, la cual trabaja como domestica y le apoya con los gastos del hogar , ellos tienen dos hijos, los cuales estudian actualmente , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida , desde hace catorce años , se dedica a la rectoría de una iglesia evangélica, la mayor dificultad que se la presentado es en cuanto a lo económico por la enfermedad de su hija , el quiere el financiamiento para la compra de materiales de construcción ya que el techo de la vivienda está muy deteriorado y en tiempo de invierno , el agua se filtra en casi toda la casa, lo cual espera poder evitar cambiándolo y darle mas seguridad a su familia.
texts.en:
Mr. Denis Alfonso R. P. is 34 years old and lives in the neighborhood of Buena Vista Nidirí with his wife, who works as a maid to support the household expenses. They have two children, who are currently studying. Their plans are to improve the living conditions of their family. He has been working as a director of an evangelical church for the last fourteen years. The biggest challenge that he is facing is his economic situation due to his daughter illness.

He is asking for a loan to finance the purchase of building materials to fix the roof of his house. It is very deteriorated and during winter water seeps into almost everywhere in the house; which he hopes to avoid replacing the roof and keep his family safe.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials to repair the roof of his house

loans.name: Rosa

texts.pt:
Rosa S. é natural de Maputo cidade, tem 46 anos de idade, casada maritalmente e mãe de 3 filhos com idade entre o primeiro 26 anos, o segundo com 23 anos e o ultimo tem 17 anos todos ainda estudante. Apenas o primeiro já trabalha.

Rosa estudou até 9ªclasse e parou de continuar por situações sociais. A 10 anos que a senhora Rosa vive gerindo próprio negocio que consiste na venda de produtos e com destaque ao peixe que adquira na Baia do Maputo a preço de 100,00mt o quilo grama e vende por 160,00mt. Deste negocio consegue rendimento mensal de 8000,00mt.

Rosa solicita empréstimo na Hluvuku e no Kiva pela primeira vez e com qual pretende aumentar o seu estoque. Futuramente pretende construir uma outra casa fora da cidade e comprar uma viatura e tudo conta com o apoio de credito. 

Rosa aparece na foto vestida de vermelho com outros vendedores do mercado
texts.en:
Rosa S. is a native of Maputo. She is 46 years old, married and a mother of 3. Her children are 26, 23 and 17 years old. The latter two are students and the first already works.

Rosa studied through the 9th grade and stopped because of social issues. Rosa has owned her own business for more than 10 years. She sells various products as well as fish that she acquires from the Bay of Maputo. From this business she gains 8000.00mt monthly.

This is Rosa's first loan with Hluvuku and Kiva. She intends to increase her stock with the loan. In the future she intends to build a house outside of the city and to purchase a car.

In the photo of market vendors, Rosa appears dressed in red.

Translated from Portuguese by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase and resell fish

loans.name: Reyna De Los Angeles

texts.es: La señora Reyna de los Ángeles R. F., tiene la edad de 36 años habita en el barrio , Juan Ramón Padilla en el municipio de Ticuantepe  junto a su esposo el cual trabaja para apoyarle con los gastos del hogar , ellos tienen a su cargo cinco hijos , dos de ellos trabajan y son casados y tres están a su cargo , los pequeños actualmente estudian , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida , ella desde hace diez años , tiene una pulpería en su casa de habitación , ya que esta al pendiente de sus pequeños y la vez trabajando . Con el financiamiento ella va a incrementar su negocio comprando granos básicos, lácteos, carnes para ofertar a sus clientes variedad.
texts.en:
