Mrs. Reyna de los Angeles R. F. is 36 years old and lives in the neighborhood Juan Ramon Padilla, in the town of Ticuantepe with her husband, who works to assist with the household expenses. They have five children two of them work and are married but they are in charge of the other three who are small and go to school. Their plans are to improve their family conditions of life. She has had a grocery shop in her residence for the last ten years. She can take care of her children while she works. She is asking for a loan to buy grains, dairy and meats to offer more variety to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy grains, dairy and meats .

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma M. is from the village of Clarin, Plaridel Misamis Occidental. She is 43 years old. Wilma is separated from her spouse and has one adult child. To make a living, Wilma owns and operates a "sari-sari" or general retail store. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, etc., in the local community. Wilma has been engaged in her business for more than 12 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Wilma joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Wilma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Wilma is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell in her "sari-sari" or retail store. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Wilma from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Joy Ann

To make a living, Joy Ann owns and operates a "sari-sari" or general retail store. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste, etc., in the local community. Joy Ann has been engaged in her business for more than three years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Joy Ann joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Joy Ann has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell in her "sari-sari" store. Joy Ann is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will also be used to purchase new items to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Joy Ann from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business and for her family's basic needs.

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.en:
Trinidad R. makes a living primarily from manufacturing and selling products like sawali (woven bamboo mats used to construct walls) to local businesses and community members. She is from the village of Bobongan, Ramon Magsaysay, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 48 years old, married and has six school-aged children. Trinidad has been in this business for over 23 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Trinidad joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Trinidad is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase bamboo for manufacturing sawali. This will be her first loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children for this coming school year.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

This with be her fourth loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
Anecita M. is from the village of Makawa, Aloran Misamis Occidental. She is 56 years old. Anecita is married and has eight adult children. To make a living, Anecita owns and operates a manufacturing business. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from the making and selling of nipa huts (an indigenous house constructed out of bamboo tied together, with a thatched roof using nipa/anahaw leaves) and mats. Anecita has been engaged in her business for more than 19 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Anecita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Anecita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from GDMPC. Anecita is requesting a new loan of 11000 PHP which will be used additional capital for the business. This loan will be the seventh loan taken out by Anecita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling clothing to the local community. Rosalina has been engaged in her business for more than two years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month for these activities.

loans.name: Rutchie

texts.en:
Rutchie T. is from the village of Taboc Norte in Oroquieta City, the capital of Misamis Occidental province in the Philippines. She is 28 years-old and married with three infant children. To make a living, Rutchie owns and operates a "sari-sari," or retail store.  The main source of sales comes from everyday products such as shampoo, soap, and toothpaste, and the customers are people in the local community. Rutchie is just starting this business.

Rutchie has just joined GDMPC this year in hopes of getting access to financial services that will help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rutchie is requesting her first loan from GDMPC in the amount of 4000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell in her "sari-sari."  Rutchie plans to use the extra revenue generated from the additional items to improve and expand her store and to sustain her family's basic needs. 

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell in her store.

Ana Lore S. is from the village of Palayan in the Aloran municipality, which is in Misamis Occidental province in the Philippines. She is 25 years-old and married with one infant child.  To make a living, Ana Lore owns and operates a "sari-sari,"or retail store.  The biggest selling products in her store are products for daily use. Ana Lore has been in this business for over 6 years and earns approximately 5,500 PHP a month.

Ana Lore has just joined GDMPC this year in hopes of getting access to financial services that will help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ana Lore is requesting her first loan from GDMPC in the amount of 5000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell in her "sari-sari." About GDMPC:

loans.name: Prescille

Prescille S. is from the village of Taboc Norte in Oroquieta City, the capital of Misamis Occidental province in the Philippines. She is 31 years-old and married with one child who is still in school. To make a living, Prescille owns and operates a business selling clothes to the local community. Prescille has been in this business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

Prescille has just joined GDMPC this year in hopes of getting access to financial services that will help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Prescille is requesting her first loan from GDMPC in the amount of 5000 PHP to purchase new products to sell.  Prescille plans to save the extra revenue generated from the additional items in a reserve fund in case of future emergencies for her family. 

About GDMPC:

loans.use: To purchase new clothing items to sell.

loans.name: Venancia

texts.en:
Venancia B. is from the village of Panalsalan, Plaridel Misamis Occidental. She is 64 years old and married with four adult-aged children. To make a living, Venancia operates a "sari-sari" or general retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, etc., in the local community. Venancia has been engaged in her business for more than 30 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Venancia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Venancia is requesting a new loan of 3500 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell in her "sari-sari" store. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Venancia from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to her house.

Josefa is requesting a new loan of 3500 PHP, which will be used as additional capital for the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Josefa from GDMPC. To make a living, Christine owns & operates a business selling fish. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling fish to the local community. Christine is just starting this business.

In 2009, Christine joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Christine is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Christine from GDMPC. About GDMPC:

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie is engaged in a vending business in her village. She sells snack refreshments such as “halo-halo” and “balot” at night as an additional source of income.  She is requesting a loan of PHP 4,000 to be used in purchasing more of her vending products to sell daily in her village. Margie started this business just a month ago, and she wants to be more productive by having her business grow. This business is very important to her because it is her sole source of income. 

Her daily income is quite enough to provide their daily needs.  But Margie aims to become more successful in the business and she hopes through that, they can uplift their life from poverty.  Margie is 29 years old, and is married to Dominic B., a farm laborer. The couple is blessed with two children and they are happily living in the mountainous village of Batong Labang (Bintacan) Ilagan, Isabela.

loans.use: To purchase more products to sell

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is already 35 years old and she is married to Victor T., 34 years old, and serves as a laborer in their village. They live in Barangay Batong Labang of Ilagan, Isabela. They are blessed with two children who are Dianara, 10 years old, and Jay-Em, 7 years old. They are both in the primary level.

Marina has been engaged in selling second-hand clothes for one year already. She is selling different kinds of clothes for men and women on a house to house basis even in nearby villages. Marina would like to request an amount of PHP 4,000 as additional working capital for her business. She aims to grow her business by selling more second hand or used clothes where she could earn higher income. Her income will be increased if she could purchase more goods at once because of the transportation savings she could get. She wants her children to finish their study; that is why she always tries to double her time and effort in selling.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Mechille

texts.en:
Mechille has been engaged in the retail business for a very long time. Lack of working capital and a desire to develop growth in her business triggered her to request a loan of PHP12,000. Mechille dreams to give her children a good future by sending them to school and having them somehow finish a college course. She is thankful that her children are studying well at present and she hopes they will not change their ways of studying in the coming days.

Mechille is 30 years old and married to Fedy D. C.. They live in the village of San Lorenzo Ilagan Isabela, a rural place where agriculture is the major source of livelihood. They were blessed with three children, namely Christian Diether, Ivan and Femiley. Christian is 12, Ivan is 6 and Femily is merely 3.

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 47 years old and resides in Calamagui 1st Ilagan, Isabela. She is married to Manuel B., a 53-year-old truck driver. They have two children. Her eldest is Mylene, who is 25 and a college graduate now working abroad. Her second child, Manuel B. Jr., is 19 and studying as a fourth-year college student. Myrna dreams to have peace of mind for their family by finishing the studies of her child who is still studying. Giving them a comfortable life is her ultimate dream.

Myrna is requesting a loan of PHP 6,000 as additional working capital for her direct-selling business, where she sells Avon, Natasha and MSE products. She is also planning to purchase products like different kind of clothes, shoes and accessories for men and women. Myrna feels glad that she can afford to provide the daily needs of her children through the business she manages. She hopes that through her diligence in working, she can continue to send her youngest child to college.

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is already 47 years old and resides in Calamagui 1st Ilagan, Isabela.  She is married to Manuel B., who is 53 years old and a truck driver. They have two children. Her eldest is Mylene, 25 years old, and a college graduate now working abroad.  Her second child is Manuel B. Jr., 19 years old, who is studying as a fourth year college student. Myrna dreams of having peace of mind in their family by finishing the studies of her child who is still studying. Giving them a comfortable life is her ultimate dream. 

Myrna is requesting a loan of PHP 6,000 as additional working capital for her direct-selling business. She sells AVON, Natasha and MSE products.  She is also planning to purchase products like different kinds of clothes, shoes, and accessories for men and women.  Myrna feels glad that she can afford to provide the daily needs of her children through the business she manages. She hopes that through her diligence in working, she can continue to send her youngest child to college.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Laxmi

texts.en:
Mrs. Laxmi S. is a resident of Tangal. Tangal is located in Lalitpur district. Tangal is one of the busy bazaars in Lalitpur district and most of the people in this region are engaged in small businesses.
Mrs. S. lives in single family with her husband and two sons. Her husband, Mr. Binod S., is engaged in his own small business. Her older son is studying in grade 9 and younger son is in primary school.
Mrs. S. opened her sandal shop in a footpath in Tangal. She opened her shop in a footpath market because she cannot afford to pay high rent in Tangal area. She already has taken a loan from Kiva and has cleared her loan. With her previous loan, she bought different varieties of sandals for boys and girls, selling well and earning well. She is really encouraged to expand her business. Now she is requesting an Rs 30000.00 loan to buy different kinds of sandals for her shop.

loans.use: To buy different kinds of sandals

loans.name: Babita

texts.en:
Mrs. Babita S. lives in a single family with her husband and one son in Tangal Lalitpur.  Her son is studying in grade 11.
Mrs. S. and her husband Mr. Dinesh S. are engaged in their own electronics shop. They opened their electronics shop more than five years ago. They sell electronic goods such as irons, rice-cookers, and lots of other kitchen utensils in their shop. Nowadays, the demand for these items is increasing among working women. So to meet the demands of the customers, Mrs. S. is requesting Rs 20000.00 to invest in their shop.

loans.use: To buy electronic goods for her business

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en: Adelaida is a hardworking wife. She sells different groceries and vegetables in her small stall. Adelaida is married to Edgar D.. They help each other improve their business and are hoping to borrow a loan of PHP 24,000 for her business vending foods and other goods. Adelaida also is hoping to give her children better living conditions in the future by supporting their studies. She is doing her best to make her business become more profitable so that her family will somehow enjoy the fullness of life.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Meena

texts.en:
Miss Meena L. is a resident of Tangal. Tangal is located in Lalitpur district and most of the people in this region are engaged in small business.
Miss Meena L. lives with her father and one brother. Her father works in a private office and her brother is studying in grade 11. 
Miss L. opened a grocery shop three months ago. She sells different grocery goods in her shop. She opened her shop to strengthen the economic condition of her family. Now she is requesting her first loan of Rs10000.00 to increase the stock of food for her shop such as noodles, rice, biscuits and others. She is very much worried about the poor condition of her family and interested to increase the living style of her family.

loans.use: To buys grocery goods

loans.name: Brigida

texts.en: Brigida B. is engaged in a general store business in her village at Barangay Estrada Mallig, Isabela. She also manages a furniture shop business and a vending vegetables business. Brigida is seeking the financial support of lenders to lend her a loan amounting to PHP 9,000 as additional working capital. She believes that her business profit will allow her family a comfortable lifestyle in the future by simply using the amount wisely in her business. She also wants to have extra income so she will have savings. With the help of her four children, Brigida is able to maintain her chosen business and she hopes to sustain it for the future welfare of her children.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Anju

texts.en:
Mrs. Anju T., 22 years old, is a tailor in the town of Kulashwor.  She opened her tailoring shop more than a year ago. Before she opened her own shop, she took six month of training for tailoring work. Her specialty is making custom-fitted ladies dresses and school uniforms for both boys and girls. She prefers to make popular dresses like the Kurta Sulwar, Blouses, Ladies long dresses, Makhshi, and others. 
She plans to use her Rs 20000.00 loan to buy raw materials for her tailoring work. 
Mrs. Anju T. lives with her husband, two brothers-in-law and one sister-in-law. Her husband, Mr. Hari, went outside of the country for work.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for her tailoring work

loans.name: Marites

texts.en: A hardworking entrepreneur is Mrs. Marites L., 28 years old. She is married to Hilario L. now 43 years old. They have two children: Aizani and Jeniffer Flower. Marites is a vendor of street foods in their place. It is very helpful as she supports the education of her two children. With her greatest dream in life, which is to continue to send her children to school and someday become a successful entrepreneur, Marites patiently maintains her vending business. She is asking to borrow PHP 24,000 as additional working capital. She hopes to expand her business through the support of lenders.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Dev Kumari

texts.en:
Mrs. Dev Kumari M. lives in Kulashwor. She lives with her husband, one brother-in-law and one sister-in-law. A year ago her husband Mr. Ram M. went to Qatar to work. Her brother-in-law and sister-in-law are now studying in grade 12 and 11 respectively.
Mrs. M. opened her vegetable shop two years ago. She sells different types of vegetables in her shop. She buys vegetables from Kalimati market. She opened her vegetable shop to increase the living standard of her family.
Now Mrs. M. is requesting an Rs 20,000.00 loan to buy various types of vegetables like potatoes, tomatoes etc for her shop.

loans.use: To buy vegetables for her shop

loans.name: Pun Maiya

texts.en:
Pun Maiya M. lives in a single family in Patan. She has five members including herself in her family. She has two daughters and one son. Her older daughter has already got married and her younger daughter is studying in BBS level. Her son is working in a private office.

Both Mrs. M. and Mr. M. are farmers and they grow seasonal vegetables in her land due to lack modern tools and equipment. They especially grow green vegetables. They sell their vegetables in the local market in the morning and evening daily.

Now she is requesting a Rs 15000.00 loan to buy seeds and fertilizers for her farming work.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Warlita

texts.en: Warlita T. is engaged in a vending business. She retails cooked foods, different goods and vegetables. She is already a widow and being a single mom is not a hindrance to pursuing her vending business and being able to meet her family needs. Her husband already died 18 years ago. Warlita stands as mother and father for her children. She admitted it is not that easy but she remains tough and determined to serve as the family breadwinner. She wishes to continue her general store business someday, but temporarily, she is doing her best to improve the income from her vending business. This made her decide to ask for additional working capital amounting to PHP 15,000. She knows this is the only source of income she can do for now, but really is trying to do her best to expand for further sources of livelihood.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is about 33 years old and married to Jayson T., 32 years old, a farmer. They live in Bintacan Ilagan, Isabela and they are blessed with three children. Their eldest child is May, 10 years old. The second is Jaysalyn, 5 years old, and their youngest is Mark Everson, 1 year old. Evelyn does everything to become a successful entrepreneur for the welfare of her children in the future. 

Evelyn manages a store, an electronic load retailing business and a piggery business. She is requesting a loan amounting to PHP 4,000 to have additional working capital for her business. She also plans to extend her business to give her customer the best service they need. She hopes that she can acquire more capital so that her business will grow up. Evelyn’s main goal in life is to send her children to school until they finish their studies in college. She wants them to have a better life than what they have right now.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Aisha's Group

texts.en:
N. Aisha is a 50-year-old hard-working lady with a business of selling produce since 1980. She is a married lady with 5 children aged 22 – 11 years as well as caring for 2 dependants. She works so hard to ensure that all her children’s school fees are paid on time and mostly for the two eldest that are in the candidate classes.

Just like any other business, Aisha’s business is faced with seasonal changes, price fluctuations and the high transportation costs that affect her business but all in all she manages to succeed. This is Aisha’s ninth loan and the previous ones have always helped her in buying more produce for sale, as well as paying school fees. She is able to generate weekly profits of 50,000 shillings and she has a dream of educating all her children until she can spend the last penny since her future depends on them. This loan is so timely as the school term is soon beginning and she has a strong belief that it will be of great help. Aisha is the leader of Kibalinga Kyosimba Onanya group in Mubende.

loans.use: Buying produce and paying school fees for her children and dependants.

loans.name: Kamala

texts.en:
Kamala S. is the tailor in the town of Patan. She took six months of training for her tailoring work. She especially prefers to make traditional ladies' dresses, such as kurta-sulwal, a blouse which is very popular among Nepalese women. She is requesting a loan of Rs 15000.00 to buy raw materials for her tailoring work, such as cloth, cutting machines etc.

Mrs. Kamala S. lives in a single family with one son. A few months ago, her husband Mr. Gyan Das S. died, so she has to take sole responsibility for the family and her son.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for her tailoring work

loans.name: Franie

texts.en:
Franie is 25 years old, married and employed at JL Marketing as a repair man. He is also in the hog raising business to generate additional income. Since, he was 18 years old, Franie has worked to help his family until he married Danica (21). They have two children Ashnor Dan and Aziekeil who are his inspiration to work hard for their future. His family resides in Bintacan, Ilagan, Isabela.

Franie is planning to purchase piglets to raise to develop his business. He knows that it could help his family with their daily financial needs. He hopes that he could avail a loan of PHP4,000 to purchase at least two piglets. Franie is a very responsible man. According to him, he can manage his piggery business before and after his other work.

loans.use: Purchase two piglets.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita, 33, is married to Rufino Tayaban who works as farm laborer in their village. They live in Barangay Bintacan Ilagan, Isabela. They are blessed with three kids, the eldest is 12 years old. Next is Moona Marie, 10, and Rufino, 8.

Lolita manages a little village store situated in front of their house. She is requesting a loan of PHP4,000 to grow and expand her business. She needs working capital to purchase more groceries to increase her daily income. She hopes she could save money because her children need financial support as they grow older and enroll in a higher level of education.

Lolita hopes that by her diligent work, she can send her children to college. As a mother, she wants to give them a good future through God’s grace and perseverance, to become successful someday.

loans.use: Buy groceries.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is just 20 years old and is married to a farmer. They live in the mountainous village of Batong Labang (Bintacan) Ilagan, Isabela. She was just married two years ago and doesn’t have children. Maricel hopes that she will have children, just like her married friends.

Maricel runs a general store. She wanted to give a good future to her children someday. Maricel is requesting a loan of PHP4,000 for working capital for her business. She will buy more stock. According to her, she must redouble her patience or be hardworking to achieve her dreams in life. Maricel wants to have a successful life someday and she hopes that God will always be there for her.

loans.use: Buy items for her store.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is a native of Batong Labang, now called Barangay Bintacan of Ilagan, Isabela. She is 21 years old and single. She is employed in a repair shop in their village but her salary from this work is minimal - so she has engaged herself in an electronic loading (of mobile phone call credits) business for additional income. From this business, she is able to generate an income amounting to PHP 2,400 a month and she considers it a great source of income that really helps her family and in providing school allowance for her younger siblings.  

She hopes that her business continues to grow. According to her, it is better to give than to receive, because it makes her happier to see her family satisfied in their life with her help. And she believes that with every good thing you do, it always comes back to you.

loans.use: To gain business capital

loans.name: Elenor

texts.en:
Elenor T. lives in Barangay Buag Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya, where she is happily married to Raymond T. and the mother of two children. Because they want to give their children a better future by enabling them to achieve college educations, this couple works hard to improve their incomes.

Elenor’s husband drives a passenger jeepney (public transportation vehicle) while Elenor maintains a computer game business and is a direct seller of NATASHA, AVON, MSE and BOARD WALK products. She is now requesting a loan of PHP10,000 for additional working capital. Elenor is grateful for the opportunity of helping her husband with their daily basic needs and the education for their children.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
“Life is not a problem to be solved, but a gift to be enjoyed and experienced” is a simple quotation that Jocelyn G. shares. She believes that living life to the fullest will satisfy everyone’s daily existence - for life in earth is just temporary, she adds. For her, living life to the fullest means living with her family: thus, she works very hard for them. She is only 24 years old and happily married. She and her husband, Michael G., have two children.

By maintaining her street food-vending business, Jocelyn is able to help her husband afford their family a simple, contented standard of living. However, the couple works hard for the education of their two children, whom they hope to give a better future by sending them to school through college. Jocelyn has therefore requested a loan from Kiva lenders as capital assistance for managing her business well in order to earn a higher income. She is taking out a small loan in the amount of PHP 5,0000.

Jocelyn wants to expand her business and earn a higher daily income by operating a typical village store business where she can display her street food items and vegetables for sale.

loans.use: To expand her food-vending business

loans.name: Celia

texts.en:
Celia is venturing into a little eatery business in her village at Barangay Gadu Solana, Cagayan. She is 47 years old and is trying her best to earn a better livelihood. She is married to Ernesto Gunsa,t who is a Barangay councilor in their village. They are blessed with three children. Their eldest daughter, Christine Mae, is 21 years old and in her fifth year in college, studying A.B. legal management. Cherry Ann, 19 years old, is in her third year of college and is a business administration student. Christopher is 16 years old and is now in his first year of college, taking up education. Celia and her husband struggle to earn enough income to support the college education of their three children.

With her small village eatery business, Celia is thankful that she is able to earn a daily income. She has even expanded her offerings to include cooked snacks, such banana cue, “pansit,” and rice cakes. These additional products help her to increase her income. She is thankful that her husband is also doing his best to provide for many of their needs at home, especially in terms of their children’s tuition fees.

She hopes that Kiva lenders will soon lend her the amount she has recently requested, a loan amounting to PHP 10,000. She intends to utilize these funds to further improve her eatery business.

loans.use: To improve her eatery business

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.en:
Esmeralda, at only 57 years old, is already a widow. She has five children. Evangeline is 33 years old and a high school graduate. Editha is 32 years old and also a high school graduate, presently working as housemaid. Estanislao is 30 years old: he is a college graduate but presently working as a vendor. Esmerita is 25 years old and a high school graduate. Eva Charlotte is 22 years old is also a college graduate - while seeking a good job opportunity, she has chosen to manage the family's little farm lot.

Esmeralda is requesting a loan amounting to PHP 18,000 for her vegetable-vending business. She means to purchase additional supplies of items, such as 10 kilos of mangoes, a volume of milkfish, pork, and other items to meet the needs of her customers.

She hopes to improve her business and become successful someday.

loans.use: To purchase additonal vegetables for her vending business

loans.name: Zahra Group

texts.en:
Zahra is the group leader of Zahra group which has four members. Each of them wants to take a loan for expanding his or her business.

Zahra wants to take a loan for her tailoring business.

Jameila wants to take a loan for her husband who has a shoe shop.

Faruema wants to take a loan for her beauty salon.

Muhammad Harf wants to take a loan for his dry-fruit shop.

They are requested a group loan 56,000 Afghani. And they are made happy by this process of loans in Afghanistan.

loans.use: To expanding her tailoring business

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.en:
Felicidad operates a typical village store business at her place in Barangay Gadu (Solana, Cagayan). She is 43 years old and married to Francisco R., who works as house carpenter in their village and sometimes is hired to work on farms as a laborer in nearby villages. Since her husband is just waiting for job calls, Felicidad strives hard to improve her store and learn not to depend on her husband's income to surpass life's difficulties. She hopes that lenders will lend her additional working capital for her business amounting to PHP12, 000.

Felicidad has four children. Francisco R. Jr. is an 18-year-old, third-year college student. Frederick, 17, is a high-school graduate. Felimar is 11 and in the first year of high school already, while Felicity is 6 years old and in grade school. According to Felicidad, her current family situation is happy and she strives for a better future.

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Nazia Muhammad Pervaiz Group

texts.en:
Nazia-baji is the wife of M. P. and lives in a historical city of Lahore named Yadgar, Pakistan. She is the group leader for this loan. Her group members are very happy with her supportive behavior. She is also much respected by her family, who are proud to have her in their lives. Her husband runs a grocery shop in the community. He has been in this business for the past five years. Nazia-baji is applying for a loan to buy groceries for her husband's grocery shop.

Lado-baji and Zakia-baji are both members of this loan group. Lado-baji wants a loan to buy flowers to sell, and Zakia-baji wants a loan to buy cement to sell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy groceries for her husband's grocery shop business

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou Macasaddu is 46 years old. Her family lives in the rural village of Gadu Solana, Cagayan. She is married to Edmundo Macasaddu, who is a local farmer in their village. They are blessed with a happy family and hope to provide all their four children with a better education someday.

Marilou manages a vending business where she sells different vegetables, street foods, and canned goods from her vending stall just in front of their house. The business has been in operation for 20 years and she is proud that her long-term business venture has helped her family significantly.

She works hard to help her husband. She gets up in the early morning to prepare her store and goes to the market to buy products in bulk. She has gained a lot of clients and is earning a better profit. But Marilou still needs to save for the college education of her four children, and thus she feels the need to increase her daily income. She would like to take out a loan amounting to PHP 17,000. She hopes to further develop her business into a mini-grocery store someday.

Marilou believes that by working hard and having patience, she will maintain her business, which will enable her to achieve all her goals in life.

loans.use: To expand her vending business

loans.name: Aqsa Muhammad Imran Group

texts.en:
Nasreen baji wants a loan to buy beams for her shuttering business. Another Nasreen baji wants a loan to buy wood to sell. Fatima baji wants a loan to buy thread to sell.

Aqsa baji is the group leader of these above mentioned ladies. They all lives in the historic city in Lahore named Yadgar, Pakistan. Aqsa baji is married to M. I. who runs a cosmetics selling business. He buys cosmetics from the famous market of Lahore city named "Shahalmi" at wholesale and sells to the cosmetics shops to earn an income.

Aqsa baji also runs a cloth selling business to share the financial burden with her husband. She is applying for a loan to buy cosmetics to expand her husband's cosmetics selling business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics for resale

loans.name: Shirly

texts.en: Shirly M. wants to borrow a loan from the lenders amounting to PHP15,000. She manages a hog-raising business and is thankful for having the business because it helps her family a lot. She is already 38 years old and is a resident of Barangay Gadu Solana Cagayan. She has four children. Two of them attend school while two are still not qualified to enroll. She is married to Edgar, 41 years old, who has a business buying and selling animals. They help each other make both businesses successful for the welfare of their family.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Claudia

texts.en: Claudia T. is already 40 years old. She is a simple resident of Barangay Ubong Solana, Cagayan. The place is a rural village and farming is the main livelihood of most of the people. She is married to Severino T. Jr. who works as a driver of a passenger jeep and, at the same time, maintains a farming business. They are blessed with a happy family and hope to provide all their three children with a better education. While managing her store, Claudia keeps doing her household activities. From 6am till 9pm, her store is open for customers to buy.  Because she wants her business to grow and earn a higher income for her children’s education. Claudia is requesting a loan from lenders of PHP 23,000. She hopes her business will become productive in the future.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine manages a vegetable and fruit vending business in her village. She is hoping to grow her business. That is why she wants to borrow a loan amounting to PHP 13,000. She wants to buy vegetables and fruits in bulk so that she will able to generate a higher income and save time buying the products repeatedly because of lack of capital to buy once a week. She is already 44 years old and is married to Junicio R.. Their two children are already finished their studying, having attained college and a vocational course. Josephine is working hard doing her best to help her husband support their farming business. Their children are already married and live separately from them.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria D. is engaged in managing a general store business. She lives in the simple village of Ubong Solana, Cagayan. She has four children. Chrismelet, 21 years old and a high school graduate, is now married. Jonalyn, 19 years old, is also a high school graduate. Maryrose, 17, graduated from high school and Marinela, 10, is in grade school. 

Maria wants to borrow a loan amounting to PHP 23000. She will utilize the amount to purchase added grocery products to sell in her store like soft drinks, some snacks or breads, basic kitchen commodities and many more. According to her, she is able to earn a daily net income of PHP 300. It is a great help to provide her family's basic needs. Her husband, Pomelo D., is a farmer. He patiently tills their little parcel of farm lot to have a harvest. Somehow, said Maria, with the financial support of KIVA lenders, she may able to improve her business more, support the education of her youngest child and even repair their house.

loans.use: To purchase more items to sell

loans.name: Tasleem Muhammad Ashiq Group

texts.en:
Najma baji wants a loan to buy material (lentils, cooking oil and spices) for her food-selling business. Rani baji wants a loan to buy wood for her furniture-making business. Hina baji and Nusrat baji each want a loan to buy clothes for their clothes-selling businesses.

Tasleem baji is the wife of M. A. and they live in a historical part of the city of Lahore named Yadgar, Pakistan. She is the group leader of above mentioned ladies. Her husband runs a clothes-selling business. He buys clothes from the famous markets of Lahore (Ichara and Anarkali) and resells to clothes shops to earn income. Tasleem baji is applying for a loan to buy clothes to increase the profits of her husband's business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Zalmi

texts.en:
The man pictured here is Zalmi, the son of A. R.. He lives in the eighth district of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married and has many responsibilities towards his family members.

The house in which he and his nine family members live is very small and needs repairs. He knows he must make these repairs to his home but he could not afford the expenses. When he heard that the microloan process exists in Afghanistan and that through AFS he can obtain a loan, he became very happy. He is now requesting a loan in the amount of $50,000 Afghani to buy the required construction materials for his house repairs.

He would like to say that this is a truly effective way to support people in need.

loans.use: To buy construction materials

loans.name: Mohammad Kazem

texts.en:
M. Kazem is the son of M. A.. He lives in 8th district of Kabul, Afghanistan. He lives in a family of seven members and all of them benefit from the income he generates through his business.

He has a carpentry business and works hard in order to earn more money. He has a desire to be the most popular carpenter and to make all kinds of wooden equipment. He would like to take a loan of 50,000 Afghani to progress and make his life better.

loans.use: To buy required materials for his carpentry business

loans.name: Mohammad Sohrab

texts.en:
M. Sohrab is the son of F. M.. He lives in Bagrami, Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married and has four children, and he is responsible for the payment of their school fees and expenses. This is what motivates him to get up early every morning and go to his workshop to start his work he has a workshop of type video television repairs which he started this business 10 years ago he has some good numbers of customers but he need to increase his business . He is a very hardworking man and he is confident that his business will progress.

He wants to expand his business, so he has requested an individual loan of $30,000 Afghani. 

He genuinely admires the microloan process.

loans.use: To expand his businesss

loans.name: Mohammad Dahood

texts.en:
The man who is pictured is M. Dahood the son of M. H.. He lives in district 8 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married with five children.

He works in the Afghan army and the salary he takes monthly is not enough for both household expenses and house repairs. So he has requested an individual loan of 50,000 Afghani to purchase the required materials to repair his house.

He would like to thank both AFS and the Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials to repair his house

loans.name: Rahmatullah

texts.en:
The man who is pictured is Rahmatullah the son of H.. He lives in Bagrami, Kabul, Afghanistan. He is 50 and has 25 years of experience in agriculture.

He would like to progress and bring some new changes to his business. He has requested an individual loan of 50,000 Afghani to purchase more seeds and tools for farming.

He is happy that through these effective processes the entrepreneurs can solve their problems and can develop their businesses as well.

loans.use: To purchase more seeds and tools

loans.name: Salahudin

texts.en:
The man in this picture is Salahudin, the son of M. R.. He lives in the ninth district of Kabul, Afghanistan. He would like to repair his house and needs money to buy the required construction materials for the repairs, so he has requested an individual loan of $50,000.

He is really glad for this assistance and would like to say that these microloan processes truly support the poor people of Afghanistan.

loans.use: To buy construction materials for essential home repairs

loans.name: Omara Khan

texts.en:
Omara Khan is the son of A. A.. He lives in district 9 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is a young man of 30 and is still single. He is very hardworking and feels responsible towards his parents.

He has the business of painting cars. He owns a shop where he has all the equipment for his business. He has painted cars since 1999 and has full experience in the business. He would like to receive an individual loan of 50,000 Afghani to progress and expand his business.

loans.use: To buy more materials for his business

loans.name: Nidal

texts.en:
Nidal M. is 37 years old. He is married with three children. His wife looks after the house and the children, and Nidal supports his family by breeding cattle, which he sells for meat.

Cattle-breeding is the main source of income for the family and generates the income needed to allow Nidal to support his family and improve their living conditions.

Nidal is requesting a loan of $1,000 so that he can buy two calves and cattle fodder.

loans.use: To buy two calves and cattle fodder.

loans.name: Abraão Guimarães

texts.pt:
Abraão Guimarães T. é natural de CaT. um distrito urbano da cidade de Maputo, tem 52 anos de idade, casado. Apenas sustenta três crianças e são estudantes são seus filhos menores.

Abraão estudou até 12ªclasse e parou por falta de capacidade financeira para custear as despesas uma vez que até ao seu casamento só tinha feito 4ªclasse e pois este voltou a estudar cursos nocturnos até este nível, com os filhos a estudar as capacidades fora superadas pelas necessidades e dai deixou de estudar dando prioridade aos filhos.

Abraao solicita empréstimo pela segunda vez na Hluvuku e primeira no Kiva com qual pretende comprar material de construção, abara é docente a mais de 20 anos, tendo salário mensal de 6000,00mt.
texts.en:
Abraão Guimarães T. is a native of CaT., an urban district in the city of Maputo. He is 52 years old and married. He supports only his three children, and his younger children are in school.

Abraão studied through 12th grade and stopped due to lack of financial resources to pay for expenses. Before his marriage, he had only completed 4th grade, and afterwards he attended night school through this level. With his children in school, resources were overcome by other needs and he stopped studying, giving priority to his children.

Abraão is requesting a loan for the second time from Hluvuku, and for the first time from Kiva. He plans to buy construction material. He has been a teacher for over 20 years with a monthly salary of 6000 meticais.

Translated from Portuguese by N Aviva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction material

loans.name: Cristencia

texts.pt:
Cristencia C. é natural de Xai-xai distrito capital da província de Gaza, tem 37 anos de idade, casada maritalmente e mãe de 6 filhos, o primeiro tem 18 anos e os últimos que são gémeos tem 9 meses de idade respectivamente. Alem dos filhos sustenta a sua mãe enviando periodicamente dinheiro ou géneros alimentícios.

Cristencia estudou 5ªclasse e parou por falta de condições. Cristencia mudou da província de Gaza para Maputo quando se casou a 12 anos atrás, neste momento vive no distrito de Boane,  gestora de um negocio e dona do mesmo tendo um estabelecimento comercial qual abra as 7h e fecha as 18h deste negocio tem um rendimento mensla de 6000,00mt.

Cristencia solicita empréstimo pela segunda vez na Hluvuku e primeira no Kiva, com qual pretende auementar o seu estoque, futuramente pretende solicitar outro empréstimo para ter mais estabelecimentos.
texts.en:
Cristencia C. is a native of the Xai-xai capital district in Gaza Province. She is 37 years old, married and mother of 6 children. The first is 18 years old and the youngest are 9-month-old twins. In addition to her children, she supports her mother by sending her money or food items periodically.

Cristencia attended school through the 5th grade and stopped due to financial circumstances. She moved from Gaza Province to Maputo when she got married 12 years ago. At this time, she lives in the Boane district, managing a business that she owns. It is a commercial establishment which opens at 7 am and closes at 6 pm. She has monthly revenue from this business of 6000 meticais.

Cristencia is requesting a loan for the second time from Hluvuku and the first from Kiva, and she plans to use it to increase her stock. In the future, she plans to request another loan to have more stores.

Translated from Portuguese by N Aviva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy and sell various products

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel S. is 46 years old. He is married and has six children: three daughters and three sons. He lives with his wife and children in a rented apartment in a town called Kofiase. Kofiase is a farming/trading community near Dormaa, the district capital, in the Brong Ahafo region. Samuel says his children are currently in junior high and primary school. His wife is a farmer.

Samuel is a commercial driver. He drives a taxi cab. He conveys goods and people to and from his community and other nearby communities. He works from morning to evening. He says his car, which is his only source of income, is virtually broken down and so he wants a loan to have it repaired and maintained. Samuel has been driving more than 15 years. Samuel is hoping to maintain the car and improve his standard of living. He is also hoping to give his children a sound education.

loans.use: To repair vehicle

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce A. is fifty – two years old. She is divorced and mother of six children. According to her, two of them are currently in the senior high school while the others are in the junior high and the primary schools. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a town called Dorma. Dorma is a farming/trading community, the district capital, in the Brong Ahafo region.
Joyce is a trader. She trades in vegetables – onions, tomatoes, pepper, garden eggs, etc. She sells on a table top in the market square. She procures her vegetables from farmers in the nearby communities at cost effective prices. Joyce has been in business for three years and wants a loan to procure vegetables in bulk. She is hopeful to expand her business and give her children the best of education she can afford.

loans.use: To procure vegetables.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David S. is 25 years old and married with three children, two sons and a daughter. According to him, the first two are in primary school and the last one has yet to start school. He lives with his wife and children in a rented apartment in a town called Kofiase. Kofiase is a farming/trading community near Dormaa, the district capital, in the Brong Ahafo region. His wife is a food vendor.

David is a trader. He runs a provisions store in his community. He procures his products from Dormaa. David has been in business for two years and wants a loan to procure provisions in bulk. He is hoping to expand his business and give his children the best education he can afford.

loans.use: To procure provisions

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy Y. is thirty-eight years old. She is married with five children, one daughter and four sons. She says her children are currently in junior high or primary school. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in Kofiase. Kofiase is a farming and trading community near Dormaa, the district capital in the Brong Ahafo region.

Mercy trades in smoked fish. She procures it from Dormaa and sells in the local market on a table top. She also treks to other towns to sell and trades in vegetables.

Mercy has been in business for two years and wants a loan to procure smoked fish in bulk. She is hopeful that she can expand her business and give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To procure smoked fish in bulk.

loans.name: Augustina

texts.en:
Augustina S. is thirty-three years old. She is married with three children, one daughter and two sons. She says her children are currently in either junior high or primary school. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in Kofiase. Kofiase is a farming and trading community near Dormaa, the district capital, in the Brong Ahafo region. Her husband is a teacher by profession.

Augustina trades in smoked fish. She procures smoked fish from Dormaa and sells in the local market on a table top. She also treks to other towns to sell. Augustina has been in business for two years and wants a loan to procure smoked fish in bulk. She is hopeful that she will expand her business and give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To procure smoked fish in bulk.

loans.name: Fidelia

texts.en:
Fidelia A. is twenty-five years old. She is married and has given birth to three children, two sons and a daughter. According to her, her first two children are in the primary school and her last one is yet to start school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a town called Kofiase. Kofiase is a farming and trading community near Dormaa, the district capital, in the Brong Ahafo region.

Fidelia and her husband are both traders. She trades in utensils, hawking to sell her products in the community in which she lives. Fidelia also treks to other towns to sell on their market days. She procures her goods from Dormaa. She has been in business for two years and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk. She is hopeful that she will expand her business and give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To buy utensils in bulk for resale.

loans.name: Kosar

texts.en:
Kosar baji is the wife of Mr. Z.. They have been living in Yadgar, a historical place near the city of Lahore, Pakistan, for ten years. Kosar baji and her husband run a cloth selling business. He sells clothing in different shops and Kosar baji sells them in the community. Both earn a good income from this business. They buy clothes from their native city of Lahore. They have had their business for five years.

Kosar baji is applying for a loan to buy more clothes to expand their business.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys A. is thirty-five years old. She is divorced and has given birth to five children, three sons and two daughters. According to her, her children are either in primary and junior high school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a town called Kofiase. Kofiase is a farming and trading community near Dormaa, the district capital, in the Brong Ahafo region.

Gladys is a trader. She runs a provision store in her community. She procures her products from Dormaa. She says her store is by the road side. Gladys has been in business for eight years and wants a loan to procure provisions in bulk to increase her stock. She is hopeful that she will expand her business and give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To procure provisions for her store.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia P., 35 years old, is married with six children. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a town called Kofiase, a farming and trading community near Dormaa, the district capital, in the Brong Ahafo region. Cecilia says her children all attend the the junior high and the primary school.

Cecilia's husband is a farmer and she herself is a trader. She runs a cold store in her community. Cecilia says her cold store is located at the market square. She sells fresh fish and meats such as beef, chicken, and turkey. Cecilia has been in business for eight years and would like to obtain a loan to procure goods in bulk so she can increase her stock.

She is hopeful about expanding her business and hopes to improve her family's standard of living. She hopes to give her children a sound education.

loans.use: To procure fresh fish and meat for sale

loans.name: Emilia

texts.en:
Emilia F. is a 29-year-old married mother of three children, one son and two daughters, all of whom are in primary school. She lives with her family in a house in the town of Kofiase, a farming/trading community near Dormaa, the district capital, in the Brong Ahafo region.

Emilia's husband is a teacher by profession, and Emilia is a baker. She bakes bread and supplies most of it to retailers in her community. She also sells it on a table top in the market square. Emilia procures bags of flour and other ingredients from Dormaa. She has been in business for over eight years and wants a loan to purchase goods in bulk. She hopes to expand her business and give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To procure bags of flour

loans.name: Shohida

texts.ru: Шохида успешно проводит свою предпринимательскую деятельность. Раньше она торговала на непостоянном месте, а сейчас арендовала торговую точку на местном рынке. Капитал ее бизнеса возрос, и ассортимент увеличился в несколько раз. Сейчас она кроме детской одежды включила несколько видов мужской одежды. Это позволяет ей увеличить реализацию, а естественно и прибыль. Ее дети ходят в школу, а муж находится на заработках в России. Шохида просит займ для того, чтобы увеличить ассортимент детской одежды.
texts.en:
Shohida successfully runs her own business. In the past, she did not have a permanent sales location, but now she rents a trade outlet at the local market. Her working capital has grown, and the variety of goods she carries has increased several times over. In addition to children's clothing, she now includes several types of men's clothing. This has allowed her to increase her sales and, naturally, her profits. Her children attend school, and her husband is away working in Russia. Shohida is asking for a loan in order to expand the selection of children's clothing she carries.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory expansion

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace A. is a 40-year-old married mother of three children, one daughter and two sons, who are currently in senior high and junior high school. She lives with her family in a rented apartment in the town of Kofiase, a farming/trading community near Dormaa, the district capital, in the Brong Ahafo region. 

Grace's husband is a farmer and Grace is a trader in smoked fish. She procures smoked fish from Dormaa, and sells it in the local market on a table top. She also treks to other towns to sell. Grace has been in business for four years and wants a loan to buy assorted fishes in bulk. She hopes to expand her business and give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To procure smoked fish.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence Y. is a 42-year-old married mother of four children, one son and three daughters, who are currently in junior high and primary school. She lives with her family in a house in the town of Kofiase, a farming/trading community near Dormaa, the district capital, in the Brong Ahafo region. 

Florence's husband is a teacher by profession, and Florence is a food vendor. She prepares and sells kenkey, a food made from corn dough and served hot with ground pepper and fried fish. She prepares the food at home and hawks to sell in her community. Florence procures bags of maize from nearby communities. She has been in business for three years and wants a loan to purchase bags of maize in bulk. She hopes to expand her business and give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To procure bags of maize

loans.name: Akosua

texts.en:
Akosua N. is a 39-year-old married mother of five children. Her two sons and three daughters are currently in junior high and primary schools. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in the town of Kofiase, a farming/trading community near Dormaa, the district capital, in the Brong Ahafo region.

Akosua's husband is a farmer, and Akosua is a cereals trader. She procures bags of maize from farmers in nearby communities and sells in the local market to retailers. Akosua also treks to other towns to sell. She has been in business for 14 years and wants a loan to purchase bags of maize in bulk. She hopes to expand her business and give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
Doris G. is 41 years old, and is married with one daughter. Her daughter had a child and dropped out of school. Doris now lives with her daughter and grandchild in a rented apartment in the town of Kofiase, a farming/trading community near Dormaa, the district capital, in the Brong Ahafo region.

Doris' husband is a farmer and Doris is a cereals trader. She procures bags of maize from farmers in nearby communities and sells in the local market to retailers. She also treks to other towns to sell. She has been in business for ten years and wants a loan to procure bags of maize in bulk. She hopes to expand her business and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize

loans.name: Zenabu

texts.en:
Zenabu Y. is a 42-year-old married mother of four children, one son and three daughters. Her children are in junior high and primary schools. Zenabu lives with her family in a house in the town of Kofiase, a farming/trading community near Dormaa, the district capital, in the Brong Ahafo region.

Zenabu's husband is a farmer, and Zenabu is a food vendor. She prepares and sells kenkey, a food made from corn dough and served hot with ground pepper and fried fish. She prepares the food at home and hawks to sell in her community. Zenabu has been in business for two years and wants a loan to procure bags of maize, which she buys from nearby communities, in bulk. She hopes to expand her business and give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama S. is 70 years old, and is a widowed mother of seven children. Her daughter and six sons have all finished school – some are married and living independently. Ama lives with some of her grandchildren in a family house in the town of Kofiase, a farming/trading community near Dormaa, the district capital, in the Brong Ahafo region.

Ama is a cereals trader. She procures bags of maize from farmers in nearby communities and sells in the local market to retailers and food vendors. She also treks to other towns to sell. Ama also deals in pepper. She has been in business for over 15 years and wants a loan to procure bags of maize in bulk. She is hopeful to expand her business and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther A. is a 36-year-old married mother of five children, one son and four daughters. Some of her children are currently in junior high school while others are in primary school. Esther lives with her family in a rented apartment in the town of Kofiase, a farming/trading community near Dormaa, the district capital, in the Brong Ahafo region.

Esther's husband is a commercial driver, while Esther trades in vegetables – onions, tomatoes, peppers, garden eggs, etc. She procures her vegetables from farmers in nearby communities at cost-effective prices, and sells them on a table top in the market square. She also hawks to sell bread. She has been in business for four years and wants a loan to procure vegetables in bulk. Esther hopes to expand her business and give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To procure vegetables

loans.name: Martha

texts.en: Martha Y. is 19 years old and single. She lives with her mother in a rented apartment in the town of Kofiase, a farming/trading community near Dormaa, the district capital, in the Brong Ahafo region. Martha trades in eggs. She buys crates of eggs at affordable prices from poultry farms in her own and nearby communities. She sells in the local market, treks to other towns to sell, and distributes eggs to retailers and beverage sellers. She has been in business for five years and wants a loan to procure crates of eggs in bulk. She hopes to expand her business and make enough savings before she enters into marriage.

loans.use: To buy crates of eggs

loans.name: Fati

texts.en:
Fati Y. is a 40-year-old married mother of four children. Her son and three daughters are in junior high or primary school. She lives with her family in a rented apartment in the town of Kofiase, a farming/trading community near Dormaa, the district capital, in the Brong Ahafo region.

Fati's husband is a farmer, while Fati is a trader in second-hand textiles – womenswear. She procures bales of textiles from Dormaa, and hawks to sell in her community as well as trekking to other towns to sell. Fati has been in business for ten years and wants a loan to buy textiles in bulk. She hopes to expand her business and give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To buy second-hand textiles

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma F. is 30 years old and married with one daughter, who is currently in primary school. She lives with her daughter and husband in a rented apartment in the town of Kofiase, a farming/trading community near Dormaa, the district capital, in the Brong Ahafo region.

Emma's husband is a farmer, while Emma is a trader in local soap. She buys the raw materials, soda and palm oil, in Dormaa and prepares the soap herself. She supplies the soap to other local retailers, as well as hawking and trekking to other towns to sell. Emma has been in business for two years and wants a loan to expand her trade. She hopes to grow her business and give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To buy soda and oil

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice B. is the 35-year-old married mother of four children, two sons and two daughters, all currently attending primary school. She lives with her husband and children in a family house in Kofiase, a farming/trading community near Dormaa, the district capital, in the Brong Ahafo region. A trader in maize, Alice procures bags of it from farmers in nearby communities and sells to retailers and food vendors both in the local market and in other towns.  She has been in business for two years and is now requesting a loan to purchase maize in bulk, hoping to ultimately expand her business and give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize.

loans.name: Gloria Del Carmen

texts.es:
GLORIA DEL CARMEN R. V. DE LIMA, pertenece al Banco Comunal “LORETO” con domicilio en el Jr. LORETO N° 241, del distrito de Callería, tiene 35 años, 02 hijos, y su esposo es empleado público.

Tenía un negocio de venta de ropas y la primera vez obtuvo un préstamo de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, compro algunas prendas más y afianzo su negocio, pero por algunos inconvenientes que tuvo dejo por un tiempo el negocio y hoy se encuentra alquilando su moto taxis.

Hoy continùa con el negocio del alquiler de mototaxi y con el préstamo  de S/.1,200.00 Nuevos Soles,  invertirá en la compra de gaseosas y  repuestos, que son necesarios para que trabajen tranquilos, sin ningún inconveniente.

Gloria se siente realizada y contenta por que el negocio que actualmente viene ejerciendo, le ayuda a cubrir todas las necesidades de la casa.
texts.en:
GLORIA DEL CARMEN R. V. OF LIMA, belongs to the “LORETO” Community Bank. She lives at 241 LOTETO St., in the Callería district. She is 35 years old, has two children and her husband is a civil servant.

She had a business selling clothes and received a loan of 300.00 PEN the first time. She bought some more clothes and strengthened her business but had to leave it for a while due to some inconveniences she had. Today she rents her motorcycle taxi.

Today she continues with her business renting her motorcycle taxi. She will invest the loan for 1,200.00 PEN in the purchase of sodas and spare parts which are necessary to work without worrying about inconveniences.

Gloria feels fulfilled and happy because the business she is currently running helps cover all household necessities.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of sodas and spare parts for motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Camila

texts.es:
CAMILA B. S., pertenece al Banco comunal “LORETO” su domicilio está ubicado en el Jr comandante suares Nº 344, Distrito de Calleria, tiene 27 años, 2 hijos pequeños, y su esposo es también comerciante.

	El primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos fue de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, que invirtió en compra de algunos abarrotes, para surtir su pequeña bodega, y desde hace 2 años que está trabajando con Manuela Ramos.  Su negocio ha ido creciendo cada vez y por eso le ha sido necesario subir el monto de sus préstamos.

Con este préstamo  de S/.2,500.00 Nuevos Soles,  invertirá en ampliar su local y además comprar 1 paquete de tallarines, 1 caja de atún y 1 caja de leche para surtir su tienda.

Agradece a Manuela Ramos, por ser una institución que sirve a la comunidad con el servicio que da, y contribuye con las mujeres de esta región.
texts.en:
Camila B. S. belongs to the “LORETO” Communal Bank. Her home is located at Jr comandante suares Nº 344 in the Calleria District. She is 27 years old, has two small children and her husband is also a merchant.
She invested the first loan of S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles from Manuela Ramos in the purchase of various groceries to stock her little store. She has worked with Manuela Ramos for 2 years. Her business has kept growing such that it has been necessary to increase her loan amounts.
With this loan of S/.2,500.00 Nuevos Soles, she will expand her business and also purchase 1 pack of noodles, 1 case of tuna, and 1 case of milk to stock her store.
She thanks Manuela Ramos for being an organisation that serves the community and helps out the women of this region.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase noodles, tuna and milk.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
VICTORIA C. D. P., pertenece al Banco Comunal “LORETO” su negocio está ubicado en el Jr Oscar R. Benavides N°  989, Distrito D. Calleria, tiene 52 años, 1 hijo que esta trabajando, y su esposo es coadministrador del negocio.

	Ella  trabaja junto con su esposo, el primer préstamo que recibió D. Manuela Ramos fue D. S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual invirtió en la compra D. algunos abarrotes, para surtir su negocio, y desD. hace 9 años que está trabajando con Manuela Ramos. 

Con el pasar del tiempo han envejecido sus vitrinas, necesita cambiar y refaccionar algunas D. ellas, por lo que con el préstamo  D. S/.2,000.00 Nuevos Soles,  invertirá en comprar una vitrina nueva donD. exhibirá productos D. belleza por ello también comprara 1 caja D. cremas para cabello, 1 caja D. jabones y 3 bolsas D. detergentes.

Agradece a Manuela Ramos, por ser una institución que sirve a la comunidad con el servicio que da, y contribuye con las mujeres D. esta región.
texts.en:
Victoria C. D. P. belongs to the "Loreto" Communal Bank. Her business is located at Jr Oscar R. Benavides #989 in the district of Calleria. She is 52 years old, has one child who works, and her husband co-manages her business. She works alongsiD. her husband. The first loan she received from Manuela Ramos was for 300 soles, which she invested in various groceries to stock her business. She has been working with Manuela Ramos for nine years. Over time, her cabinets have aged, and some of them need to be replaced and repaired. With this loan of 2,000 soles, she will buy a new cabinet in which she will display beauty products. She will also buy a case of hair cream, a case of soaps and three bags of detergent. She gives thanks to Manuela Ramos for being an institution that serves the community, and that contributes to the women of this region.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a cabinet, creams, soaps and detergents
